exodus-28-7.text: Fix pieces of cloth on its two edges. These will go over the priest's shoulders to join the front and the back parts of the ephod.
exodus-28-7.korean: 그것에 어깨받이 둘을 달아 그 두 끝을 이어지게 하고

genesis-24-18.text: She replied, ‘Yes sir, please drink.’ She quickly took the pot down from her shoulders. She held the pot with her hands and gave him a drink.
genesis-24-18.korean: 그가 이르되 내 주여 마시소서 하며 급히 그 물동이를 손에 내려 마시게 하고

numbers-7-9.text: But the descendants of Kohath had to carry everything that was special on their shoulders. So Moses did not give any carts or oxen to the descendants of Kohath.
numbers-7-9.korean: 고핫 자손에게는 주지 아니하였으니 그들의 성소의 직임은 그 어깨로 메는 일을 하는 까닭이었더라

exodus-12-45.text: But if you pay him money for his work, he must not eat the food. A visitor also must not eat the food.

judges-13-21.text: The Lord's angel did not appear to them again. Manoah then realized that their visitor was the Lord's own angel.
judges-13-21.korean: 여호와의 사자가 마노아와 그의 아내에게 다시 나타나지 아니하니 마노아가 그제야 그가 여호와의 사자인 줄 알고

mark-6-22.text: The daughter of Herodias came in and she danced. Herod and his visitors were very happy when they saw her dance.
mark-6-22.korean: 헤로디아의 딸이 친히 들어와 춤을 추어 헤롯과 그와 함께 앉은 자들을 기쁘게 한지라 왕이 그 소녀에게 이르되 무엇이든지 네가 원하는 것을 내게 구하라 내가 주리라 하고

john-11-20.text: Martha heard the news that Jesus was coming. So she went out to meet him. But Mary stayed in the house with the visitors.
john-11-20.korean: 마르다는 예수께서 오신다는 말을 듣고 곧 나가 맞이하되 마리아는 집에 앉았더라

genesis-19-10.text: The two visitors who were inside the house opened the door. They pulled Lot back into his house and they shut the door quickly.
genesis-19-10.korean: 그 사람들이 손을 내밀어 롯을 집으로 끌어들이고 문을 닫고

proverbs-12-9.text: It is better to be a humble person who has a servant
proverbs-12-9.korean: 비천히 여김을 받을지라도 종을 부리는 자는 스스로 높은 체하고도 음식이 핍절한 자보다 나으니라

numbers-12-3.text: Moses was a very humble man. He was the most humble person in the whole world.
numbers-12-3.korean: 이 사람 모세는 온유함이 지면의 모든 사람보다 더하더라

daniel-5-22.text: King Belshazzar, you are Nebuchadnezzar's son, and you knew all that. But you did not become humble.
daniel-5-22.korean: 벨사살이여 왕은 그의 아들이 되어서 이것을 다 알고도 아직도 마음을 낮추지 아니하고

2-chronicles-12-6.text: The leaders of Israel and the king made themselves humble. They said, ‘The Lord is right to do that.’
2-chronicles-12-6.korean: 이에 이스라엘 방백들과 왕이 스스로 겸비하여 이르되 여호와는 의로우시다 하매

job-5-11.text: He gives honour to humble people. When people are suffering, he puts them in a safe place. He gives honour to humble people.
job-5-11.korean: 낮은 자를 높이 드시고 애곡하는 자를 일으키사 구원에 이르게 하시느니라

song-of-solomon-7-6.text: You are very beautiful, my dear friend,
song-of-solomon-7-6.korean: 사랑아 네가 어찌 그리 아름다운지, 어찌 그리 화창한지 즐겁게 하는구나

jeremiah-8-11.text: They tell my dear people that their wounds are not bad.
jeremiah-8-11.korean: 그들이 딸 내 백성의 상처를 가볍게 여기면서 말하기를 평강하다, 평강하다 하나 평강이 없도다

proverbs-31-2.text: Be careful, my dear son. God answered my prayers when I gave birth to you. Please listen carefully!
proverbs-31-2.korean: 내 아들아 내가 무엇을 말하랴 내 태에서 난 아들아 내가 무엇을 말하랴 서원대로 얻은 아들아 내가 무엇을 말하랴

2-john-1-5.text: So now, dear lady, I want you to do something. I want all of us to love one another. I am not telling you a new command to obey. This is a command that we have had from the beginning.
2-john-1-5.korean: 부녀여, 내가 이제 네게 구하노니 서로 사랑하자 이는 새 계명 같이 네게 쓰는 것이 아니요 처음부터 우리가 가진 것이라

philippians-4-1.text: My dear Christian friends, I love you very much. I want very much to see you again. You make me very happy. You show that my work among you had good results. Please continue to live in a way that pleases the Lord. This is what I have taught you to do.
philippians-4-1.korean: 그러므로 나의 사랑하고 사모하는 형제들, 나의 기쁨이요 면류관인 사랑하는 자들아 이와 같이 주 안에 서라

exodus-25-17.text: Use pure gold to make a lid for the box. Make the lid 1 metre long and 75 centimetres wide.
exodus-25-17.korean: 순금으로 속죄소를 만들되 길이는 두 규빗 반, 너비는 한 규빗 반이 되게 하고

jeremiah-52-21.text: Each pillar was 8 metres high and 5 metres around. The bronze was 8 centimetres thick and each pillar was empty inside.
jeremiah-52-21.korean: 그 기둥은 한 기둥의 높이가 십팔 규빗이요 그 둘레는 십이 규빗이며 그 속이 비었고 그 두께는 네 손가락 두께이며

1-kings-7-15.text: Hiram made two bronze pillars. Each pillar was 8.2 metres high and 5.5 metres around the outside. The metal itself was about 7 centimetres thick.
1-kings-7-15.korean: 그가 놋기둥 둘을 만들었으니 그 높이는 각각 십팔 규빗이라 각각 십이 규빗 되는 줄을 두를 만하며

ezekiel-40-43.text: They put the meat for the offerings on the stone tables. There were hooks all around the inside walls of the room. Each hook was 7½ centimetres long.
ezekiel-40-43.korean: 현관 안에는 길이가 손바닥 넓이만한 갈고리가 사방에 박혔으며 상들에는 희생제물의 고기가 있더라

2-chronicles-4-5.text: The bronze walls of the ‘Sea’ were 7½ centimetres thick. Its top edge was like a cup in the shape of a lily flower. The ‘Sea’ contained about 65,000 litres of water.
2-chronicles-4-5.korean: 바다의 두께는 한 손 너비만 하고 그 둘레는 잔 둘레와 같이 백합화의 모양으로 만들었으니 그 바다에는 삼천 밧을 담겠으며

matthew-14-25.text: Then, when it was nearly dawn, Jesus walked on the water towards his disciples.
matthew-14-25.korean: 밤 사경에 예수께서 바다 위로 걸어서 제자들에게 오시니

jonah-4-7.text: But at dawn the next day, God sent a worm to attack the plant. So then the plant died.
jonah-4-7.korean: 하나님이 벌레를 예비하사 이튿날 새벽에 그 박넝쿨을 갉아먹게 하시매 시드니라

genesis-32-24.text: Then Jacob was alone. A man came and fought with him for a long time. They continued until dawn.
genesis-32-24.korean: 야곱은 홀로 남았더니 어떤 사람이 날이 새도록 야곱과 씨름하다가

mark-16-2.text: They went out at dawn on the first day of the week, Sunday. They went to the hole in the rock where Joseph had put Jesus' dead body.
mark-16-2.korean: 안식 후 첫날 매우 일찍이 해 돋을 때에 그 무덤으로 가며

acts-5-21.text: The apostles did what the angel told them to do. At dawn they went into the yard of the temple. They began to teach the people there.
acts-5-21.korean: 그들이 듣고 새벽에 성전에 들어가서 가르치더니 대제사장과 그와 함께 있는 사람들이 와서 공회와 이스라엘 족속의 원로들을 다 모으고 사람을 옥에 보내어 사도들을 잡아오라 하니

acts-28-14.text: We found some believers there. They asked us to stay with them for one week. After this we travelled to Rome.
acts-28-14.korean: 거기서 형제들을 만나 그들의 청함을 받아 이레를 함께 머무니라 그래서 우리는 이와 같이 로마로 가니라

genesis-29-28.text: So Jacob did what Laban said. He finished the marriage week with Leah. Then Laban gave Rachel to Jacob to be his wife.
genesis-29-28.korean: 야곱이 그대로 하여 그 칠 일을 채우매 라반이 딸 라헬도 그에게 아내로 주고

leviticus-23-15.text: On the day after the Sabbath day the people will sacrifice their gifts to God. After this, they must count seven weeks.
leviticus-23-15.korean: 안식일 이튿날 곧 너희가 요제로 곡식단을 가져온 날부터 세어서 일곱 안식일의 수효를 채우고

exodus-34-22.text: Eat the Feast of Weeks every year when you cut the first wheat in your fields. Eat the Feast of Harvest at the end of each year.
exodus-34-22.korean: 칠칠절 곧 맥추의 초실절을 지키고 세말에는 수장절을 지키라

luke-2-43.text: When the week finished, Mary and Joseph left Jerusalem to return home. But Jesus stayed behind and his parents did not know this.
luke-2-43.korean: 그 날들을 마치고 돌아갈 때에 아이 예수는 예루살렘에 머무셨더라 그 부모는 이를 알지 못하고

1-chronicles-2-14.text: His fourth son was Nethanel and his fifth son was Raddai.

leviticus-27-31.text: If a person buys back any of his gift, he must pay the price and one fifth more.
leviticus-27-31.korean: 또 만일 어떤 사람이 그의 십일조를 무르려면 그것에 오분의 일을 더할 것이요

1-kings-14-25.text: In the fifth year that Rehoboam was king, King Shishak of Egypt attacked Jerusalem.
1-kings-14-25.korean: 르호보암 왕 제오년에 애굽의 왕 시삭이 올라와서 예루살렘을 치고

genesis-30-17.text: God listened to Leah and she became pregnant again. She gave birth to a fifth son for Jacob.
genesis-30-17.korean: 하나님이 레아의 소원을 들으셨으므로 그가 임신하여 다섯째 아들을 야곱에게 낳은지라

nehemiah-6-5.text: Then Sanballat sent his officer to me with a fifth message. He carried a letter that was open for anyone to read.
nehemiah-6-5.korean: 산발랏이 다섯 번째는 그 종자의 손에 봉하지 않은 편지를 들려 내게 보냈는데

exodus-34-33.text: When Moses had finished speaking to the people, he covered his face with a thin cloth.
exodus-34-33.korean: 모세가 그들에게 말하기를 마치고 수건으로 자기 얼굴을 가렸더라

ezekiel-34-20.text: So this is what I, the Almighty Lord, say to the sheep: I myself will judge between the fat sheep and the thin sheep.
ezekiel-34-20.korean: 그러므로 주 여호와께서 그들에게 이같이 말씀하시되 나 곧 내가 살진 양과 파리한 양 사이에서 심판하리라

genesis-41-7.text: Then the groups of thin grains ate the seven groups of grains that were good and fat. Then Pharaoh woke up. He realized that it was a dream.
genesis-41-7.korean: 그 가는 일곱 이삭이 무성하고 충실한 일곱 이삭을 삼킨지라 바로가 깬즉 꿈이라

job-17-7.text: I have cried so much that my eyes have become weak. My body is so thin that I am like a shadow. I have cried so much that my eyes have become weak.
job-17-7.korean: 내 눈은 근심 때문에 어두워지고 나의 온 지체는 그림자 같구나

1-kings-6-32.text: The wooden doors had pictures of cherubs, palm trees and flowers. Solomon covered the pictures of the cherubs and the palm trees with very thin gold.
1-kings-6-32.korean: 감람나무로 만든 그 두 문짝에 그룹과 종려와 핀 꽃을 아로새기고 금으로 입히되 곧 그룹들과 종려에 금으로 입혔더라

mark-3-17.text: James and John who were the sons of Zebedee. Jesus called them ‘Boanerges’. It means ‘men who are like thunder ’.
mark-3-17.korean: 또 세베대의 아들 야고보와 야고보의 형제 요한이니 이 둘에게는 보아너게 곧 우레의 아들이란 이름을 더하셨으며

1-samuel-12-18.text: Samuel prayed to the Lord. That same day the Lord sent thunder and rain. All the people became afraid of the Lord and of Samuel.
1-samuel-12-18.korean: 이에 사무엘이 여호와께 아뢰매 여호와께서 그 날에 우레와 비를 보내시니 모든 백성이 여호와와 사무엘을 크게 두려워하니라

revelation-10-3.text: Then he shouted with a loud voice, like a lion that roars. When he shouted, seven loud voices answered him. They were like the noise of thunder.
revelation-10-3.korean: 사자가 부르짖는 것 같이 큰 소리로 외치니 그가 외칠 때에 일곱 우레가 그 소리를 내어 말하더라

ezekiel-3-12.text: Then a spirit lifted me up. I heard a loud noise like thunder behind me. It was the sound of the Lord's great glory as it rose up from its place!
ezekiel-3-12.korean: 때에 주의 영이 나를 들어올리시는데 내가 내 뒤에서 크게 울리는 소리를 들으니 찬송할지어다 여호와의 영광이 그의 처소로부터 나오는도다 하니

exodus-9-28.text: The storms with the thunder and the hail are too much for us! Pray to the Lord to take them away. Then I will let you go! You do not need to stay any longer in Egypt.’
exodus-9-28.korean: 여호와께 구하여 이 우렛소리와 우박을 그만 그치게 하라 내가 너희를 보내리니 너희가 다시는 머물지 아니하리라

isaiah-54-8.text: For a moment I became very angry with you,
isaiah-54-8.korean: 내가 넘치는 진노로 내 얼굴을 네게서 잠시 가렸으나 영원한 자비로 너를 긍휼히 여기리라 네 구속자 여호와께서 말씀하셨느니라

matthew-26-16.text: Judas then waited for the right moment to help them to take hold of Jesus.
matthew-26-16.korean: 그가 그 때부터 예수를 넘겨 줄 기회를 찾더라

luke-2-13.text: At that moment, a great crowd of angels appeared. They were praising God. They said:
luke-2-13.korean: 홀연히 수많은 천군이 그 천사들과 함께 하나님을 찬송하여 이르되

acts-11-11.text: At that moment, three men from Caesarea arrived at the house where I was staying. Someone had sent these men to find me.
acts-11-11.korean: 마침 세 사람이 내가 유숙한 집 앞에 서 있으니 가이사랴에서 내게로 보낸 사람이라

mark-9-8.text: At that moment, the three disciples looked around. They saw that nobody else was there now. Only Jesus was there with them.
mark-9-8.korean: 문득 둘러보니 아무도 보이지 아니하고 오직 예수와 자기들뿐이었더라

galatians-3-25.text: But now that the way of faith in Christ has come, we do not need God's Law to keep us safe any longer.
galatians-3-25.korean: 믿음이 온 후로는 우리가 초등교사 아래에 있지 아니하도다

james-2-20.text: You fool! If someone's faith does not lead them to do good things, it is not worth anything. You should know that!
james-2-20.korean: 아아 허탄한 사람아 행함이 없는 믿음이 헛것인 줄을 알고자 하느냐

hebrews-11-30.text: Because of their faith, Israel's people marched round Jericho city for seven days. Then the city's walls fell down.
hebrews-11-30.korean: 믿음으로 칠 일 동안 여리고를 도니 성이 무너졌으며

habakkuk-2-4.text: Look now! The enemy is very proud. They do not want to do what is right. But righteous people will live because of their faith in God.
habakkuk-2-4.korean: 보라 그의 마음은 교만하며 그 속에서 정직하지 못하나 의인은 그의 믿음으로 말미암아 살리라

1-timothy-3-13.text: If a deacon serves God's people well, then people will respect him as a good person. He will become strong to tell people about his faith in Christ Jesus.
1-timothy-3-13.korean: 집사의 직분을 잘한 자들은 아름다운 지위와 그리스도 예수 안에 있는 믿음에 큰 담력을 얻느니라

joshua-14-15.text: (Before that, Hebron had been called ‘Kiriath Arba’. Arba was a famous Anakite.)
joshua-14-15.korean: 헤브론의 옛 이름은 기럇 아르바라 아르바는 아낙 사람 가운데에서 가장 큰 사람이었더라 그리고 그 땅에 전쟁이 그쳤더라

2-samuel-23-22.text: Those were some things that Jehoiada's son Benaiah did. He became as famous as the ‘Three Brave Soldiers’.
2-samuel-23-22.korean: 여호야다의 아들 브나야가 이런 일을 행하였으므로 세 용사 중에 이름을 얻고

1-chronicles-11-24.text: Those were some things that Jehoiada's son Benaiah did. He became as famous as the ‘Three Brave Soldiers’.
1-chronicles-11-24.korean: 여호야다의 아들 브나야가 이런 일을 행하였으므로 세 용사 중에 이름을 얻고

numbers-22-17.text: I will certainly make you rich and famous. I will do for you anything that you want. So please come and curse these people for me.” ’
numbers-22-17.korean: 내가 그대를 높여 크게 존귀하게 하고 그대가 내게 말하는 것은 무엇이든지 시행하리니 청하건대 와서 나를 위하여 이 백성을 저주하라 하시더이다

isaiah-23-9.text: The Lord Almighty did that! He decided to show that the pride of those people is useless. He decided to bring all those famous people down low.
isaiah-23-9.korean: 만군의 여호와께서 그것을 정하신 것이라 모든 누리던 영화를 욕되게 하시며 세상의 모든 교만하던 자가 멸시를 받게 하려 하심이라

matthew-7-26.text: Other people listen to my message but they do not obey it. Those people are like a fool who built his house on sand.
matthew-7-26.korean: 나의 이 말을 듣고 행하지 아니하는 자는 그 집을 모래 위에 지은 어리석은 사람 같으리니

1-kings-4-29.text: God gave Solomon wisdom so that he understood things well. He knew about everything, more things than there is sand on the shore of the sea!
1-kings-4-29.korean: 하나님이 솔로몬에게 지혜와 총명을 심히 많이 주시고 또 넓은 마음을 주시되 바닷가의 모래 같이 하시니

job-27-16.text: Wicked people may have lots of money. They may have silver like heaps of sand. They may have more clothes than they could ever wear. Wicked people may have lots of money.
job-27-16.korean: 그가 비록 은을 티끌 같이 쌓고 의복을 진흙 같이 준비할지라도

genesis-41-49.text: In this way, Joseph stored a lot of food. The food grains were as many as the sand by the sea! Joseph stopped counting how much food he had stored because there was too much food to measure.
genesis-41-49.korean: 쌓아 둔 곡식이 바다 모래 같이 심히 많아 세기를 그쳤으니 그 수가 한이 없음이었더라

acts-27-39.text: In the morning, the ship was near to some land, but the sailors did not recognize the place. They saw a place on the shore where there was a lot of sand. They wanted to drive the ship onto the sand.
acts-27-39.korean: 날이 새매 어느 땅인지 알지 못하나 경사진 해안으로 된 항만이 눈에 띄거늘 배를 거기에 들여다 댈 수 있는가 의논한 후

1-samuel-25-4.text: While David was in the desert, he heard that Nabal was cutting the wool from his sheep.
1-samuel-25-4.korean: 다윗이 나발이 자기 양 털을 깎는다 함을 광야에서 들은지라

genesis-38-13.text: Someone told Tamar, ‘Your husband's father is going to Timnah to get the wool from his sheep.’
genesis-38-13.korean: 어떤 사람이 다말에게 말하되 네 시아버지가 자기의 양털을 깎으려고 딤나에 올라왔다 한지라

numbers-31-20.text: You must also make these things clean: any clothes or anything made from leather, wool or wood.’
numbers-31-20.korean: 모든 의복과 가죽으로 만든 모든 것과 염소털로 만든 모든 것과 나무로 만든 모든 것을 다 깨끗하게 할지니라

leviticus-13-52.text: The priest must burn the wool, leather or linen clothes. They have a disease that will destroy them.
leviticus-13-52.korean: 그는 그 색점 있는 의복이나 털이나 베의 날이나 씨나 모든 가죽으로 만든 것을 불사를지니 이는 악성 나병인즉 그것을 불사를지니라

job-31-20.text: Then I would give them clothes. The wool from my sheep would keep them warm. And they all thanked me. Then I would give them clothes.
job-31-20.korean: 만일 나의 양털로 그의 몸을 따뜻하게 입혀서 그의 허리가 나를 위하여 복을 빌게 하지 아니하였다면

john-20-22.text: When he had said this, he breathed on them. He said, ‘Receive God's Holy Spirit.
john-20-22.korean: 이 말씀을 하시고 그들을 향하사 숨을 내쉬며 이르시되 성령을 받으라

ezekiel-37-8.text: While I watched, I saw meat come and join to the bones. Then skin covered them. But there was no breath in them yet.
ezekiel-37-8.korean: 내가 또 보니 그 뼈에 힘줄이 생기고 살이 오르며 그 위에 가죽이 덮이나 그 속에 생기는 없더라

job-7-15.text: I would like someone to stop me breathing! Death would be better than life. I would like someone to stop me breathing!
job-7-15.korean: 이러므로 내 마음이 뼈를 깎는 고통을 겪느니 차라리 숨이 막히는 것과 죽는 것을 택하리이다

genesis-35-18.text: But Rachel was dying. With her last breath, she gave to her son the name Ben-Oni. But Jacob, his father, called him Benjamin.
genesis-35-18.korean: 그가 죽게 되어 그의 혼이 떠나려 할 때에 아들의 이름을 베노니라 불렀으나 그의 아버지는 그를 베냐민이라 불렀더라

revelation-11-11.text: But after three and a half days, God breathed life into those dead bodies. They stood up. The people who saw them were very afraid.
revelation-11-11.korean: 삼 일 반 후에 하나님께로부터 생기가 그들 속에 들어가매 그들이 발로 일어서니 구경하는 자들이 크게 두려워하더라

ruth-2-16.text: You should also pull out some barley and drop it for her to pick up. Do not be angry with her.’
ruth-2-16.korean: 또 그를 위하여 곡식 다발에서 조금씩 뽑아 버려서 그에게 줍게 하고 꾸짖지 말라 하니라

exodus-9-31.text: At that time, the barley was ripe in the fields and the flax was nearly ripe. So the storm of hail destroyed the flax and the barley.
exodus-9-31.korean: 그 때에 보리는 이삭이 나왔고 삼은 꽃이 피었으므로 삼과 보리가 상하였으나

1-kings-4-28.text: Each officer also supplied barley and straw for the king's horses. They took the right amount to the different places where the horses lived.
1-kings-4-28.korean: 또 그들이 각기 직무를 따라 말과 준마에게 먹일 보리와 꼴을 그 말들이 있는 곳으로 가져왔더라

ezekiel-4-12.text: Prepare your food like a cake that is made from barley. Bake it on a fire that you have made with human dung. Do this where the people can see you.’
ezekiel-4-12.korean: 너는 그것을 보리떡처럼 만들어 먹되 그들의 목전에서 인분 불을 피워 구울지니라

2-chronicles-2-10.text: I will pay your men who cut down the trees. To pay them, I will send 2,000 tons of wheat, 2,000 tons of barley, 450,000 litres of wine and 450,000 litres of olive oil.’
2-chronicles-2-10.korean: 내가 당신의 벌목하는 종들에게 찧은 밀 이만 고르와 보리 이만 고르와 포도주 이만 밧과 기름 이만 밧을 주리이다 하였더라

isaiah-7-12.text: But Ahaz said, ‘I will never ask the Lord to do that. I do not want to test him.’
isaiah-7-12.korean: 아하스가 이르되 나는 구하지 아니하겠나이다 나는 여호와를 시험하지 아니하겠나이다 한지라

deuteronomy-6-16.text: Do not test the Lord your God, to see what he will do. That is what you did at Massah.
deuteronomy-6-16.korean: 너희가 맛사에서 시험한 것 같이 너희의 하나님 여호와를 시험하지 말고

matthew-4-7.text: Jesus replied, ‘No! The Bible also says, “Do not test the Lord God, to see if he will save you”.’
matthew-4-7.korean: 예수께서 이르시되 또 기록되었으되 주 너의 하나님을 시험하지 말라 하였느니라 하시니

1-timothy-3-10.text: Before anyone becomes a deacon, you must first test their character. If they are good enough, then let them serve God as deacons.
1-timothy-3-10.korean: 이에 이 사람들을 먼저 시험하여 보고 그 후에 책망할 것이 없으면 집사의 직분을 맡게 할 것이요

job-7-18.text: You never leave us alone. You test us every moment of every day. You never leave us alone. You test us every moment of every day. You never leave us alone.

isaiah-59-4.text: When people accuse somebody in court,
isaiah-59-4.korean: 공의대로 소송하는 자도 없고 진실하게 판결하는 자도 없으며 허망한 것을 의뢰하며 거짓을 말하며 악행을 잉태하여 죄악을 낳으며

proverbs-29-9.text: If a wise person accuses a foolish person in court,
proverbs-29-9.korean: 지혜로운 자와 미련한 자가 다투면 지혜로운 자가 노하든지 웃든지 그 다툼은 그침이 없느니라

job-9-16.text: He might agree to meet with me in court. But I do not believe that he would listen to me. He might agree to meet with me in court.
job-9-16.korean: 가령 내가 그를 부르므로 그가 내게 대답하셨을지라도 내 음성을 들으셨다고는 내가 믿지 아니하리라

exodus-23-2.text: Do not join a group of bad people to do evil things. When you speak in court, tell the truth so that the judges will decide what is right. Do not tell lies to agree with what everyone else says.
exodus-23-2.korean: 다수를 따라 악을 행하지 말며 송사에 다수를 따라 부당한 증언을 하지 말며

2-samuel-15-4.text: Absalom would also say, ‘I think that I should have authority to be a judge in Israel. Then when people have a problem to take to court, they could come to me. I would make sure that they receive justice.’
2-samuel-15-4.korean: 또 압살롬이 이르기를 내가 이 땅에서 재판관이 되고 누구든지 송사나 재판할 일이 있어 내게로 오는 자에게 내가 정의 베풀기를 원하노라 하고

habakkuk-1-15.text: The Babylonians can easily catch them,
habakkuk-1-15.korean: 그가 낚시로 모두 낚으며 그물로 잡으며 투망으로 모으고 그리고는 기뻐하고 즐거워하여

proverbs-17-24.text: A person who knows what is right can easily find wisdom.
proverbs-17-24.korean: 지혜는 명철한 자 앞에 있거늘 미련한 자는 눈을 땅 끝에 두느니라

matthew-5-14.text: You are like a light for everybody in this world. If people build a city on a hill, then other people can see it easily.
matthew-5-14.korean: 너희는 세상의 빛이라 산 위에 있는 동네가 숨겨지지 못할 것이요

luke-19-4.text: He ran on in front of the crowd and he climbed up a fig tree. He could see Jesus more easily from the tree, because Jesus would walk along that way.
luke-19-4.korean: 앞으로 달려가서 보기 위하여 돌무화과나무에 올라가니 이는 예수께서 그리로 지나가시게 됨이러라

mark-3-27.text: Nobody can easily go into the house of a strong man to rob him. To do that, he must first tie up the strong man. Then he can take away all that man's valuable things.
mark-3-27.korean: 사람이 먼저 강한 자를 결박하지 않고는 그 강한 자의 집에 들어가 세간을 강탈하지 못하리니 결박한 후에야 그 집을 강탈하리라

1-corinthians-6-3.text: You know that we will judge the angels one day. So we must be able to decide about ordinary things here on earth.
1-corinthians-6-3.korean: 우리가 천사를 판단할 것을 너희가 알지 못하느냐 그러하거든 하물며 세상 일이랴

ezekiel-44-23.text: They must teach my people that holy things are different from ordinary things. They must also show them how to know if something is clean or unclean.
ezekiel-44-23.korean: 내 백성에게 거룩한 것과 속된 것의 구별을 가르치며 부정한 것과 정한 것을 분별하게 할 것이며

matthew-11-18.text: People today are like those children. John the Baptist did not eat ordinary food. He never drank wine. So people say that he has a bad spirit in him.
matthew-11-18.korean: 요한이 와서 먹지도 않고 마시지도 아니하매 그들이 말하기를 귀신이 들렸다 하더니

job-3-19.text: Great people and ordinary people are all there together. Slaves have no master that they must obey. Great people and ordinary people are all there together.
job-3-19.korean: 거기서는 작은 자와 큰 자가 함께 있고 종이 상전에게서 놓이느니라

jeremiah-42-8.text: So Jeremiah told Kareah's son Johanan, the other army officers and all the people to come to him. That included everyone, important people and ordinary people.
jeremiah-42-8.korean: 그가 가레아의 아들 요하난과 그와 함께 있는 모든 군 지휘관과 백성의 낮은 자로부터 높은 자까지 다 부르고

leviticus-11-20.text: Some insects fly in the air and walk on the ground. The people must not eat them.
leviticus-11-20.korean: 날개가 있고 네 발로 기어 다니는 곤충은 너희가 혐오할 것이로되

zechariah-5-1.text: Again, I looked and I saw a large paper. It was moving through the air. There were many words on the paper.
zechariah-5-1.korean: 내가 다시 눈을 들어 본즉 날아가는 두루마리가 있더라

job-41-16.text: Each shield is very near the next one. Not even air can pass between them. Each shield is very near the next one.
job-41-16.korean: 그것들이 서로 달라붙어 있어 바람이 그 사이로 지나가지 못하는구나

ezekiel-10-15.text: The cherubs rose up into the air. They were the same as the living things that I had seen beside the River Kebar.
ezekiel-10-15.korean: 그룹들이 올라가니 그들은 내가 그발 강 가에서 보던 생물이라

revelation-16-17.text: Then the seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air. A voice spoke loudly from the throne in God's house. The voice said, ‘Now it has happened!’
revelation-16-17.korean: 일곱째 천사가 그 대접을 공중에 쏟으매 큰 음성이 성전에서 보좌로부터 나서 이르되 되었다 하시니

proverbs-7-6.text: Once I was looking out through the window of my house.
proverbs-7-6.korean: 내가 내 집 들창으로, 살창으로 내다 보다가

1-samuel-19-12.text: So Michal helped David to leave the house through a window. He ran away and he escaped.
1-samuel-19-12.korean: 미갈이 다윗을 창에서 달아 내리매 그가 피하여 도망하니라

1-kings-7-4.text: There were three rows of windows on each side of the room. They were opposite each other, in groups of three windows.
1-kings-7-4.korean: 또 창틀이 세 줄로 있는데 창과 창이 세 층으로 서로 마주 대하였고

joshua-2-21.text: Rahab said, ‘I agree with what you have said.’ She sent the men away. When they had gone, she tied the red string in her window.
joshua-2-21.korean: 라합이 이르되 너희의 말대로 할 것이라 하고 그들을 보내어 가게 하고 붉은 줄을 창문에 매니라

genesis-26-8.text: Isaac stayed in Gerar for a long time. One day Abimelech, the king of the Philistines, looked down from his window. He saw that Isaac was kissing Rebekah.
genesis-26-8.korean: 이삭이 거기 오래 거주하였더니 이삭이 그 아내 리브가를 껴안은 것을 블레셋 왕 아비멜렉이 창으로 내다본지라

genesis-22-10.text: Then Abraham took hold of the knife. He was ready to kill his son as a sacrifice.
genesis-22-10.korean: 손을 내밀어 칼을 잡고 그 아들을 잡으려 하니

revelation-14-16.text: Then the person who sat on the cloud moved his sharp knife over the earth. He cut down the earth's plants and he brought in the harvest.
revelation-14-16.korean: 구름 위에 앉으신 이가 낫을 땅에 휘두르매 땅의 곡식이 거두어지니라

judges-19-29.text: When he arrived home, he picked up a knife. He cut his slave wife's body into 12 pieces. Then he sent them to each of Israel's 12 tribes.
judges-19-29.korean: 그 집에 이르러서는 칼을 가지고 자기 첩의 시체를 거두어 그 마디를 찍어 열두 덩이에 나누고 그것을 이스라엘 사방에 두루 보내매

isaiah-18-5.text: Then, when the grapes on the vines are nearly ready for harvest, the Lord will cut them off! He will use his knife to cut off the branches.
isaiah-18-5.korean: 추수하기 전에 꽃이 떨어지고 포도가 맺혀 익어갈 때에 내가 낫으로 그 연한 가지를 베며 퍼진 가지를 찍어 버려서

deuteronomy-23-25.text: If you go into your neighbour's field of grain, you may eat some of it. You may pick some grain with your hands, but do not use a knife to cut it down.
deuteronomy-23-25.korean: 네 이웃의 곡식밭에 들어갈 때에는 네가 손으로 그 이삭을 따도 되느니라 그러나 네 이웃의 곡식밭에 낫을 대지는 말지니라

1-corinthians-2-3.text: I lived among you as someone who felt weak. I was very afraid.
1-corinthians-2-3.korean: 내가 너희 가운데 거할 때에 약하고 두려워하고 심히 떨었노라

luke-1-41.text: When Elizabeth heard Mary speak, she felt her baby move quickly inside her. The Holy Spirit filled her.
luke-1-41.korean: 엘리사벳이 마리아가 문안함을 들으매 아이가 복중에서 뛰노는지라 엘리사벳이 성령의 충만함을 받아

judges-16-16.text: She continued to say the same thing to Samson many times. Her words made Samson very upset. He felt that he wanted to die.
judges-16-16.korean: 날마다 그 말로 그를 재촉하여 조르매 삼손의 마음이 번뇌하여 죽을 지경이라

1-samuel-24-5.text: After that, David thought that he had done something wrong. He felt sorry that he had cut a piece of cloth from Saul's coat.
1-samuel-24-5.korean: 그리 한 후에 사울의 옷자락 벰으로 말미암아 다윗의 마음이 찔려

mark-6-26.text: Then Herod felt very sad. Because he had made a special promise, he did not want to refuse her. All his visitors had heard him.
mark-6-26.korean: 왕이 심히 근심하나 자기가 맹세한 것과 그 앉은 자들로 인하여 그를 거절할 수 없는지라

exodus-20-3.text: You must not have any other gods except me.
exodus-20-3.korean: 너는 나 외에는 다른 신들을 네게 두지 말라

deuteronomy-5-7.text: You must not have any other gods except me.
deuteronomy-5-7.korean: 나 외에는 다른 신들을 네게 두지 말지니라

john-3-13.text: The Son of Man came down from heaven. Nobody else has gone up to heaven except him.
john-3-13.korean: 하늘에서 내려온 자 곧 인자 외에는 하늘에 올라간 자가 없느니라

isaiah-43-11.text: I am the Lord, I alone. There is no other saviour, except me. I am the Lord, I alone.
isaiah-43-11.korean: 나 곧 나는 여호와라 나 외에 구원자가 없느니라

daniel-2-11.text: You are asking us to do something much too difficult! Nobody can do it, except the gods. And they do not live among men.’
daniel-2-11.korean: 왕께서 물으신 것은 어려운 일이라 육체와 함께 살지 아니하는 신들 외에는 왕 앞에 그것을 보일 자가 없나이다 한지라

proverbs-6-13.text: He sends secret messages with his eyes, his feet or his fingers.
proverbs-6-13.korean: 눈짓을 하며 발로 뜻을 보이며 손가락질을 하며

leviticus-14-27.text: He will put a finger from his right hand into the oil. He will shake it seven times in front of the Lord's altar.
leviticus-14-27.korean: 오른쪽 손가락으로 왼쪽 손의 기름을 조금 찍어 여호와 앞에 일곱 번 뿌릴 것이요

mark-7-33.text: Jesus led the man away from the crowd. He put his fingers into the man's ears. Then he spat on his hands and touched the man's tongue.
mark-7-33.korean: 예수께서 그 사람을 따로 데리고 무리를 떠나사 손가락을 그의 양 귀에 넣고 침을 뱉어 그의 혀에 손을 대시며

exodus-29-12.text: Take some of the bull's blood. Use your finger to put some of it on the horns of the altar. Pour the blood that remains on the ground around the altar.
exodus-29-12.korean: 그 피를 네 손가락으로 제단 뿔들에 바르고 그 피 전부를 제단 밑에 쏟을지며

john-20-27.text: Then he said to Thomas, ‘Put your finger in here. Look at my hands. Put your hand here, in my side. Do not refuse to believe what is true. Now, believe.’
john-20-27.korean: 도마에게 이르시되 네 손가락을 이리 내밀어 내 손을 보고 네 손을 내밀어 내 옆구리에 넣어 보라 그리하여 믿음 없는 자가 되지 말고 믿는 자가 되라

jonah-2-7.text: When my life was nearly gone, I prayed to you, Lord.
jonah-2-7.korean: 내 영혼이 내 속에서 피곤할 때에 내가 여호와를 생각하였더니 내 기도가 주께 이르렀사오며 주의 성전에 미쳤나이다

luke-23-54.text: This all happened on the day before the Jewish day of rest. It was nearly time for the Jewish day of rest to begin.
luke-23-54.korean: 이 날은 준비일이요 안식일이 거의 되었더라

1-chronicles-23-1.text: David was old and his life had nearly finished. He chose his son Solomon to rule over Israel as king. Chronicles 22 Chronicles 24
1-chronicles-23-1.korean: 다윗이 나이가 많아 늙으매 아들 솔로몬을 이스라엘 왕으로 삼고

2-corinthians-1-10.text: We nearly died, but God saved us from that great danger. We know that we can continue to trust him. He will save us from any future danger.
2-corinthians-1-10.korean: 그가 이같이 큰 사망에서 우리를 건지셨고 또 건지실 것이며 이후에도 건지시기를 그에게 바라노라

joshua-10-20.text: So Joshua and the Israelites destroyed nearly all the Amorite armies. But a few of the Amorites escaped and they reached their strong cities.
joshua-10-20.korean: 여호수아와 이스라엘 자손이 그들을 크게 살륙하여 거의 멸하였고 그 남은 몇 사람은 견고한 성들로 들어간 고로

1-kings-9-27.text: Hiram had sailors who knew how to sail ships on the sea. He sent some of these men to work with Solomon's sailors.
1-kings-9-27.korean: 히람이 자기 종 곧 바다에 익숙한 사공들을 솔로몬의 종과 함께 그 배로 보내매

acts-27-29.text: The sailors were afraid that the ship would hit some rocks. So they dropped four anchors on ropes from the back of the ship into the sea.
acts-27-29.korean: 암초에 걸릴까 하여 고물로 닻 넷을 내리고 날이 새기를 고대하니라

isaiah-23-2.text: Weep quietly, you people who live on the coast of the sea. Yes, weep, you traders of Sidon city. Your sailors travelled across the sea and you became rich.
isaiah-23-2.korean: 바다에 왕래하는 시돈 상인들로 말미암아 부요하게 된 너희 해변 주민들아 잠잠하라

jonah-1-16.text: When they saw what had happened, the sailors became very afraid of the Lord's power. They offered a sacrifice to him and they promised that they would serve him.
jonah-1-16.korean: 그 사람들이 여호와를 크게 두려워하여 여호와께 제물을 드리고 서원을 하였더라

ezekiel-27-28.text: When your sailors call out for help, the cities on the coast of the sea will shake. When your sailors call out for help, the cities on the coast of the sea will shake. When your sailors call out for help,
ezekiel-27-28.korean: 네 선장이 부르짖는 소리에 물결이 흔들리리로다

mark-9-49.text: God will put fire on everybody, as people put salt on food.
mark-9-49.korean: 사람마다 불로써 소금 치듯 함을 받으리라

1-chronicles-18-12.text: Zeruiah's son Abishai killed 18,000 men from Edom in the Valley of Salt.
1-chronicles-18-12.korean: 스루야의 아들 아비새가 소금 골짜기에서 에돔 사람 만 팔천 명을 쳐죽인지라

numbers-34-12.text: Then it will go along the Jordan River and it will finish at the Salt Sea.
numbers-34-12.korean: 그 경계가 또 요단으로 내려가서 염해에 이르나니 너희 땅의 사방 경계가 이러하니라

joshua-15-5.text: Judah's east border went from the Salt Sea as far as the end of the Jordan River.
joshua-15-5.korean: 그 동쪽 경계는 염해이니 요단 끝까지요 그 북쪽 경계는 요단 끝에 있는 해만에서부터

2-chronicles-25-11.text: But Amaziah was brave. He led his army to Salt Valley. There they killed 10,000 soldiers from Edom.
2-chronicles-25-11.korean: 아마샤가 담력을 내어 그의 백성을 거느리고 소금 골짜기에 이르러 세일 자손 만 명을 죽이고

job-11-7.text: You cannot discover everything about God.
job-11-7.korean: 네가 하나님의 오묘함을 어찌 능히 측량하며 전능자를 어찌 능히 완전히 알겠느냐

exodus-18-15.text: Moses answered Jethro, ‘The people come to me to discover what God says.
exodus-18-15.korean: 모세가 그의 장인에게 대답하되 백성이 하나님께 물으려고 내게로 옴이라

romans-4-1.text: Abraham was the ancestor of all of us who are Jews. Think about what he discovered.
romans-4-1.korean: 그런즉 육신으로 우리 조상인 아브라함이 무엇을 얻었다 하리요

john-4-3.text: Jesus discovered what the Pharisees were thinking, so he left Judea. He returned to Galilee.

1-samuel-26-4.text: So David sent some men to see if that was true. They discovered that Saul had arrived at Hakilah.
1-samuel-26-4.korean: 이에 다윗이 정탐꾼을 보내어 사울이 과연 이른 줄 알고

2-samuel-13-29.text: So Absalom's men killed Amnon, as Absalom had told them to do. Then all the king's other sons got on their mules. They quickly rode away.
2-samuel-13-29.korean: 압살롬의 종들이 압살롬의 명령대로 암논에게 행하매 왕의 모든 아들들이 일어나 각기 노새를 타고 도망하니라

1-kings-1-33.text: The king said to them, ‘Take my officers with you and put my son Solomon on my own mule. Then lead him down to Gihon, as he rides on the mule.
1-kings-1-33.korean: 왕이 그들에게 이르되 너희는 너희 주의 신하들을 데리고 내 아들 솔로몬을 내 노새에 태우고 기혼으로 인도하여 내려가고

2-chronicles-9-24.text: Every year, people who came to visit Solomon brought him gifts. They brought things that were made from silver and gold, as well as clothes, weapons, spices, horses and mules.
2-chronicles-9-24.korean: 각기 예물을 가지고 왔으니 곧 은 그릇과 금 그릇과 의복과 갑옷과 향품과 말과 노새라 해마다 정한 수가 있었더라

ezekiel-27-14.text: Men from Beth Togarmah came. They paid you with horses to use in war or for work, and also with mules. Men from Beth Togarmah came. They paid you with horses to use in war or for work, and also with mules.
ezekiel-27-14.korean: 도갈마 족속은 말과 군마와 노새를 네 물품과 바꾸었으며

2-kings-5-17.text: So Naaman said, ‘So, you will not accept my gift. But please agree to let me take home some soil from here. I will take as much soil as two mules can carry. Then I will never again make any sacrifices or burnt offerings to any other god. I will only worship the Lord.
2-kings-5-17.korean: 나아만이 이르되 그러면 청하건대 노새 두 마리에 실을 흙을 당신의 종에게 주소서 이제부터는 종이 번제물과 다른 희생제사를 여호와 외 다른 신에게는 드리지 아니하고 다만 여호와께 드리겠나이다

romans-9-12.text: God said to Rebekah, ‘The older son will serve the younger son.’
romans-9-12.korean: 리브가에게 이르시되 큰 자가 어린 자를 섬기리라 하셨나니

genesis-27-15.text: Then Rebekah took some of Esau's best clothes that were in her house. She put them on Jacob, her younger son.
genesis-27-15.korean: 리브가가 집 안 자기에게 있는 그의 맏아들 에서의 좋은 의복을 가져다가 그의 작은 아들 야곱에게 입히고

job-32-4.text: Elihu had waited for Job's three friends to speak before he spoke to Job himself. He waited because he was younger than them.
job-32-4.korean: 엘리후는 그들의 나이가 자기보다 여러 해 위이므로 욥에게 말하기를 참고 있다가

1-samuel-14-49.text: Saul's sons were Jonathan, Ishvi and Malki-Shua. Saul had two daughters. Merab was his older daughter. Michal was his younger daughter.
1-samuel-14-49.korean: 사울의 아들은 요나단과 이스위와 말기수아요 그의 두 딸의 이름은 이러하니 맏딸의 이름은 메랍이요 작은 딸의 이름은 미갈이며

1-timothy-5-2.text: Speak to older women as you would speak to your mother. Speak to younger women as you would speak to your sisters. Always respect them properly.
1-timothy-5-2.korean: 늙은 여자에게는 어머니에게 하듯 하며 젊은 여자에게는 온전히 깨끗함으로 자매에게 하듯 하라

genesis-27-26.text: Then Isaac said, ‘Come here my son and kiss me.’
genesis-27-26.korean: 그의 아버지 이삭이 그에게 이르되 내 아들아 가까이 와서 내게 입맞추라

2-corinthians-13-12.text: When you meet, kiss each other as Christian brothers and sisters.

1-peter-5-14.text: When you meet, kiss each other as Christian brothers and sisters.
1-peter-5-14.korean: 너희는 사랑의 입맞춤으로 서로 문안하라 그리스도 안에 있는 너희 모든 이에게 평강이 있을지어다

proverbs-7-13.text: Now she took hold of the young man and she kissed him. She looked into his eyes without any shame.
proverbs-7-13.korean: 그 여인이 그를 붙잡고 그에게 입맞추며 부끄러움을 모르는 얼굴로 그에게 말하되

matthew-26-49.text: Now Judas went immediately to Jesus. He said, ‘Hello, Teacher.’ Then he kissed Jesus in a friendly way.
matthew-26-49.korean: 곧 예수께 나아와 랍비여 안녕하시옵니까 하고 입을 맞추니

jeremiah-9-2.text: I would like to live in a hut in the desert.
jeremiah-9-2.korean: 내가 광야에서 나그네가 머무를 곳을 얻는다면 내 백성을 떠나 가리니 그들은 다 간음하는 자요 반역한 자의 무리가 됨이로다

ezekiel-16-24.text: In the public places of every town you built huts to worship your idols.
ezekiel-16-24.korean: 너를 위하여 누각을 건축하며 모든 거리에 높은 대를 쌓았도다

isaiah-1-8.text: Jerusalem is now like a hut in a vineyard or in a field of crops. It stands there alone, with its enemies all round it.
isaiah-1-8.korean: 딸 시온은 포도원의 망대 같이, 참외밭의 원두막 같이, 에워 싸인 성읍 같이 겨우 남았도다

ezra-3-4.text: Then they had the Feast of Huts, as the law said they should do. On each day of the feast they made the right number of burnt offerings.
ezra-3-4.korean: 기록된 규례대로 초막절을 지켜 번제를 매일 정수대로 날마다 드리고

genesis-33-17.text: But Jacob went to Succoth instead. He built a house for himself, and he made huts for his animals. That is why the place is called Succoth.
genesis-33-17.korean: 야곱은 숙곳에 이르러 자기를 위하여 집을 짓고 그의 가축을 위하여 우릿간을 지었으므로 그 땅 이름을 숙곳이라 부르더라

2-kings-9-8.text: The whole family of Ahab must die. I will kill every male among his descendants in Israel, whoever they are.
2-kings-9-8.korean: 아합의 온 집이 멸망하리니 이스라엘 중에 매인자나 놓인 자나 아합에게 속한 모든 남자는 내가 다 멸절하되

matthew-10-39.text: Whoever wants to keep his life safe will lose it. But whoever gives his life to serve me will have true life.’
matthew-10-39.korean: 자기 목숨을 얻는 자는 잃을 것이요 나를 위하여 자기 목숨을 잃는 자는 얻으리라

colossians-3-25.text: Remember that God will punish anyone who does wrong things. He always judges people correctly, whoever they are.
colossians-3-25.korean: 불의를 행하는 자는 불의의 보응을 받으리니 주는 사람을 외모로 취하심이 없느니라

luke-17-33.text: Whoever wants to keep his own life safe will lose it. But whoever gives his life to serve me will have true life.
luke-17-33.korean: 무릇 자기 목숨을 보전하고자 하는 자는 잃을 것이요 잃는 자는 살리리라

genesis-44-10.text: The servant said, ‘What you say is fair. Whoever has the cup, will become my slave. The rest of you will go free.’
genesis-44-10.korean: 그가 이르되 그러면 너희의 말과 같이 하리라 그것이 누구에게서든지 발견되면 그는 내게 종이 될 것이요 너희는 죄가 없으리라

isaiah-22-9.text: You saw that there were many holes in the walls of the City of David. You stored water in the Lower Pool.
isaiah-22-9.korean: 너희가 다윗 성의 무너진 곳이 많은 것도 보며 너희가 아랫못의 물도 모으며

nehemiah-2-14.text: I went to the Fountain Gate and then to the King's Pool. The path there was too narrow for my donkey to pass through.
nehemiah-2-14.korean: 앞으로 나아가 샘문과 왕의 못에 이르러서는 탄 짐승이 지나갈 곳이 없는지라

jeremiah-41-12.text: So they took all their soldiers to go and fight against Ishmael. They chased after him. They caught him near the large pool at Gibeon.
jeremiah-41-12.korean: 모든 사람을 데리고 느다냐의 아들 이스마엘과 싸우러 가다가 기브온 큰 물 가에서 그를 만나매

nahum-2-8.text: Nineveh is like a pool of water. But now its people run away, like water that is pouring away. ‘Stop, stop!’ they shout, but nobody comes back.
nahum-2-8.korean: 니느웨는 예로부터 물이 모인 못 같더니 이제 모두 도망하니 서라 서라 하나 돌아보는 자가 없도다

2-samuel-2-13.text: Zeruiah's son, Joab, took David's men to meet Abner's men at the pool of Gibeon. One group sat on one side of the pool while the other group sat on the other side.
2-samuel-2-13.korean: 스루야의 아들 요압과 다윗의 신복들도 나와 기브온 못 가에서 그들을 만나 함께 앉으니 이는 못 이쪽이요 그는 못 저쪽이라

luke-13-12.text: Jesus saw her and he called her to come to him. He said, ‘Woman, you are now better from your illness.’
luke-13-12.korean: 예수께서 보시고 불러 이르시되 여자여 네가 네 병에서 놓였다 하시고

exodus-23-25.text: You must serve only me, the Lord your God. Then I will bless your food and your water. I will remove illness from among you.
exodus-23-25.korean: 네 하나님 여호와를 섬기라 그리하면 여호와가 너희의 양식과 물에 복을 내리고 너희 중에서 병을 제하리니

mark-5-29.text: As soon as she touched Jesus' coat, the blood stopped. She felt in her body that her illness was better. She knew that she was well again.
mark-5-29.korean: 이에 그의 혈루 근원이 곧 마르매 병이 나은 줄을 몸에 깨달으니라

job-27-15.text: Illness will kill any children who continue to live. Their widows will not weep when they are dead. Illness will kill any children who continue to live.
job-27-15.korean: 그 남은 자들은 죽음의 병이 돌 때에 묻히리니 그들의 과부들이 울지 못할 것이며

ezekiel-5-17.text: Famine or wild animals will kill you. Your children will no longer live. Illness and war will destroy you. I will send soldiers to attack you. I, the Lord, say this!’
ezekiel-5-17.korean: 내가 기근과 사나운 짐승을 너희에게 보내 외롭게 하고 너희 가운데에 전염병과 살륙이 일어나게 하고 또 칼이 너희에게 임하게 하리라 나 여호와의 말이니라

ephesians-5-14.text: Everything that becomes clear to see is in the light. That is why it says:
ephesians-5-14.korean: 그러므로 이르시기를 잠자는 자여 깨어서 죽은 자들 가운데서 일어나라 그리스도께서 너에게 비추이시리라 하셨느니라

exodus-24-10.text: They saw the God of Israel there. Under his feet was something like a jewel called sapphire. It was as bright as a clear blue sky.
exodus-24-10.korean: 이스라엘의 하나님을 보니 그의 발 아래에는 청옥을 편 듯하고 하늘 같이 청명하더라

mark-8-32.text: What Jesus said was very clear. Then Peter took Jesus away from the other disciples. Peter began to tell Jesus that he must not say things like that.
mark-8-32.korean: 드러내 놓고 이 말씀을 하시니 베드로가 예수를 붙들고 항변하매

2-corinthians-11-6.text: Perhaps I do not speak as well as they speak. But I do know what I am speaking about. We have always made this very clear to you in everything that we do.
2-corinthians-11-6.korean: 내가 비록 말에는 부족하나 지식에는 그렇지 아니하니 이것을 우리가 모든 사람 가운데서 모든 일로 너희에게 나타내었노라

romans-9-6.text: God promised good things to Israel's people. But I am not saying that what God promised did not happen. It is clear that not all of Israel's people are God's true people.
romans-9-6.korean: 그러나 하나님의 말씀이 폐하여진 것 같지 않도다 이스라엘에게서 난 그들이 다 이스라엘이 아니요

proverbs-26-23.text: When a hypocrite says nice words,
proverbs-26-23.korean: 온유한 입술에 악한 마음은 낮은 은을 입힌 토기니라

genesis-31-2.text: And Jacob could see that Laban was not as nice to him as he had been before.
genesis-31-2.korean: 야곱이 라반의 안색을 본즉 자기에게 대하여 전과 같지 아니하더라

job-6-6.text: You cannot enjoy food that has no salt in it. The white part of an egg is not nice to eat on its own. You cannot enjoy food that has no salt in it.
job-6-6.korean: 싱거운 것이 소금 없이 먹히겠느냐 닭의 알 흰자위가 맛이 있겠느냐

john-11-2.text: It was this Mary who had poured oil with a nice smell over the feet of the Lord Jesus. Then she had cleaned his feet with her hair. It was her brother Lazarus who was ill.
john-11-2.korean: 이 마리아는 향유를 주께 붓고 머리털로 주의 발을 닦던 자요 병든 나사로는 그의 오라버니더라

numbers-11-5.text: We remember the fish that we ate in Egypt. We had as much as we wanted. And we remember all the nice vegetables, cucumbers, leeks, onions and garlic. And we remember the melons.
numbers-11-5.korean: 우리가 애굽에 있을 때에는 값없이 생선과 오이와 참외와 부추와 파와 마늘들을 먹은 것이 생각나거늘

leviticus-17-16.text: If that person does not wash his clothes and his body, it is his own mistake.’
leviticus-17-16.korean: 그가 빨지 아니하거나 그의 몸을 물로 씻지 아니하면 그가 죄를 담당하리라

james-1-22.text: But be careful to do what God says in his message. Do not only listen to it. Do not make that mistake!
james-1-22.korean: 너희는 말씀을 행하는 자가 되고 듣기만 하여 자신을 속이는 자가 되지 말라

numbers-15-29.text: The same rule is for the Israelites and for all the foreign people who live among them. That is when it was a mistake.
numbers-15-29.korean: 이스라엘 자손 중 본토 소생이든지 그들 중에 거류하는 타국인이든지 누구든 부지중에 범죄한 자에 대한 법이 동일하거니와

job-4-18.text: God knows that even his angels make mistakes. They may do foolish things. God knows that even his angels make mistakes.
job-4-18.korean: 하나님은 그의 종이라도 그대로 믿지 아니하시며 그의 천사라도 미련하다 하시나니

luke-6-41.text: Perhaps you want to tell a friend about his little mistake. If you want to tell him, first remember your own bigger mistakes.
luke-6-41.korean: 어찌하여 형제의 눈 속에 있는 티는 보고 네 눈 속에 있는 들보는 깨닫지 못하느냐

job-41-14.text: Nobody is strong enough to open its mouth. Its teeth make everyone afraid. Nobody is strong enough to open its mouth.
job-41-14.korean: 누가 그것의 턱을 벌릴 수 있겠느냐 그의 둥근 이틀은 심히 두렵구나

matthew-13-50.text: The angels will throw the wicked people into the great fire. There those people will weep and they will bite their teeth together.’
matthew-13-50.korean: 풀무 불에 던져 넣으리니 거기서 울며 이를 갈리라

ezekiel-18-2.text: ‘You say this proverb about Israel: “The fathers have eaten bitter fruit, but it causes their children's teeth to hurt.” Why do you say that?
ezekiel-18-2.korean: 너희가 이스라엘 땅에 관한 속담에 이르기를 아버지가 신 포도를 먹었으므로 그의 아들의 이가 시다고 함은 어찌 됨이냐

acts-7-54.text: The group of Jewish leaders listened to Stephen. What he said made them very angry. They bit their teeth together because they were so angry.
acts-7-54.korean: 그들이 이 말을 듣고 마음에 찔려 그를 향하여 이를 갈거늘

song-of-solomon-6-6.text: Your teeth are very white like a group of clean sheep that is coming from the pool of water. Each tooth is one of a pair. Not one of them is alone. Your teeth are very white
song-of-solomon-6-6.korean: 네 이는 목욕하고 나오는 암양 떼 같으니 쌍태를 가졌으며 새끼 없는 것은 하나도 없구나

numbers-28-5.text: With the lambs, you must also offer to God one kilogram of flour that you have mixed with one litre of good olive oil.
numbers-28-5.korean: 또 고운 가루 십분의 일 에바에 빻아 낸 기름 사분의 일 힌을 섞어서 소제로 드릴 것이니

exodus-29-40.text: With the first lamb, offer two litres of good flour. Mix the flour with one litre of olive oil. Also offer one litre of wine as a drink offering.
exodus-29-40.korean: 한 어린 양에 고운 밀가루 십분의 일 에바와 찧은 기름 사분의 일 힌을 더하고 또 전제로 포도주 사분의 일 힌을 더할지며

1-kings-7-26.text: The walls of ‘the Sea’ were 7½ centimetres thick. Its top edge was like a cup in the shape of a lily flower. ‘The Sea’ contained about 40,000 litres of water.
1-kings-7-26.korean: 바다의 두께는 한 손 너비만 하고 그것의 가는 백합화의 양식으로 잔 가와 같이 만들었으니 그 바다에는 이천 밧을 담겠더라

leviticus-24-5.text: The people must bake 12 loaves of bread. They must use the best flour. They must weigh the flour for each loaf. They must use two tenths (2/10) of an ephah (4 litres).
leviticus-24-5.korean: 너는 고운 가루를 가져다가 떡 열두 개를 굽되 각 덩이를 십분의 이 에바로 하여

john-2-6.text: There were six big pots there. People had used stone to make them. Each pot could contain about 100 litres of water. The water was there so that the Jews could wash themselves in the way that their special rules taught.
john-2-6.korean: 거기에 유대인의 정결 예식을 따라 두세 통 드는 돌항아리 여섯이 놓였는지라

joshua-8-32.text: The Israelites watched Joshua as he made a copy of God's Law on the stones. This was the Law that Moses had written.
joshua-8-32.korean: 여호수아가 거기서 모세가 기록한 율법을 이스라엘 자손의 목전에서 그 돌에 기록하매

2-kings-16-11.text: So Uriah built an altar that copied the plan that King Ahaz had sent from Damascus. Uriah finished it before King Ahaz returned.
2-kings-16-11.korean: 아하스 왕이 다메섹에서 돌아오기 전에 제사장 우리야가 아하스 왕이 다메섹에서 보낸 대로 모두 행하여 제사장 우리야가 제단을 만든지라

jeremiah-32-11.text: I took the paper with the seal, and also a copy of it that had no seal. The agreement about the sale of land was written on those pieces of paper.
jeremiah-32-11.korean: 법과 규례대로 봉인하고 봉인하지 아니한 매매 증서를 내가 가지고

deuteronomy-17-18.text: When anyone starts to rule as king, he must copy this Law of God on a scroll. The scroll will be a copy of the one that belongs to the Levite priests.
deuteronomy-17-18.korean: 그가 왕위에 오르거든 이 율법서의 등사본을 레위 사람 제사장 앞에서 책에 기록하여

exodus-23-24.text: Do not worship their gods. Do not serve them. Do not copy the evil things that these people do. Destroy their idols and break their special stones into pieces.
exodus-23-24.korean: 너는 그들의 신을 경배하지 말며 섬기지 말며 그들의 행위를 본받지 말고 그것들을 다 깨뜨리며 그들의 주상을 부수고

exodus-36-15.text: The curtains were all the same size: 13.5 metres long and 2 metres wide.
exodus-36-15.korean: 각 폭의 길이는 서른 규빗, 너비는 네 규빗으로 열한 폭의 장단을 같게 하여

ezekiel-46-22.text: These four small yards were 20 metres long and 15 metres wide. They were all the same size.
ezekiel-46-22.korean: 뜰의 네 구석 안에는 집이 있으니 길이는 마흔 척이요 너비는 서른 척이라 구석의 네 뜰이 같은 크기며

1-kings-7-11.text: On top of the foundation they used the best stones that they cut to the right size. They also used beams of cedar wood.
1-kings-7-11.korean: 그 위에는 크기대로 다듬은 귀한 돌도 있고 백향목도 있으며

job-38-5.text: It was me who decided the size of the world. You surely must know that! I measured it as I made it. It was me who decided the size of the world.
job-38-5.korean: 누가 그것의 도량법을 정하였는지, 누가 그 줄을 그것의 위에 띄웠는지 네가 아느냐

revelation-21-17.text: He also measured its wall. The size of the wall was 144 cubits (65 metres). That is the way that humans measure things. The angel also measured in the same way.
revelation-21-17.korean: 그 성곽을 측량하매 백사십사 규빗이니 사람의 측량 곧 천사의 측량이라

exodus-26-28.text: The bar that goes across the centre of the boards must reach from one end of the tabernacle to the other end.
exodus-26-28.korean: 널판 가운데에 있는 중간 띠는 이 끝에서 저 끝에 미치게 하고

1-kings-7-28.text: This is how he made the water carts: He made them with bronze sides, which he fixed to bronze bars at the edges.
1-kings-7-28.korean: 그 받침 수레의 구조는 이러하니 사면 옆 가장자리 가운데에는 판이 있고

1-chronicles-22-3.text: He supplied a lot of iron to make things for the temple. That was for nails and bars to fix the doors at the entrances. He also supplied more bronze than they could weigh.
1-chronicles-22-3.korean: 다윗이 또 문짝 못과 거멀 못에 쓸 철을 많이 준비하고 또 무게를 달 수 없을 만큼 심히 많은 놋을 준비하고

nehemiah-3-3.text: The clan of Hassenaah built the Fish Gate. They put up the beams and they fixed its doors in their place. They made wooden bars and iron bars so that they could lock the doors.
nehemiah-3-3.korean: 어문은 하스나아의 자손들이 건축하여 그 들보를 얹고 문짝을 달고 자물쇠와 빗장을 갖추었고

acts-13-7.text: The ruler of Cyprus was called Sergius Paulus. Bar-Jesus was his friend. Sergius Paulus understood things well. So he asked Barnabas and Saul to come to him. He wanted them to tell him God's message.
acts-13-7.korean: 그가 총독 서기오 바울과 함께 있으니 서기오 바울은 지혜 있는 사람이라 바나바와 사울을 불러 하나님의 말씀을 듣고자 하더라

acts-16-8.text: So they went quickly through Mysia and they arrived at the city of Troas, on the coast.

2-chronicles-8-17.text: Then Solomon went to Ezion-Geber and to Elath. They were towns on the coast of the sea, in the land of Edom.
2-chronicles-8-17.korean: 그 때에 솔로몬이 에돔 땅의 바닷가 에시온게벨과 엘롯에 이르렀더니

numbers-24-24.text: Ships will come from the coast of Cyprus island. Their soldiers will attack Assyria and Eber. Then God will destroy them too.’
numbers-24-24.korean: 깃딤 해변에서 배들이 와서 앗수르를 학대하며 에벨을 괴롭힐 것이나 그도 멸망하리로다 하고

ezekiel-28-20.text: Sidon was a city on the coast about 25 miles north of Tyre. The Lord gave this message to me: The Lord gave this message to me:
ezekiel-28-20.korean: 여호와의 말씀이 또 내게 임하여 이르시되

isaiah-20-6.text: At that time, the people who live on this coast will say, “Look! This has happened to the people that we trusted to help us. We thought that they would rescue us from the king of Assyria. Now we will never escape from his power.” ’
isaiah-20-6.korean: 그 날에 이 해변 주민이 말하기를 우리가 믿던 나라 곧 우리가 앗수르 왕에게서 벗어나기를 바라고 달려가서 도움을 구하던 나라가 이같이 되었은즉 우리가 어찌 능히 피하리요 하리라

proverbs-28-3.text: A poor person who is cruel to helpless people
proverbs-28-3.korean: 가난한 자를 학대하는 가난한 자는 곡식을 남기지 아니하는 폭우 같으니라

amos-8-4.text: So listen to me, you who are cruel to helpless people. You try to destroy people who are poor and weak.
amos-8-4.korean: 가난한 자를 삼키며 땅의 힘없는 자를 망하게 하려는 자들아 이 말을 들으라

job-30-11.text: God has made me weak and helpless. People do to me anything that they want to do. God has made me weak and helpless.
job-30-11.korean: 이는 하나님이 내 활시위를 늘어지게 하시고 나를 곤고하게 하심으로 무리가 내 앞에서 굴레를 벗었음이니라

judges-16-6.text: So Delilah said to Samson, ‘Please tell me what makes you so strong. How could someone tie you up so that you become helpless?’
judges-16-6.korean: 들릴라가 삼손에게 말하되 청하건대 당신의 큰 힘이 무엇으로 말미암아 생기며 어떻게 하면 능히 당신을 결박하여 굴복하게 할 수 있을는지 내게 말하라 하니

isaiah-24-4.text: The earth becomes dry and all the plants die. The whole world becomes weak and helpless. Its important people also become weak.
isaiah-24-4.korean: 땅이 슬퍼하고 쇠잔하며 세계가 쇠약하고 쇠잔하며 세상 백성 중에 높은 자가 쇠약하며

amos-6-4.text: You lie on beautiful, expensive beds. You do not work, but you rest all the time. You eat fat young sheep and cows.
amos-6-4.korean: 상아 상에 누우며 침상에서 기지개 켜며 양 떼에서 어린 양과 우리에서 송아지를 잡아서 먹고

luke-16-19.text: Jesus then said, ‘At one time, there was a rich man who wore very expensive clothes. This rich man ate big meals every day.
luke-16-19.korean: 한 부자가 있어 자색 옷과 고운 베옷을 입고 날마다 호화롭게 즐기더라

matthew-11-8.text: Did you go to see a man who was wearing expensive clothes? No! People like that do not live in the wilderness. They live in kings' great houses.
matthew-11-8.korean: 그러면 너희가 무엇을 보려고 나갔더냐 부드러운 옷 입은 사람이냐 부드러운 옷을 입은 사람들은 왕궁에 있느니라

ezekiel-16-10.text: I put a beautiful dress on you. I put the best leather shoes on your feet. I dressed you with clothes made from linen and other expensive cloths.
ezekiel-16-10.korean: 수 놓은 옷을 입히고 물돼지 가죽신을 신기고 가는 베로 두르고 모시로 덧입히고

zechariah-14-14.text: Judah also will go to Jerusalem and they will fight. They will take every good thing from all the countries. There will be a lot of expensive metals and many rich clothes.
zechariah-14-14.korean: 유다도 예루살렘에서 싸우리니 이 때에 사방에 있는 이방 나라들의 보화 곧 금 은과 의복이 심히 많이 모여질 것이요

genesis-1-19.text: Evening passed and then it was morning.
genesis-1-19.korean: 저녁이 되고 아침이 되니 이는 넷째 날이니라

exodus-7-25.text: After the Lord had made the water in the river become blood, another seven days passed.
exodus-7-25.korean: 여호와께서 나일 강을 치신 후 이레가 지나니라

ezekiel-12-22.text: ‘Son of man, you have this proverb in the land of Israel: “A long time passes and visions never truly happen.”
ezekiel-12-22.korean: 인자야 이스라엘 땅에서 이르기를 날이 더디고 모든 묵시가 사라지리라 하는 너희의 이 속담이 어찌 됨이냐

mark-7-19.text: But food does not go into people's minds. It goes into their stomachs and then it passes out of their bodies.’
mark-7-19.korean: 이는 마음으로 들어가지 아니하고 배로 들어가 뒤로 나감이라 이러므로 모든 음식물을 깨끗하다 하시니라

leviticus-11-42.text: This means animals that pass across the ground on their stomachs. It also means animals that walk on four legs or many legs.
leviticus-11-42.korean: 곧 땅에 기어다니는 모든 기는 것 중에 배로 밀어 다니는 것이나 네 발로 걷는 것이나 여러 발을 가진 것이라 너희가 먹지 말지니 이것들은 가증함이니라

john-1-27.text: He is the one who comes after me. I am not good enough even to undo his shoes for him.’
john-1-27.korean: 곧 내 뒤에 오시는 그이라 나는 그의 신발끈을 풀기도 감당하지 못하겠노라 하더라

deuteronomy-25-10.text: After that, people will call that man's family, ‘the family of the man who lost his shoe.’
deuteronomy-25-10.korean: 이스라엘 중에서 그의 이름을 신 벗김 받은 자의 집이라 부를 것이니라

ruth-4-8.text: So the relative said to Boaz, ‘You may buy the land.’ When he said that, he removed his shoe.
ruth-4-8.korean: 이에 그 기업 무를 자가 보아스에게 이르되 네가 너를 위하여 사라 하고 그의 신을 벗는지라

ephesians-6-15.text: Be prepared to tell people the good news about peace with God. That will be like shoes on your feet.
ephesians-6-15.korean: 평안의 복음이 준비한 것으로 신을 신고

exodus-3-5.text: God said to Moses, ‘Do not come nearer! Remove your shoes from your feet. The ground that you are standing on is holy.’
exodus-3-5.korean: 하나님이 이르시되 이리로 가까이 오지 말라 네가 선 곳은 거룩한 땅이니 네 발에서 신을 벗으라

joel-2-30.text: I will do strange things in the sky and on the earth.
joel-2-30.korean: 내가 이적을 하늘과 땅에 베풀리니 곧 피와 불과 연기 기둥이라

acts-17-20.text: The officers said, ‘These strange ideas that you are teaching surprise us. Please explain to us what these ideas mean.’
acts-17-20.korean: 네가 어떤 이상한 것을 우리 귀에 들려 주니 그 무슨 뜻인지 알고자 하노라 하니

luke-21-31.text: In the same way, you will see these strange things happening. Then you will know that God will soon begin to rule in his kingdom.
luke-21-31.korean: 이와 같이 너희가 이런 일이 일어나는 것을 보거든 하나님의 나라가 가까이 온 줄을 알라

john-9-30.text: The man answered, ‘That is a very strange thing! You do not know where this man comes from. But he is the one who made my eyes able to see.
john-9-30.korean: 그 사람이 대답하여 이르되 이상하다 이 사람이 내 눈을 뜨게 하였으되 당신들은 그가 어디서 왔는지 알지 못하는도다

leviticus-20-12.text: A man is sinning if he has sex with his son's wife. You must kill them both. They have done a strange thing. Their own sin causes their death.
leviticus-20-12.korean: 누구든지 그의 며느리와 동침하거든 둘 다 반드시 죽일지니 그들이 가증한 일을 행하였음이라 그들의 피가 자기들에게로 돌아가리라

1-kings-6-35.text: He cut pictures of cherubs, palm trees and flowers on those doors too. He covered them with gold in the same way.
1-kings-6-35.korean: 그 문짝에 그룹들과 종려와 핀 꽃을 아로새기고 금으로 입히되 그 새긴 데에 맞게 하였고

isaiah-9-14.text: So, in one day, the Lord will destroy Israel, both its head and its tail. He will cut down both palm branch and reed.
isaiah-9-14.korean: 그러므로 여호와께서 하루 사이에 이스라엘 중에서 머리와 꼬리와 종려나무 가지와 갈대를 끊으시리니

numbers-33-9.text: They travelled from Marah to Elim. At Elim, there were 12 wells of water and 70 palm trees. They made their camp there.
numbers-33-9.korean: 마라를 떠나 엘림에 이르니 엘림에는 샘물 열둘과 종려 칠십 그루가 있으므로 거기에 진을 치고

deuteronomy-34-3.text: He saw the Negev desert in the south. He saw the valley that goes from Jericho as far as Zoar. Jericho is called ‘The city of palm trees’.
deuteronomy-34-3.korean: 네겝과 종려나무의 성읍 여리고 골짜기 평지를 소알까지 보이시고

ezekiel-40-26.text: Seven steps went up to it. The entrance room to the yard was at the end of the passage. There were pictures of palm trees on the inside walls of the passage.
ezekiel-40-26.korean: 또 그리로 올라가는 일곱 층계가 있고 그 안에 현관이 있으며 또 이쪽 저쪽 문 벽 위에 종려나무를 새겼으며

2-samuel-16-7.text: Shimei said, ‘Go away! Get out of here! You are a murderer, a wicked man!
2-samuel-16-7.korean: 시므이가 저주하는 가운데 이와 같이 말하니라 피를 흘린 자여 사악한 자여 가거라 가거라

numbers-35-17.text: Someone might hit another person with a big stone. If the person dies, the man is a murderer. He must die.
numbers-35-17.korean: 만일 사람을 죽일 만한 돌을 손에 들고 사람을 쳐죽이면 이는 살인한 자니 그 살인자는 반드시 죽일 것이요

2-kings-21-24.text: Then the people of Judah punished all Amon's murderers with death. They chose his son Josiah to be king after him.
2-kings-21-24.korean: 그 국민이 아몬 왕을 반역한 사람들을 다 죽이고 그의 아들 요시야를 대신하게 하여 왕을 삼았더라

2-chronicles-33-25.text: Then the people of Judah punished all Amon's murderers with death. They chose his son Josiah to be king after him.
2-chronicles-33-25.korean: 백성들이 아몬 왕을 반역한 사람들을 다 죽이고 그의 아들 요시야를 대신하여 왕으로 삼으니라

ezekiel-22-6.text: Each ruler of Israel that lives in you, Jerusalem, has been a murderer. Each one has used his power to kill people.
ezekiel-22-6.korean: 이스라엘 모든 고관은 각기 권세대로 피를 흘리려고 네 가운데에 있었도다

leviticus-22-20.text: They must not give any animal that is not perfect. The Lord will not accept that animal.
leviticus-22-20.korean: 흠 있는 것은 무엇이나 너희가 드리지 말 것은 그것이 기쁘게 받으심이 되지 못할 것임이니라

2-samuel-14-25.text: Everyone in Israel praised Absalom. They all thought that he was the most handsome man in the whole country. His body was perfect, from head to toe.
2-samuel-14-25.korean: 온 이스라엘 가운데에서 압살롬 같이 아름다움으로 크게 칭찬 받는 자가 없었으니 그는 발바닥부터 정수리까지 흠이 없음이라

deuteronomy-15-21.text: But if a firstborn animal is not perfect, you must not offer it as a sacrifice to the Lord your God. It must not be blind or have weak legs. It must not have anything wrong with it.
deuteronomy-15-21.korean: 그러나 그 짐승이 흠이 있어서 절거나 눈이 멀었거나 무슨 흠이 있으면 네 하나님 여호와께 잡아 드리지 못할지니

proverbs-30-12.text: There are some people who think that they are perfect. But they are still dirty inside. There are some people who think that they are perfect. But they are still dirty inside. There are some people who think that they are perfect. But they are still dirty inside.
proverbs-30-12.korean: 스스로 깨끗한 자로 여기면서도 자기의 더러운 것을 씻지 아니하는 무리가 있느니라

leviticus-1-10.text: A person may want to give a sheep or a goat as a gift to God. It must be a male animal. It must be perfect.
leviticus-1-10.korean: 만일 그 예물이 가축 떼의 양이나 염소의 번제이면 흠 없는 수컷으로 드릴지니

1-kings-12-6.text: Then King Rehoboam went to talk to the older advisors who had served his father Solomon. He asked them, ‘What answer should I give to these people?’
1-kings-12-6.korean: 르호보암 왕이 그의 아버지 솔로몬의 생전에 그 앞에 모셨던 노인들과 의논하여 이르되 너희는 어떻게 충고하여 이 백성에게 대답하게 하겠느냐

2-chronicles-10-6.text: Then King Rehoboam went to talk to the older advisors who had served his father Solomon. He asked them, ‘What answer should I give to these people?’
2-chronicles-10-6.korean: 르호보암 왕이 그의 아버지 솔로몬의 생전에 그 앞에 모셨던 원로들과 의논하여 이르되 너희는 이 백성에게 어떻게 대답하도록 권고하겠느냐 하니

judges-17-10.text: Micah said, ‘Stay here with me. You will be my advisor and my priest. I will pay you ten pieces of silver each year, as well as your clothes and food.’
judges-17-10.korean: 미가가 그에게 이르되 네가 나와 함께 거주하며 나를 위하여 아버지와 제사장이 되라 내가 해마다 은 열과 의복 한 벌과 먹을 것을 주리라 하므로 그 레위인이 들어갔더라

jeremiah-39-13.text: So Captain Nebuzaradan, an important officer called Nebushazban, Nergal-Sharezer, the king's advisor, and all King Nebuchadnezzar's other officers did that.
jeremiah-39-13.korean: 이에 사령관 느부사라단과 내시장 느부사스반과 궁중 장관 네르갈사레셀과 바벨론 왕의 모든 장관이

job-27-21.text: The east wind picks them up and takes then far away. 27: The wind in verses 21 to 23 is probably a picture of the troubles that come to wicked people. It removes them from their homes. The east wind picks them up and takes then far away.
job-27-21.korean: 동풍이 그를 들어올리리니 그는 사라질 것이며 그의 처소에서 그를 몰아내리라

isaiah-22-15.text: This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Now go and speak to Shebna, the officer with authority in the king's palace. Verses 15 to 24 are about royal officers called Shebna and Eliakim. This is what the Lord Almighty says: ‘Now go and speak to Shebna, the officer with authority in the king's palace.

2-kings-8-17.text: He was 32 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for eight years.
2-kings-8-17.korean: 여호람이 왕이 될 때에 나이가 삼십이 세라 예루살렘에서 팔 년 동안 통치하니라

2-chronicles-21-5.text: He was 32 years old when he became king. He ruled in Jerusalem for eight years.
2-chronicles-21-5.korean: 여호람이 왕위에 오를 때에 나이가 삼십이 세라 예루살렘에서 팔 년 동안 다스리니라

genesis-21-4.text: When Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him. That is what God had told him to do.

exodus-26-25.text: So there will be eight boards at the back of the tabernacle and 16 silver bases, two bases under each board.
exodus-26-25.korean: 그 여덟 널판에는 은 받침이 열여섯이니 이쪽 판 아래에도 두 받침이요 저쪽 판 아래에도 두 받침이니라

proverbs-27-7.text: A person who has eaten enough food will refuse honey.
proverbs-27-7.korean: 배부른 자는 꿀이라도 싫어하고 주린 자에게는 쓴 것이라도 다니라

isaiah-7-15.text: One day he will know how to choose good things and refuse to do evil things. By that time there will be cream and honey for him to eat.

1-kings-14-3.text: Take ten loaves of bread with you. Also take some cakes and a pot of honey. When you visit Ahijah, he will tell you what will happen to our son.’

revelation-10-10.text: So I took the little book from the angel's hand and I ate it. It was as sweet as honey in my mouth. But when I had eaten the book, it hurt my stomach.

matthew-25-26.text: The master said to him, “You are a bad and lazy servant. You know what I am like, do you? I get food from fields where I did not put any seeds. I get fruit from trees that I did not plant. You knew all that.

2-thessalonians-3-6.text: Our friends, you must stay away from every believer who is living in a lazy way. We tell you this with the authority that the Lord Jesus Christ gives to us. Lazy people like that are not living in the way that we taught you.

exodus-8-4.text: The frogs will jump all over you. They will jump on your people and on all your servants.” ’
exodus-8-4.korean: 개구리가 너와 네 백성과 네 모든 신하에게 기어오르리라 하셨다 하라

matthew-4-6.text: He said to Jesus, ‘If you are the Son of God, jump down from here to the ground. You know that the Bible says:
matthew-4-6.korean: 이르되 네가 만일 하나님의 아들이어든 뛰어내리라 기록되었으되 그가 너를 위하여 그의 사자들을 명하시리니 그들이 손으로 너를 받들어 발이 돌에 부딪치지 않게 하리로다 하였느니라

acts-14-10.text: So Paul said to him loudly, ‘Stand up on your feet!’ Immediately the man jumped up and he began to walk about.
acts-14-10.korean: 큰 소리로 이르되 네 발로 바로 일어서라 하니 그 사람이 일어나 걷는지라

1-kings-7-3.korean: 기둥 위에 있는 들보 사십오 개를 백향목으로 덮었는데 들보는 한 줄에 열 다섯이요

john-5-35.text: John was like a light that shone brightly. For a certain time, you enjoyed the light that he gave.
john-5-35.korean: 요한은 켜서 비추이는 등불이라 너희가 한때 그 빛에 즐거이 있기를 원하였거니와

ezekiel-1-22.text: I saw something over the heads of the living things. It looked like a high roof that shone brightly like ice.
ezekiel-1-22.korean: 그 생물의 머리 위에는 수정 같은 궁창의 형상이 있어 보기에 두려운데 그들의 머리 위에 펼쳐져 있고

luke-9-29.text: While Jesus was praying, his face became different to look at. His clothes also became very white. They were shining brightly.
luke-9-29.korean: 기도하실 때에 용모가 변화되고 그 옷이 희어져 광채가 나더라

revelation-1-14.text: His head and his hair were white like sheep's hair. They were very white, like snow. His eyes were like fires that were burning brightly.
revelation-1-14.korean: 그의 머리와 털의 희기가 흰 양털 같고 눈 같으며 그의 눈은 불꽃 같고

job-37-18.text: God puts the clouds across the whole sky, like a metal mirror that shines brightly. Can you also do that? No! God puts the clouds across the whole sky,
job-37-18.korean: 그대는 그를 도와 구름장들을 두들겨 넓게 만들어 녹여 부어 만든 거울 같이 단단하게 할 수 있겠느냐

revelation-5-2.text: Then I saw a powerful angel. He said with a loud voice, ‘Who is so good that they can break the seals? Who can open the book?’
revelation-5-2.korean: 또 보매 힘있는 천사가 큰 음성으로 외치기를 누가 그 두루마리를 펴며 그 인을 떼기에 합당하냐 하나

daniel-12-9.text: He said to me, ‘You must go now, Daniel. This message will remain secret until it is time for the end of this world. The seals will keep the book closed.
daniel-12-9.korean: 그가 이르되 다니엘아 갈지어다 이 말은 마지막 때까지 간수하고 봉함할 것임이니라

1-kings-21-8.text: Jezebel wrote some letters as if King Ahab had written them. She used his special seal as a mark on them. Then she sent them to the older leaders and important men who lived in Jezreel with Naboth.
1-kings-21-8.korean: 아합의 이름으로 편지들을 쓰고 그 인을 치고 봉하여 그의 성읍에서 나봇과 함께 사는 장로와 귀족들에게 보내니

jeremiah-32-10.text: I wrote my name on a piece of paper to show that I had bought the land. Some men watched as I did this, to agree to the sale. I closed the paper with a seal. Then I gave Hanamel the silver that I had weighed.
jeremiah-32-10.korean: 증서를 써서 봉인하고 증인을 세우고 은을 저울에 달아 주고

matthew-27-66.text: So the Jewish leaders and the soldiers went to the place where Joseph had put Jesus' body. They fixed the big stone that closed the front of the hole with a seal. Then they would know if someone had moved it. The soldiers stayed there to watch the place very carefully.
matthew-27-66.korean: 그들이 경비병과 함께 가서 돌을 인봉하고 무덤을 굳게 지키니라

job-41-20.text: Smoke pours out from its nose, like reeds that burn under a pot. Smoke pours out from its nose, like reeds that burn under a pot. Smoke pours out from its nose,
job-41-20.korean: 그것의 콧구멍에서는 연기가 나오니 마치 갈대를 태울 때에 솥이 끓는 것과 같구나

genesis-24-47.text: I asked her, “Whose daughter are you?” She said, “I am the daughter of Bethuel. Nahor is his father and Milcah is his mother.” When I heard that, I put the ring in her nose. I put the rings on her arms.
genesis-24-47.korean: 내가 그에게 묻기를 네가 뉘 딸이냐 한즉 이르되 밀가가 나홀에게서 낳은 브두엘의 딸이라 하기로 내가 코걸이를 그 코에 꿰고 손목고리를 그 손에 끼우고

2-chronicles-33-11.text: So the Lord brought the officers of the king of Assyria's army to attack them. They took hold of Manasseh. They put metal hooks in his nose and they tied bronze chains around him. Then they took him away to Babylon.
2-chronicles-33-11.korean: 여호와께서 앗수르 왕의 군대 지휘관들이 와서 치게 하시매 그들이 므낫세를 사로잡고 쇠사슬로 결박하여 바벨론으로 끌고 간지라

2-kings-19-28.text: Yes, you do shout at me! And I have heard all your proud noise. So I will put my hook in your nose. I will tie a rope to your mouth. Then I will pull you back home by the same way that you came.” Yes, you do shout at me!
2-kings-19-28.korean: 네가 내게 향한 분노와 네 교만한 말이 내 귀에 들렸도다 그러므로 내가 갈고리를 네 코에 꿰고 재갈을 네 입에 물려 너를 오던 길로 끌어 돌이키리라 하셨나이다

isaiah-37-29.text: Yes, you do shout at me! And I have heard all your proud noise. So I will put my hook in your nose. I will tie a rope to your mouth. Then I will pull you back home by the same way that you came.” Yes, you do shout at me!
isaiah-37-29.korean: 네가 나를 거슬러 분노함과 네 오만함이 내 귀에 들렸으므로 내가 갈고리로 네 코를 꿰며 재갈을 네 입에 물려 너를 오던 길로 돌아가게 하리라 하셨나이다

leviticus-13-53.text: When the priest looks at the clothes, the mildew might not be getting bigger.
leviticus-13-53.korean: 그러나 제사장이 보기에 그 색점이 그 의복의 날에나 씨에나 모든 가죽으로 만든 것에 퍼지지 아니하였으면

matthew-7-3.text: Perhaps you want to tell your friend about his little mistake. If you want to do that, first remember your own bigger mistakes.
matthew-7-3.korean: 어찌하여 형제의 눈 속에 있는 티는 보고 네 눈 속에 있는 들보는 깨닫지 못하느냐

isaiah-26-15.text: Lord, you have made our nation larger. You have made our nation larger and you have shown how great you are. You have made all the borders of our land grow bigger.
isaiah-26-15.korean: 여호와여 주께서 이 나라를 더 크게 하셨고 이 나라를 더 크게 하셨나이다 스스로 영광을 얻으시고 이 땅의 모든 경계를 확장하셨나이다

joshua-10-2.text: The king and the people of Jerusalem were very afraid, because Gibeon was a great city. It was bigger than Ai, like a city with a king. All its men were brave soldiers.
joshua-10-2.korean: 크게 두려워하였으니 이는 기브온은 왕도와 같은 큰 성임이요 아이보다 크고 그 사람들은 다 강함이라

mark-2-21.text: Then Jesus said, ‘Nobody uses a piece of new cloth to mend an old coat. If he does, the new cloth will cause the old cloth to tear again. It will make a bigger hole than before.
mark-2-21.korean: 생베 조각을 낡은 옷에 붙이는 자가 없나니 만일 그렇게 하면 기운 새 것이 낡은 그것을 당기어 해어짐이 더하게 되느니라

exodus-28-22.text: Use pure gold to make two thin chains like strings. These will fix the breastpiece to the ephod.
exodus-28-22.korean: 순금으로 노끈처럼 땋은 사슬을 흉패 위에 붙이고

judges-16-8.text: So the Philistine rulers gave Delilah seven new strings for bows. She used them to tie Samson up while he was asleep.
judges-16-8.korean: 블레셋 사람의 방백들이 마르지 아니한 새 활줄 일곱을 여인에게로 가져오매 그가 그것으로 삼손을 결박하고

isaiah-8-16.text: Tie a string round the paper where I have written this. Keep it safe as a true message. Give it to my disciples, to teach them.
isaiah-8-16.korean: 너는 증거의 말씀을 싸매며 율법을 내 제자들 가운데에서 봉함하라

genesis-38-28.text: While she was giving birth, one baby put out his hand. The woman who was helping Tamar tied a red string to that baby's arm. She said, ‘This baby came out first.’
genesis-38-28.korean: 해산할 때에 손이 나오는지라 산파가 이르되 이는 먼저 나온 자라 하고 홍색 실을 가져다가 그 손에 매었더니

numbers-15-38.text: ‘Tell the Israelites that they must put tassels on the corners of their clothes. They must fix the tassels on blue strings. They must do this now and for all future time.
numbers-15-38.korean: 이스라엘 자손에게 명령하여 대대로 그들의 옷단 귀에 술을 만들고 청색 끈을 그 귀의 술에 더하라

philippians-3-7.text: All those ideas seemed very important to me then. But now they are worth nothing to me, because I trust in Christ.
philippians-3-7.korean: 그러나 무엇이든지 내게 유익하던 것을 내가 그리스도를 위하여 다 해로 여길뿐더러

leviticus-6-6.text: He must bring a sheep to the priest. The sheep must be a perfect male animal. The sheep must be worth the right amount of money.
leviticus-6-6.korean: 그는 또 그 속건제물을 여호와께 가져갈지니 곧 네가 지정한 가치대로 양 떼 중 흠 없는 숫양을 속건제물을 위하여 제사장에게로 끌고 갈 것이요

galatians-5-2.text: Listen carefully! I, Paul, tell you this. If you agree that someone should circumcise you, then Christ will be worth nothing to you.
galatians-5-2.korean: 보라 나 바울은 너희에게 말하노니 너희가 만일 할례를 받으면 그리스도께서 너희에게 아무 유익이 없으리라

james-2-17.text: How we believe in God is also like that. If our faith does not lead us to do good things, then it is not worth anything. It is dead!
james-2-17.korean: 이와 같이 행함이 없는 믿음은 그 자체가 죽은 것이라

hebrews-6-8.text: But a field where only weeds and thorn bushes grow is worth nothing. God will very soon speak against that ground. In the end, fire will burn all of it.
hebrews-6-8.korean: 만일 가시와 엉겅퀴를 내면 버림을 당하고 저주함에 가까워 그 마지막은 불사름이 되리라

jeremiah-14-5.text: There is no grass in the fields for the deer to eat.
jeremiah-14-5.korean: 들의 암사슴은 새끼를 낳아도 풀이 없으므로 내버리며

proverbs-6-5.text: You must make yourself free from the trap. Escape quickly, like a bird or a deer that runs away from a hunter.
proverbs-6-5.korean: 노루가 사냥꾼의 손에서 벗어나는 것 같이, 새가 그물 치는 자의 손에서 벗어나는 것 같이 스스로 구원하라

deuteronomy-14-4.text: You may eat the meat of these animals: cows, sheep, goats, 5 deer, wild goats, mountain goats, antelopes and wild sheep.
deuteronomy-14-4.korean: 너희가 먹을 만한 짐승은 이러하니 곧 소와 양과 염소와

isaiah-13-14.text: Everyone will try to run away and escape. They will run anywhere, like a deer that runs away from a hunter. They will be like sheep with no shepherd to lead them. They will return to their own countries and homes.
isaiah-13-14.korean: 그들이 쫓긴 노루나 모으는 자 없는 양 같이 각기 자기 동족에게로 돌아가며 각기 본향으로 도망할 것이나

habakkuk-3-19.text: The Lord God causes me to be strong. He makes my feet run safely over the rocks and hills, like a deer's feet. This prayer is for the music leader. He must use stringed instruments. The Lord God causes me to be strong.
habakkuk-3-19.korean: 주 여호와는 나의 힘이시라 나의 발을 사슴과 같게 하사 나를 나의 높은 곳으로 다니게 하시리로다 이 노래는 지휘하는 사람을 위하여 내 수금에 맞춘 것이니라

numbers-20-25.text: Moses, you must take Aaron and his son Eleazar to climb up Hor mountain.
numbers-20-25.korean: 너는 아론과 그의 아들 엘르아살을 데리고 호르 산에 올라

matthew-15-29.text: Jesus travelled on from that place and he walked along the shore of Lake Galilee. He climbed up a hill and he sat down there.
matthew-15-29.korean: 예수께서 거기서 떠나사 갈릴리 호숫가에 이르러 산에 올라가 거기 앉으시니

joshua-2-15.text: So Rahab put a rope out through the window of her house. (The house that she lived in was part of the city wall.) The men climbed down the rope.
joshua-2-15.korean: 라합이 그들을 창문에서 줄로 달아 내리니 그의 집이 성벽 위에 있으므로 그가 성벽 위에 거주하였음이라

1-kings-18-42.text: So Ahab went away to eat and to drink. But Elijah climbed to the top of Mount Carmel. He bent low down towards the ground. He put his face between his knees.
1-kings-18-42.korean: 아합이 먹고 마시러 올라가니라 엘리야가 갈멜 산 꼭대기로 올라가서 땅에 꿇어 엎드려 그의 얼굴을 무릎 사이에 넣고

exodus-20-26.text: Do not make an altar which has stairs going up to it. If you do that, someone may see under your clothes when you climb up the stairs. Then you would be ashamed.”
exodus-20-26.korean: 너는 층계로 내 제단에 오르지 말라 네 하체가 그 위에서 드러날까 함이니라

isaiah-53-8.text: They spoke lies to accuse him in court.
isaiah-53-8.korean: 그는 곤욕과 심문을 당하고 끌려 갔으나 그 세대 중에 누가 생각하기를 그가 살아 있는 자들의 땅에서 끊어짐은 마땅히 형벌 받을 내 백성의 허물 때문이라 하였으리요

deuteronomy-19-16.text: Somebody may accuse another person because he wants to hurt him. He tells lies against him.
deuteronomy-19-16.korean: 만일 위증하는 자가 있어 어떤 사람이 악을 행하였다고 말하면

hosea-4-1.text: Israelites, listen to the Lord's message! The Lord accuses the people who live in Israel of these bad things:
hosea-4-1.korean: 이스라엘 자손들아 여호와의 말씀을 들으라 여호와께서 이 땅 주민과 논쟁하시나니 이 땅에는 진실도 없고 인애도 없고 하나님을 아는 지식도 없고

1-corinthians-6-6.text: But instead, some believers among you accuse other believers in front of judges. And those judges are not believers!
1-corinthians-6-6.korean: 형제가 형제와 더불어 고발할 뿐더러 믿지 아니하는 자들 앞에서 하느냐

1-kings-21-10.text: Put two wicked men in seats near him. Tell them to accuse Naboth that he has insulted God and the king. Then take him out. Throw stones at him until he is dead.’
1-kings-21-10.korean: 불량자 두 사람을 그의 앞에 마주 앉히고 그에게 대하여 증거하기를 네가 하나님과 왕을 저주하였다 하게 하고 곧 그를 끌고 나가서 돌로 쳐죽이라 하였더라

exodus-26-14.text: Use red leather from sheep's skins to cover the tent. Then use another kind of good leather to cover the red leather.
exodus-26-14.korean: 붉은 물 들인 숫양의 가죽으로 막의 덮개를 만들고 해달의 가죽으로 그 윗덮개를 만들지니라

2-kings-1-8.text: They replied, ‘He was wearing rough clothes. He had tied a leather belt around him.’ Then the king said, ‘That was Elijah, the prophet from Tishbe.’
2-kings-1-8.korean: 그들이 그에게 대답하되 그는 털이 많은 사람인데 허리에 가죽 띠를 띠었더이다 하니 왕이 이르되 그는 디셉 사람 엘리야로다

leviticus-13-59.text: These are the rules for mildew in linen cloth. They are rules for wool or leather clothes. They tell the priest how to know whether they are clean or not clean.
leviticus-13-59.korean: 이는 털옷에나 베옷에나 그 날에나 씨에나 가죽으로 만든 모든 것에 발생한 나병 색점의 정하고 부정한 것을 진단하는 규례니라

judges-4-19.text: Sisera said to her, ‘I am thirsty. Please give me some water to drink.’ She gave him some milk from a leather bottle. Then she covered him again with the cloth.
judges-4-19.korean: 시스라가 그에게 말하되 청하노니 내게 물을 조금 마시게 하라 내가 목이 마르다 하매 우유 부대를 열어 그에게 마시게 하고 그를 덮으니

numbers-4-11.text: They must cover the gold altar with a blue cloth. They must cover the blue cloth with good leather. Then they must fix the poles to the altar, so that they can carry it.
numbers-4-11.korean: 금제단 위에 청색 보자기를 펴고 해달의 가죽 덮개로 덮고 그 채를 꿰고

mark-1-18.text: Simon and Andrew immediately put down their nets and they went with Jesus.

exodus-27-5.text: Fix this net inside the altar, in the middle, between the top of the altar and the ground.
exodus-27-5.korean: 그물은 제단 주위 가장자리 아래 곧 제단 절반에 오르게 할지며

luke-5-2.text: Jesus saw two fishing boats at the edge of the lake. The fishermen had left the boats there and they were now washing their nets.
luke-5-2.korean: 호숫가에 배 두 척이 있는 것을 보시니 어부들은 배에서 나와서 그물을 씻는지라

john-21-11.text: Simon Peter got back into the boat and he pulled the net onto the shore. It was full of 153 big fish. There were so many fish, but the net had not broken.
john-21-11.korean: 시몬 베드로가 올라가서 그물을 육지에 끌어 올리니 가득히 찬 큰 물고기가 백쉰세 마리라 이같이 많으나 그물이 찢어지지 아니하였더라

ezekiel-12-13.text: I will throw my net over him and I will catch him in my trap. I will take him to Babylon city, in the land of the Chaldeans. But he will not see that land. He will die there.
ezekiel-12-13.korean: 내가 또 내 그물을 그의 위에 치고 내 올무에 걸리게 하여 그를 끌고 갈대아 땅 바벨론에 이르리니 그가 거기에서 죽으려니와 그 땅을 보지 못하리라

jonah-1-17.text: But the Lord sent a great fish to swallow Jonah. Jonah was inside the fish's stomach for three days and three nights.
jonah-1-17.korean: 여호와께서 이미 큰 물고기를 예비하사 요나를 삼키게 하셨으므로 요나가 밤낮 삼 일을 물고기 뱃속에 있으니라

2-chronicles-21-18.text: After all this happened, the Lord caused Jehoram to have a bad disease in his stomach. He could not become well again.
2-chronicles-21-18.korean: 이 모든 일 후에 여호와께서 여호람을 치사 능히 고치지 못할 병이 그 창자에 들게 하셨으므로

1-timothy-5-23.text: I know that you often become ill. So do not drink only water, but drink a little wine. This will help your stomach to keep well.
1-timothy-5-23.korean: 이제부터는 물만 마시지 말고 네 위장과 자주 나는 병을 위하여는 포도주를 조금씩 쓰라

leviticus-4-11.text: He must take up the skin and all the meat. He must take the head, the legs and all the inside pieces. He must include the stomach.
leviticus-4-11.korean: 그 수송아지의 가죽과 그 모든 고기와 그것의 머리와 정강이와 내장과

matthew-15-17.text: You should understand that food first goes into people's mouths. Then it goes into their stomach, and then it passes out of their body.
matthew-15-17.korean: 입으로 들어가는 모든 것은 배로 들어가서 뒤로 내버려지는 줄 알지 못하느냐

leviticus-14-42.text: The person who lives in the house must get some more stones. He must get some more clay. Then he can mend the wall.
leviticus-14-42.korean: 그들은 다른 돌로 그 돌을 대신하며 다른 흙으로 집에 바를지니라

revelation-2-27.text: That person will rule the nations with strong authority. He will destroy them, like someone who breaks clay pots into many pieces.
revelation-2-27.korean: 그가 철장을 가지고 그들을 다스려 질그릇 깨뜨리는 것과 같이 하리라 나도 내 아버지께 받은 것이 그러하니라

daniel-2-42.text: But the iron parts of the statue were mixed with clay parts. This shows that the fourth kingdom will be strong in some parts and weak in other parts.
daniel-2-42.korean: 그 발가락이 얼마는 쇠요 얼마는 진흙인즉 그 나라가 얼마는 든든하고 얼마는 부서질 만할 것이며

jeremiah-19-1.text: The Lord said to me, ‘Go to a potter. Buy from him a pot that he has made from clay. Take with you some leaders of the people and some leaders of the priests.
jeremiah-19-1.korean: 여호와께서 이와 같이 말씀하시되 가서 토기장이의 옹기를 사고 백성의 어른들과 제사장의 어른 몇 사람과

job-4-19.text: God used clay to make bodies for us who are humans. We came from the dust of the earth. We are as weak as moths. God used clay to make bodies for us who are humans.
job-4-19.korean: 하물며 흙 집에 살며 티끌로 터를 삼고 하루살이 앞에서라도 무너질 자이겠느냐

isaiah-41-5.text: The people on the islands see what I am doing,
isaiah-41-5.korean: 섬들이 보고 두려워하며 땅 끝이 무서워 떨며 함께 모여 와서

acts-28-9.text: After Paul did this, the other sick people on the island came to him. He caused them also to become well again.
acts-28-9.korean: 이러므로 섬 가운데 다른 병든 사람들이 와서 고침을 받고

revelation-6-14.text: The sky divided into two parts. It rolled up like a piece of paper. Every mountain and every island moved away from its place.
revelation-6-14.korean: 하늘은 두루마리가 말리는 것 같이 떠나가고 각 산과 섬이 제 자리에서 옮겨지매

deuteronomy-2-23.text: The same thing happened to the Avvites. They had lived in villages as far west as Gaza. But Philistines came from Crete island and they killed the Avvites. The Philistines lived there instead.)
deuteronomy-2-23.korean: 또 갑돌에서 나온 갑돌 사람이 가사까지 각 촌에 거주하는 아위 사람을 멸하고 그들을 대신하여 거기에 거주하였느니라)

deuteronomy-28-34.text: When you see what is happening to you, you will become crazy.
deuteronomy-28-34.korean: 이러므로 네 눈에 보이는 일로 말미암아 네가 미치리라

john-10-20.text: Many of them said, ‘He has a demon in him and he is crazy. You should not listen to him!’
john-10-20.korean: 그 중에 많은 사람이 말하되 그가 귀신 들려 미쳤거늘 어찌하여 그 말을 듣느냐 하며

1-samuel-21-14.text: King Achish said to his servants, ‘Look at this man! He is completely crazy! Why did you bring him to me?
1-samuel-21-14.korean: 아기스가 그의 신하에게 이르되 너희도 보거니와 이 사람이 미치광이로다 어찌하여 그를 내게로 데려왔느냐

acts-26-25.text: Paul said, ‘Festus, sir, I am not crazy. Everything that I have said is true. It is not difficult to understand.
acts-26-25.korean: 바울이 이르되 베스도 각하여 내가 미친 것이 아니요 참되고 온전한 말을 하나이다

mark-3-21.text: People told his family what was happening. So they went to take him away with them. They thought that Jesus was crazy.
mark-3-21.korean: 예수의 친족들이 듣고 그를 붙들러 나오니 이는 그가 미쳤다 함일러라

ezekiel-19-1.text: ‘Sing this sad funeral song for the leaders of Israel.
ezekiel-19-1.korean: 너는 이스라엘 고관들을 위하여 애가를 지어

jeremiah-9-17.text: The Lord Almighty said this: ‘Think about what is happening! Call the women who weep at funerals. Bring those women who know what to do.’ The Lord Almighty said this:
jeremiah-9-17.korean: 만군의 여호와께서 이와 같이 말씀하시되 너희는 잘 생각해 보고 곡하는 부녀를 불러오며 또 사람을 보내 지혜로운 부녀를 불러오되

amos-8-10.text: Your parties will become funerals. You will not sing happy songs but you will weep. You will wear rough clothes and you will cut off all your hair. You will be as sad as if your only son had died. That will be a very bad day for you.’
amos-8-10.korean: 너희 절기를 애통으로, 너희 모든 노래를 애곡으로 변하게 하며 모든 사람에게 굵은 베로 허리를 동이게 하며 모든 머리를 대머리가 되게 하며 독자의 죽음으로 말미암아 애통하듯 하게 하며 결국은 곤고한 날과 같게 하리라

2-samuel-14-2.text: So he sent a message to Tekoa to bring a wise woman from there. He said to her, ‘Pretend that you are upset because of someone's death. Dress in funeral clothes. Do not use any perfume on your body. You must seem like a woman who has been sad for a long time. Samuel 13 Samuel 15
2-samuel-14-2.korean: 드고아에 사람을 보내 거기서 지혜로운 여인 하나를 데려다가 그에게 이르되 청하건대 너는 상주가 된 것처럼 상복을 입고 기름을 바르지 말고 죽은 사람을 위하여 오래 슬퍼하는 여인 같이 하고

romans-2-6.text: He will give to each person what they ought to have because of the things that they have done.
