job-6-16.text: In the spring, ice and deep snow covers them. In the spring, ice and deep snow covers them. In the spring, ice and deep snow covers them. In the spring, ice and deep snow covers them.
job-6-16.korean: 얼음이 녹으면 물이 검어지며 눈이 그 속에 감추어질지라도

exodus-4-6.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, ‘Put your hand inside your robe.’ So Moses did this. When he took his hand out again, the skin had become white, like snow. It was the bad disease called leprosy.
exodus-4-6.korean: 여호와께서 또 그에게 이르시되 네 손을 품에 넣으라 하시매 그가 손을 품에 넣었다가 내어보니 그의 손에 나병이 생겨 눈 같이 된지라

jeremiah-1-14.text: ‘Yes, trouble like boiling water will come from the north. It will destroy all the people who live in this land.
jeremiah-1-14.korean: 여호와께서 내게 이르시되 재앙이 북방에서 일어나 이 땅의 모든 주민들에게 부어지리라

exodus-9-10.text: So they took ashes from an oven and they stood in front of Pharaoh. Moses threw the ashes up in the air. Then bad boils appeared on both people and animals.
exodus-9-10.korean: 그들이 화덕의 재를 가지고 바로 앞에 서서 모세가 하늘을 향하여 날리니 사람과 짐승에게 붙어 악성 종기가 생기고

2-kings-20-7.text: Then Isaiah said, ‘Take some figs to make a medicine.’ So the king's servants did what Isaiah had said. They put the medicine on Hezekiah's boil. He became well again.
2-kings-20-7.korean: 이사야가 이르되 무화과 반죽을 가져오라 하매 무리가 가져다가 그 상처에 놓으니 나으니라

leviticus-13-23.text: If the red mark is not becoming bigger, the disease is getting better. It is a mark that remains on the skin from the boil. The priest must say that the person is now clean again.
leviticus-13-23.korean: 그러나 그 색점이 여전하고 퍼지지 아니하였으면 이는 종기 흔적이니 제사장은 그를 정하다 할지니라

2-chronicles-35-13.text: The Levites cooked the lambs for the Passover meal over a fire, as the rules taught. They boiled the meat of the holy offerings in pots and pans. Then they quickly carried the meat to all the people.
2-chronicles-35-13.korean: 이에 규례대로 유월절 양을 불에 굽고 그 나머지 성물은 솥과 가마와 냄비에 삶아 모든 백성들에게 속히 분배하고

proverbs-7-17.text: I have splashed many kinds of perfume on my bed, like myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.

exodus-30-38.text: If anyone makes any incense like it for his own perfume, he will no longer belong to my people.’
exodus-30-38.korean: 냄새를 맡으려고 이같은 것을 만드는 모든 자는 그 백성 중에서 끊어지리라

1-samuel-8-13.text: The king will take your daughters to serve him. They will have to make perfume for him. They will also have to cook and bake bread for him.
1-samuel-8-13.korean: 그가 또 너희의 딸들을 데려다가 향료 만드는 자와 요리하는 자와 떡 굽는 자로 삼을 것이며

song-of-solomon-4-10.text: Your love for me is wonderful, my sister and my bride. I enjoy your love even more than I enjoy wine. Your perfume has a smell that is more lovely than any spice! Your love for me is wonderful,
song-of-solomon-4-10.korean: 내 누이, 내 신부야 네 사랑이 어찌 그리 아름다운지 네 사랑은 포도주보다 진하고 네 기름의 향기는 각양 향품보다 향기롭구나

ruth-3-3.text: So wash yourself carefully. Put some perfume on yourself. Put on your best clothes. Then go down to the threshing floor. Do not let Boaz know that you are there. Wait quietly until he has finished his food and drink.
ruth-3-3.korean: 그런즉 너는 목욕하고 기름을 바르고 의복을 입고 타작 마당에 내려가서 그 사람이 먹고 마시기를 다 하기까지는 그에게 보이지 말고

1-kings-4-3.text: Shisha's sons, Elihoreph and Ahijah, were secretaries.
1-kings-4-3.korean: 시사의 아들 엘리호렙과 아히야는 서기관이요 아힐룻의 아들 여호사밧은 사관이요

2-samuel-8-17.text: Ahitub's son Zadok and Abiathar's son Ahimelech were priests. Seraiah was David's secretary.
2-samuel-8-17.korean: 아히둡의 아들 사독과 아비아달의 아들 아히멜렉은 제사장이 되고 스라야는 서기관이 되고

1-chronicles-18-16.text: Ahitub's son Zadok and Abiathar's son Ahimelech were priests. Shavsha was David's secretary.
1-chronicles-18-16.korean: 아히둡의 아들 사독과 아비아달의 아들 아비멜렉은 제사장이 되고 사워사는 서기관이 되고

esther-9-32.text: Queen Esther's command made those rules about the feast of Purim. The palace secretaries wrote it down in a book.
esther-9-32.korean: 에스더의 명령이 이 부림에 대한 일을 견고하게 하였고 그 일이 책에 기록되었더라

2-chronicles-34-15.text: Hilkiah told Shaphan, the king's secretary, ‘I have found the book of the Law in the Lord's temple.’ He gave the book to Shaphan.
2-chronicles-34-15.korean: 힐기야가 서기관 사반에게 말하여 이르되 내가 여호와의 전에서 율법책을 발견하였노라 하고 힐기야가 그 책을 사반에게 주매

micah-1-9.text: Because Samaria has such bad wounds it can never get well.
micah-1-9.korean: 이는 그 상처는 고칠 수 없고 그것이 유다까지도 이르고 내 백성의 성문 곧 예루살렘에도 미쳤음이니라

exodus-21-25.text: You must give him a burn for a burn, a wound for a wound, a bruise for a bruise.
exodus-21-25.korean: 덴 것은 덴 것으로, 상하게 한 것은 상함으로, 때린 것은 때림으로 갚을지니라

jeremiah-30-12.text: The Lord says this to Zion's people: ‘You have received very bad wounds. Nobody can make you well again. The Lord says this to Zion's people:
jeremiah-30-12.korean: 여호와께서 이와 같이 말씀하시니라 네 상처는 고칠 수 없고 네 부상은 중하도다

2-kings-8-29.text: King Joram returned to Jezreel, so that his wounds could get better after the battle. While he was there, King Ahaziah went to visit him, because of his wounds.
2-kings-8-29.korean: 요람 왕이 아람 왕 하사엘과 싸울 때에 라마에서 아람 사람에게 당한 부상을 치료하려 하여 이스르엘로 돌아왔더라 유다의 왕 여호람의 아들 아하시야가 아합의 아들 요람을 보기 위하여 내려갔으니 이는 그에게 병이 생겼음이더라

2-chronicles-22-6.text: Joram returned to Jezreel, so that his wounds could get better after the battle. While he was there, King Ahaziah of Judah went to visit him, because of his wounds.
2-chronicles-22-6.korean: 요람이 아람 왕 하사엘과 싸울 때에 라마에서 맞아 상한 것을 치료하려 하여 이스르엘로 돌아왔더라 아합의 아들 요람이 병이 있으므로 유다 왕 여호람의 아들 아사랴가 이스르엘에 내려가서 방문하였더라

ezekiel-25-6.text: This is what the Almighty Lord says: You were happy when I punished Israel. You clapped your hands together. You stamped your feet on the ground.
ezekiel-25-6.korean: 주 여호와께서 이같이 말씀하셨느니라 네가 이스라엘 땅에 대하여 손뼉을 치며 발을 구르며 마음을 다하여 멸시하며 즐거워하였나니

daniel-8-10.text: Its power became so great that it reached up into heaven. It attacked heaven's army and the stars in the sky. It threw some of them down to the ground and it stamped on them.
daniel-8-10.korean: 그것이 하늘 군대에 미칠 만큼 커져서 그 군대와 별들 중의 몇을 땅에 떨어뜨리고 그것들을 짓밟고

revelation-14-19.text: So the angel moved his sharp knife over the earth. He cut off the grapes which grew in the earth's vineyard. He threw the grapes into the winepress where God stamps on the grapes because he is very angry.
revelation-14-19.korean: 천사가 낫을 땅에 휘둘러 땅의 포도를 거두어 하나님의 진노의 큰 포도주 틀에 던지매

revelation-14-20.text: The winepress was outside the city. When God stamped on the grapes, the juice that came out of the winepress was blood. The river of blood was very deep. It rose as high as horses' necks and it went as far as 300 kilometres.
revelation-14-20.korean: 성 밖에서 그 틀이 밟히니 틀에서 피가 나서 말 굴레에까지 닿았고 천육백 스다디온에 퍼졌더라

matthew-27-45.text: It was now midday. The whole country became dark for three hours.
matthew-27-45.korean: 제육시로부터 온 땅에 어둠이 임하여 제구시까지 계속되더니

luke-23-44.text: It was now about midday. The whole country became dark for three hours.
luke-23-44.korean: 때가 제육시쯤 되어 해가 빛을 잃고 온 땅에 어둠이 임하여 제구시까지 계속하며

acts-5-7.text: About three hours later, Ananias's wife, Sapphira, came into the room. She did not know what had happened to her husband.
acts-5-7.korean: 세 시간쯤 지나 그의 아내가 그 일어난 일을 알지 못하고 들어오니

mark-14-37.text: Jesus returned to his three disciples. Now they were sleeping. He said to Peter, ‘Simon, you are asleep! You could not stay awake for even one hour!
mark-14-37.korean: 돌아오사 제자들이 자는 것을 보시고 베드로에게 말씀하시되 시몬아 자느냐 네가 한 시간도 깨어 있을 수 없더냐

john-11-9.text: Jesus answered, ‘You know that there are 12 hours in the day. Anyone who walks during the day will not fall down. He will not fall down because he sees this world's light.
john-11-9.korean: 예수께서 대답하시되 낮이 열두 시간이 아니냐 사람이 낮에 다니면 이 세상의 빛을 보므로 실족하지 아니하고

genesis-7-22.text: Everything that lived on the dry land died. Nothing could breathe any more.
genesis-7-22.korean: 육지에 있어 그 코에 생명의 기운의 숨이 있는 것은 다 죽었더라

1-kings-17-22.text: The Lord answered Elijah's prayer. The boy started to breathe again. He was alive!
1-kings-17-22.korean: 여호와께서 엘리야의 소리를 들으시므로 그 아이의 혼이 몸으로 돌아오고 살아난지라

job-19-20.text: My body is now only skin and bones. I still breathe but I am only just alive. My body is now only skin and bones. I still breathe but I am only just alive. My body is now only skin and bones.
job-19-20.korean: 내 피부와 살이 뼈에 붙었고 남은 것은 겨우 잇몸 뿐이로구나

2-kings-8-15.text: The next day, Hazael took a thick cloth. He used water to make it wet. Then he put it over the king's face so that he could not breathe. So King Ben-Hadad died. Hazael became king of Syria after him.
2-kings-8-15.korean: 그 이튿날에 하사엘이 이불을 물에 적시어 왕의 얼굴에 덮으매 왕이 죽은지라 그가 대신하여 왕이 되니라

genesis-38-6.text: Judah found a wife for his oldest son, Er. Her name was Tamar.
genesis-38-6.korean: 유다가 장자 엘을 위하여 아내를 데려오니 그의 이름은 다말이더라

mark-12-20.text: But once there were seven brothers. The oldest brother married a woman. But he died before they had any children.
mark-12-20.korean: 칠 형제가 있었는데 맏이가 아내를 취하였다가 상속자가 없이 죽고

luke-20-29.text: But once there were seven brothers. The oldest brother married a woman. Then he died before they had any children.
luke-20-29.korean: 그런데 칠 형제가 있었는데 맏이가 아내를 취하였다가 자식이 없이 죽고

judges-8-20.text: Gideon said to his oldest son, Jether, ‘Kill them now!’ But Jether was only a boy. He was too afraid to do anything.
judges-8-20.korean: 그의 맏아들 여델에게 이르되 일어나 그들을 죽이라 하였으나 그 소년이 그의 칼을 빼지 못하였으니 이는 아직 어려서 두려워함이었더라

esther-2-12.text: All the young women stayed in the harem for 12 months. For six months they received myrrh oil for their bodies. Then they received perfume and different kinds of oil for another six months. After that time they could each go to the king's bedroom.
esther-2-12.korean: 처녀마다 차례대로 아하수에로 왕에게 나아가기 전에 여자에 대하여 정한 규례대로 열두 달 동안을 행하되 여섯 달은 몰약 기름을 쓰고 여섯 달은 향품과 여자에게 쓰는 다른 물품을 써서 몸을 정결하게 하는 기한을 마치며

genesis-43-11.text: Then their father Jacob said to them, ‘If you must take Benjamin, do what I tell you. Put some of the best things from our land in your bags. Take them to the man as a gift. Take some oil, some honey and some spices. Also take some myrrh, and some nuts.
genesis-43-11.korean: 그들의 아버지 이스라엘이 그들에게 이르되 그러할진대 이렇게 하라 너희는 이 땅의 아름다운 소산을 그릇에 담아가지고 내려가서 그 사람에게 예물로 드릴지니 곧 유향 조금과 꿀 조금과 향품과 몰약과 유향나무 열매와 감복숭아이니라

exodus-36-18.text: They made 50 bronze hooks to join the two sets of curtains together. It made a single tent.
exodus-36-18.korean: 놋 갈고리 쉰 개를 만들어 그 휘장을 연결하여 한 막이 되게 하고

amos-4-2.text: The Lord God has made this promise and he speaks only true words. He says, ‘The time will come, when your enemies will take you away with meat hooks and fish hooks.
amos-4-2.korean: 주 여호와께서 자기의 거룩함을 두고 맹세하시되 때가 너희에게 이를지라 사람이 갈고리로 너희를 끌어 가며 낚시로 너희의 남은 자들도 그리하리라

isaiah-19-8.text: The people who catch fish in the Nile river will be very sad. Yes, everyone who throws a hook into the river will cry. The people who throw nets into the river will not catch any fish.
isaiah-19-8.korean: 어부들은 탄식하며 나일 강에 낚시를 던지는 자마다 슬퍼하며 물 위에 그물을 치는 자는 피곤할 것이며

ezekiel-38-4.text: I will turn you around. I will put hooks into your mouth and catch you. I will take hold of you and your great army, with its horses and their riders. I will take hold of all your soldiers, who are ready to fight with their swords and their shields. I will pull them all away.
ezekiel-38-4.korean: 너를 돌이켜 갈고리로 네 아가리를 꿰고 너와 말과 기마병 곧 네 온 군대를 끌어내되 완전한 갑옷을 입고 큰 방패와 작은 방패를 가지며 칼을 잡은 큰 무리와

leviticus-15-28.text: When the woman stops bleeding, she must count seven days. Then she will be clean.
leviticus-15-28.korean: 그의 유출이 그치면 이레를 센 후에야 정하리니

luke-8-44.text: She came in the crowd behind Jesus and she touched the edge of his coat. Immediately she stopped bleeding.
luke-8-44.korean: 예수의 뒤로 와서 그의 옷 가에 손을 대니 혈루증이 즉시 그쳤더라

ezekiel-22-10.text: Some men have sex with their father's wife. Some men have sex with a woman at the time when she bleeds each month and she is unclean.
ezekiel-22-10.korean: 네 가운데에 자기 아버지의 하체를 드러내는 자도 있었으며 네 가운데에 월경하는 부정한 여인과 관계하는 자도 있었으며

isaiah-1-6.text: From the bottom of your feet, to the top of your head, everywhere hurts! There are wounds all over your body that are still bleeding. Nobody has cleaned your wounds or covered them. Nobody has put olive oil on them to make them better.
isaiah-1-6.korean: 발바닥에서 머리까지 성한 곳이 없이 상한 것과 터진 것과 새로 맞은 흔적뿐이거늘 그것을 짜며 싸매며 기름으로 부드럽게 함을 받지 못하였도다

acts-19-16.text: The man who had the bad spirit in him then jumped up. He fought with the seven sons and he was too strong for them. He hurt them badly and he tore their clothes off. So the sons ran away from the man's house. Their bodies were bleeding and they wore no clothes.
acts-19-16.korean: 악귀 들린 사람이 그들에게 뛰어올라 눌러 이기니 그들이 상하여 벗은 몸으로 그 집에서 도망하는지라

leviticus-19-9.text: When a person cuts the plants in his field, he must not cut to the edge of the field. He must not pick up what he drops.
leviticus-19-9.korean: 너희가 너희의 땅에서 곡식을 거둘 때에 너는 밭 모퉁이까지 다 거두지 말고 네 떨어진 이삭도 줍지 말며

numbers-35-23.text: Or he might drop a heavy stone on someone when he had not seen them. If he did not hate the other person, perhaps he did not mean to hurt him.
numbers-35-23.korean: 보지 못하고 사람을 죽일 만한 돌을 던져서 죽였을 때에 이는 악의도 없고 해하려 한 것도 아닌즉

mark-7-28.text: The woman replied, ‘Yes, sir. That is true. But small pieces of food drop while the children eat. And the dogs under the table eat those pieces.’
mark-7-28.korean: 여자가 대답하여 이르되 주여 옳소이다마는 상 아래 개들도 아이들이 먹던 부스러기를 먹나이다

deuteronomy-28-40.text: Olive trees will grow everywhere in your land, but you will never use any oil from them. The olives will drop off the trees before they are ready to pick.
deuteronomy-28-40.korean: 네 모든 경내에 감람나무가 있을지라도 그 열매가 떨어지므로 그 기름을 네 몸에 바르지 못할 것이며

2-corinthians-11-33.text: But my friends put me in a basket on the end of a rope. They sent me out through a window in the city wall and they let me drop to the ground. That is how I got away from the ruler of the city.
2-corinthians-11-33.korean: 나는 광주리를 타고 들창문으로 성벽을 내려가 그 손에서 벗어났노라

leviticus-25-13.text: In the Jubilee year every person must return to the land of his family.
leviticus-25-13.korean: 이 희년에는 너희가 각기 자기의 소유지로 돌아갈지라

numbers-36-4.text: Even when the Jubilee year comes, the land will not return to our tribe. It will belong to the tribes of the men that Zelophehad's daughters have married.’
numbers-36-4.korean: 이스라엘 자손의 희년을 당하여 그 기업이 그가 속한 지파에 첨가될 것이라 그런즉 그들의 기업은 우리 조상 지파의 기업에서 아주 삭감되리이다

ezekiel-46-17.text: The king may also choose to give some of his land to one of his servants. If he does that, the servant can keep the land until the year of Jubilee. After that, the land will belong to the ruler again. The ruler's land will always belong to the ruler and to his descendants.
ezekiel-46-17.korean: 군주가 만일 그 기업을 한 종에게 선물로 준즉 그 종에게 속하여 희년까지 이르고 그 후에는 군주에게로 돌아갈 것이니 군주의 기업은 그 아들이 이어 받을 것임이라

leviticus-27-24.text: In the Jubilee year, the land returns to the family from whom he bought it.
leviticus-27-24.korean: 그가 판 밭은 희년에 그 판 사람 곧 그 땅의 원주인에게로 되돌아갈지니라

leviticus-27-21.text: In the Jubilee year the land will become holy. Then it will belong to the priests.
leviticus-27-21.korean: 희년이 되어서 그 밭이 돌아오게 될 때에는 여호와께 바친 성물이 되어 영영히 드린 땅과 같이 제사장의 기업이 될 것이며

1-chronicles-25-7.text: All those men had skills to make good music, as well as their relatives. There were 288 Levites who served the Lord as musicians.
1-chronicles-25-7.korean: 그들과 모든 형제 곧 여호와 찬송하기를 배워 익숙한 자의 수효가 이백팔십팔 명이라

2-chronicles-9-11.text: The king used the wood to make steps for the Lord's temple and for the king's palace. He also used it to make harps and lyres for the musicians. Nobody had ever seen things like those in Judah.
2-chronicles-9-11.korean: 왕이 백단목으로 여호와의 전과 왕궁의 층대를 만들고 또 노래하는 자들을 위하여 수금과 비파를 만들었으니 이같은 것들은 유다 땅에서 전에는 보지 못하였더라)

1-kings-10-12.text: The king used the wood to make steps for the Lord's temple and for the king's palace. He also used it to make harps and lyres for the musicians. Nobody has ever seen such valuable wood, even until today.
1-kings-10-12.korean: 왕이 백단목으로 여호와의 성전과 왕궁의 난간을 만들고 또 노래하는 자를 위하여 수금과 비파를 만들었으니 이같은 백단목은 전에도 온 일이 없었고 오늘까지도 보지 못하였더라

1-chronicles-15-21.text: They chose these musicians to make music in a special way with lyres: Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel and Azaziah.
1-chronicles-15-21.korean: 맛디디야와 엘리블레후와 믹네야와 오벧에돔과 여이엘과 아사시야는 수금을 타서 여덟째 음에 맞추어 인도하는 자요

1-chronicles-25-8.text: They used lots to decide the right work for each musician. They chose work for everyone in the same way: the young men and the older men, the teachers and the students.
1-chronicles-25-8.korean: 이 무리의 큰 자나 작은 자나 스승이나 제자를 막론하고 다같이 제비 뽑아 직임을 얻었으니

ezekiel-41-14.text: He measured the front of the temple building and the open space on each side. That was 50 metres too.
ezekiel-41-14.korean: 성전 앞면의 너비는 백 척이요 그 앞 동쪽을 향한 뜰의 너비도 그러하며

numbers-22-26.text: Then the angel of the Lord moved on. He stood in a very narrow place where there was no space to turn round.
numbers-22-26.korean: 여호와의 사자가 더 나아가서 좌우로 피할 데 없는 좁은 곳에 선지라

exodus-25-37.text: Then make seven lamps and fix them to the lampstand. Fix them so that they light the space in front of the lampstand.
exodus-25-37.korean: 등잔 일곱을 만들어 그 위에 두어 앞을 비추게 하며

genesis-1-7.text: So God made this wide space. He made the water under the space separate from the water that was above it. What God said happened.
genesis-1-7.korean: 하나님이 궁창을 만드사 궁창 아래의 물과 궁창 위의 물로 나뉘게 하시니 그대로 되니라

job-26-7.text: He puts the skies in their place in the north, so that they cover empty space. He hangs the earth in the skies and it stays there. He puts the skies in their place in the north,
job-26-7.korean: 그는 북쪽을 허공에 펴시며 땅을 아무것도 없는 곳에 매다시며

joshua-19-32.text: The sixth part of the land was for Naphtali's tribe, clan by clan.
joshua-19-32.korean: 여섯째로 납달리 자손을 위하여 납달리 자손의 가족대로 제비를 뽑았으니

1-chronicles-26-3.text: Elam (his fifth son), Jehohanan (his sixth son) and Eliehoenai (his seventh son).
1-chronicles-26-3.korean: 다섯째 엘람과 여섯째 여호하난과 일곱째 엘여호에내이며

leviticus-25-21.text: God will cause a lot of food to grow in the sixth year. They will have food for three more years.
leviticus-25-21.korean: 내가 명령하여 여섯째 해에 내 복을 너희에게 주어 그 소출이 삼 년 동안 쓰게 하리라

numbers-29-29.text: On the sixth day give eight bulls, two male sheep and 14 male lambs that are a year old. The animals must not have anything wrong with them.
numbers-29-29.korean: 여섯째 날에는 수송아지 여덟 마리와 숫양 두 마리와 일 년 되고 흠 없는 숫양 열네 마리를 드릴 것이며

revelation-9-13.text: Then the sixth angel made a sound with his trumpet. I heard a voice that spoke to him from the four corners of the gold altar. This altar is near to God himself.
revelation-9-13.korean: 여섯째 천사가 나팔을 불매 내가 들으니 하나님 앞 금 제단 네 뿔에서 한 음성이 나서

genesis-39-7.text: After some time had passed, Potiphar's wife saw that Joseph was handsome. She said, ‘Come to bed with me!’
genesis-39-7.korean: 그 후에 그의 주인의 아내가 요셉에게 눈짓하다가 동침하기를 청하니

daniel-1-15.text: After ten days, their faces seemed more handsome than the young men who ate the king's food. Their bodies also seemed to be fatter.
daniel-1-15.korean: 열흘 후에 그들의 얼굴이 더욱 아름답고 살이 더욱 윤택하여 왕의 음식을 먹는 다른 소년들보다 더 좋아 보인지라

1-samuel-16-12.text: So Jesse told his men to bring his youngest son for Samuel to see. This young man was handsome and strong and he had beautiful eyes.
1-samuel-16-12.korean: 이에 사람을 보내어 그를 데려오매 그의 빛이 붉고 눈이 빼어나고 얼굴이 아름답더라 여호와께서 이르시되 이가 그니 일어나 기름을 부으라 하시는지라

1-kings-1-6.text: His father, David, had never warned him when he did something wrong. He never asked Adonijah, ‘Why are you doing that?’ Adonijah was also very handsome. He was born after Absalom as David's next son.
1-kings-1-6.korean: 그는 압살롬 다음에 태어난 자요 용모가 심히 준수한 자라 그의 아버지가 네가 어찌하여 그리 하였느냐고 하는 말로 한 번도 그를 섭섭하게 한 일이 없었더라

song-of-solomon-1-16.text: My lover, I see that you are very handsome! Yes, you are lovely! This field of fresh, green grass is our comfortable bed. My lover, I see that you are very handsome! Yes, you are lovely! This field of fresh, green grass is our comfortable bed. My lover, I see that you are very handsome!
song-of-solomon-1-16.korean: 나의 사랑하는 자야 너는 어여쁘고 화창하다 우리의 침상은 푸르고

numbers-19-4.text: Eleazar must take some of the blood from the cow. He must splash it seven times in front of the Tent of Meeting.
numbers-19-4.korean: 제사장 엘르아살은 손가락에 그 피를 찍고 그 피를 회막 앞을 향하여 일곱 번 뿌리고

exodus-24-6.text: Moses took half of the blood of these animals and he put it into some bowls. He splashed the other half of the blood over the altar.
exodus-24-6.korean: 모세가 피를 가지고 반은 여러 양푼에 담고 반은 제단에 뿌리고

2-kings-16-13.text: He made a burnt offering and a grain offering. He poured wine as a drink offering. He splashed the blood from his peace offerings onto the altar.
2-kings-16-13.korean: 자기의 번제물과 소제물을 불사르고 또 전제물을 붓고 수은제 짐승의 피를 제단에 뿌리고

ezekiel-36-25.text: You will become pure, as if I splash you with clean water. I will remove all the things that make you unclean. I will take away the idols that you worship.
ezekiel-36-25.korean: 맑은 물을 너희에게 뿌려서 너희로 정결하게 하되 곧 너희 모든 더러운 것에서와 모든 우상 숭배에서 너희를 정결하게 할 것이며

2-chronicles-35-11.text: Some Levites killed the lambs for the Passover meal. They gave the blood to the priests, and the priests splashed the blood on the altar. At the same time, some Levites were removing the skins from the animals.
2-chronicles-35-11.korean: 유월절 양을 잡으니 제사장들은 그들의 손에서 피를 받아 뿌리고 또 레위 사람들은 잡은 짐승의 가죽을 벗기고

proverbs-17-22.text: If you are happy in life, you will be healthy.
proverbs-17-22.korean: 마음의 즐거움은 양약이라도 심령의 근심은 뼈를 마르게 하느니라

hosea-7-1.text: ‘Yes, I want to make the people of Israel healthy again,
hosea-7-1.korean: 내가 이스라엘을 치료하려 할 때에 에브라임의 죄와 사마리아의 악이 드러나도다 그들은 거짓을 행하며 안으로 들어가 도둑질하고 밖으로 떼 지어 노략질하며

deuteronomy-28-18.text: God will curse your children and the crops that you grow. Your cows and your sheep will not give birth to healthy babies.
deuteronomy-28-18.korean: 네 몸의 소생과 네 토지의 소산과 네 소와 양의 새끼가 저주를 받을 것이며

1-samuel-17-42.text: As he came nearer, the Philistine looked carefully at David. He saw that David was no more than a healthy, handsome boy. That made him laugh at David.
1-samuel-17-42.korean: 그 블레셋 사람이 둘러보다가 다윗을 보고 업신여기니 이는 그가 젊고 붉고 용모가 아름다움이라

isaiah-10-16.text: So the Lord, the Almighty Lord, will punish Assyria's soldiers. They are now fat and healthy, but they will become thin! It will be like a fire that burns them, with all their proud strength.
isaiah-10-16.korean: 그러므로 주 만군의 여호와께서 살진 자를 파리하게 하시며 그의 영화 아래에 불이 붙는 것 같이 맹렬히 타게 하실 것이라

2-chronicles-13-6.text: Nebat's son Jeroboam was a servant of David's son, King Solomon. But he turned against his master.
2-chronicles-13-6.korean: 다윗의 아들 솔로몬의 신하 느밧의 아들 여로보암이 일어나 자기의 주를 배반하고

1-kings-15-1.text: Abijah became king of Judah after Nebat's son Jeroboam had been king of Israel for 18 years. Kings 14 Kings 16
1-kings-15-1.korean: 느밧의 아들 여로보암 왕 열여덟째 해에 아비얌이 유다 왕이 되고

2-kings-9-9.text: I will destroy Ahab's family as I did to the family of Nebat's son Jeroboam and the family of Ahijah's son Baasha.
2-kings-9-9.korean: 아합의 집을 느밧의 아들 여로보암의 집과 같게 하며 또 아히야의 아들 바아사의 집과 같게 할지라

1-kings-16-3.text: So now I am ready to destroy you and your family. I will remove your family as I did to the family of Nebat's son Jeroboam.
1-kings-16-3.korean: 내가 너 바아사와 네 집을 쓸어버려 네 집이 느밧의 아들 여로보암의 집 같이 되게 하리니

1-kings-11-26.text: Nebat's son Jeroboam was one of Solomon's officers. He came from Zeredah in Ephraim. His mother was a widow. Her name was Zeruah. Jeroboam turned against King Solomon.
1-kings-11-26.korean: 솔로몬의 신하 느밧의 아들 여로보암이 또한 손을 들어 왕을 대적하였으니 그는 에브라임 족속인 스레다 사람이요 그의 어머니의 이름은 스루아이니 과부더라

revelation-12-8.text: But the dragon and his army were not strong enough to win the battle. They no longer had a place for themselves in heaven.
revelation-12-8.korean: 이기지 못하여 다시 하늘에서 그들이 있을 곳을 얻지 못한지라

revelation-12-3.text: Then another wonderful thing appeared in the sky. It was a very big red dragon. It had seven heads and ten horns. There was a crown on each head.
revelation-12-3.korean: 하늘에 또 다른 이적이 보이니 보라 한 큰 붉은 용이 있어 머리가 일곱이요 뿔이 열이라 그 여러 머리에 일곱 왕관이 있는데

revelation-12-7.text: Then a war started in heaven. Michael and his angels fought against the dragon. The dragon and his army of angels fought against Michael and his angels.
revelation-12-7.korean: 하늘에 전쟁이 있으니 미가엘과 그의 사자들이 용과 더불어 싸울새 용과 그의 사자들도 싸우나

revelation-20-2.text: He took hold of the dragon. That dragon is the Devil and Satan. He is the snake who has lived since long ago. The angel tied up the dragon with the chain for 1,000 years.
revelation-20-2.korean: 용을 잡으니 곧 옛 뱀이요 마귀요 사탄이라 잡아서 천 년 동안 결박하여

revelation-16-13.text: Then I saw three bad spirits that looked like frogs. One bad spirit came out of the dragon's mouth. Another one came out of the first wild animal's mouth. The third one came out of the false prophet's mouth.
revelation-16-13.korean: 또 내가 보매 개구리 같은 세 더러운 영이 용의 입과 짐승의 입과 거짓 선지자의 입에서 나오니

exodus-40-24.text: He also put the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting. He put it on the south side of the Holy Place, opposite the table.
exodus-40-24.korean: 그는 또 회막 안 곧 성막 남쪽에 등잔대를 놓아 상과 마주하게 하고

joshua-18-17.text: Then it went north to En Shemesh. It continued to Geliloth, opposite the valley of Adummim. Then it went to the great stone of Bohan, Reuben's son.
joshua-18-17.korean: 또 북쪽으로 접어들어 엔 세메스로 나아가서 아둠밈 비탈 맞은편 글릴롯으로 나아가서 르우벤 자손 보한의 돌까지 내려가고

ezekiel-42-8.text: The row of rooms in the outside yard was also 25 metres long. But the other row of rooms in the inside yard, opposite the temple, was 50 metres long.
ezekiel-42-8.korean: 바깥뜰로 향한 방의 길이는 쉰 척이며 성전 앞을 향한 방은 백 척이며

genesis-15-10.text: Abram brought the three animals and the two birds to offer to God. Abram cut each animal in two pieces. He put the halves opposite each other. But he did not cut the birds in two pieces.
genesis-15-10.korean: 아브람이 그 모든 것을 가져다가 그 중간을 쪼개고 그 쪼갠 것을 마주 대하여 놓고 그 새는 쪼개지 아니하였으며

nehemiah-12-24.text: The leaders of the Levites were: Hashabiah, Sherebiah, Kadmiel's son, Jeshua, and their relatives. The two groups stood opposite each other to sing and praise and thank God. They did this in the way that God's servant, King David, had commanded. The leaders of the Levites were:
nehemiah-12-24.korean: 레위 족속의 지도자들은 하사뱌와 세레뱌와 갓미엘의 아들 예수아라 그들은 그들의 형제의 맞은편에 있어 하나님의 사람 다윗의 명령대로 순서를 따라 주를 찬양하며 감사하고

ezekiel-39-20.text: I will give you horses and their riders to eat. I will give you great men and many kinds of soldiers to eat,” says the Lord God.
ezekiel-39-20.korean: 내 상에서 말과 기병과 용사와 모든 군사를 배부르게 먹일지니라 하라 주 여호와의 말씀이니라

isaiah-22-6.text: Elam's soldiers came with bows and arrows. They came with chariots and riders on horses. Kir's soldiers prepared their shields to fight.
isaiah-22-6.korean: 엘람 사람은 화살통을 메었고 병거 탄 자와 마병이 함께 하였고 기르 사람은 방패를 드러냈으니

2-kings-18-23.text: So you should make an agreement with my master, the king of Assyria. I will give you 2,000 horses if you have enough riders to put on them.
2-kings-18-23.korean: 청하건대 이제 너는 내 주 앗수르 왕과 내기하라 네가 만일 말을 탈 사람을 낼 수 있다면 나는 네게 말 이천 마리를 주리라

exodus-14-23.text: The Egyptians followed the Israelites into the middle of the sea to catch them. All Pharaoh's horses, his chariots and their riders did this.
exodus-14-23.korean: 애굽 사람들과 바로의 말들, 병거들과 그 마병들이 다 그들의 뒤를 추격하여 바다 가운데로 들어오는지라

jeremiah-51-21.text: I have used you to destroy whole armies, with their horses, chariots and riders. I have used you to destroy whole armies, with their horses, chariots and riders. I have used you to destroy whole armies,
jeremiah-51-21.korean: 네가 말과 기마병을 분쇄하며 네가 병거와 병거대를 부수며

1-chronicles-11-13.text: Eleazar was with David at Pas-Dammim. The Philistine soldiers were ready to attack the Israelites. There was a field there with a lot of barley. The Israelites ran away from the Philistines.
1-chronicles-11-13.korean: 그가 바스담밈에서 다윗과 함께 있었더니 블레셋 사람들이 그 곳에 모여와서 치니 거기에 보리가 많이 난 밭이 있더라 백성들이 블레셋 사람들 앞에서 도망하되

leviticus-2-8.text: He must give the cake to the priest. The priest will take it to the altar.
leviticus-2-8.korean: 너는 이것들로 만든 소제물을 여호와께로 가져다가 제사장에게 줄 것이요 제사장은 그것을 제단으로 가져가서

2-samuel-13-11.text: But when she offered the cakes to him, he took hold of her. He said to her, ‘Come here, my sister! Come into bed with me.’
2-samuel-13-11.korean: 그에게 먹이려고 가까이 가지고 갈 때에 암논이 그를 붙잡고 그에게 이르되 나의 누이야 와서 나와 동침하자 하는지라

jeremiah-44-19.text: The women said, ‘It is true that we offered sacrifices and drink offerings to the Queen of Heaven. We also made cakes that were like her image. But our husbands knew what we were doing and they helped us.’
jeremiah-44-19.korean: 여인들은 이르되 우리가 하늘의 여왕에게 분향하고 그 앞에 전제를 드릴 때에 어찌 우리 남편의 허락이 없이 그의 형상과 같은 과자를 만들어 놓고 전제를 드렸느냐 하는지라

numbers-11-8.text: The people walked about and they picked it up from the ground. They used stones to make it into flour. Or they beat it with a stick. They boiled it in pots, and they made cakes with it. The taste of the cakes was like olive oil.
numbers-11-8.korean: 백성이 두루 다니며 그것을 거두어 맷돌에 갈기도 하며 절구에 찧기도 하고 가마에 삶기도 하여 과자를 만들었으니 그 맛이 기름 섞은 과자 맛 같았더라

1-samuel-16-21.text: David went to Saul. He became Saul's servant. Saul loved David. David carried Saul's armour for him.
1-samuel-16-21.korean: 다윗이 사울에게 이르러 그 앞에 모셔 서매 사울이 그를 크게 사랑하여 자기의 무기를 드는 자로 삼고

job-41-13.text: Nobody is able to remove their thick skin. It is like armour that nobody can cut through. Nobody is able to remove their thick skin.
job-41-13.korean: 누가 그것의 겉가죽을 벗기겠으며 그것에게 겹재갈을 물릴 수 있겠느냐

2-chronicles-26-14.text: Uzziah gave shields, spears, helmets and armour to the whole army. He also gave them bows and arrows, and stones to put in their slings.
2-chronicles-26-14.korean: 웃시야가 그의 온 군대를 위하여 방패와 창과 투구와 갑옷과 활과 물매 돌을 준비하고

nehemiah-4-16.text: After that day, half of my men continued to do the work on the wall. The other half carried spears, shields and bows. They also wore armour. The officers stood behind the people while they built the wall.
nehemiah-4-16.korean: 그 때로부터 내 수하 사람들의 절반은 일하고 절반은 갑옷을 입고 창과 방패와 활을 가졌고 민장은 유다 온 족속의 뒤에 있었으며

ephesians-6-11.text: Use all the help that God gives to us. Then you can be like a soldier who fights against the Devil. You must put on the whole armour that God gives to us. The Devil attacks us in clever ways, and we need to be strong.
ephesians-6-11.korean: 마귀의 간계를 능히 대적하기 위하여 하나님의 전신 갑주를 입으라

amos-3-8.text: So now the lion has roared! Everyone should be afraid! The Lord God has spoken, so his prophets must tell his message.
amos-3-8.korean: 사자가 부르짖은즉 누가 두려워하지 아니하겠느냐 주 여호와께서 말씀하신즉 누가 예언하지 아니하겠느냐

isaiah-5-29.text: As they march to fight, they roar like lions. They are like strong young lions that catch other animals to eat. They carry their prisoners away to places where nobody can rescue them.
isaiah-5-29.korean: 그들의 부르짖음은 암사자 같을 것이요 그들의 소리지름은 어린 사자들과 같을 것이라 그들이 부르짖으며 먹이를 움켜 가져가 버려도 건질 자가 없으리로다

jeremiah-51-16.text: When he shouts like thunder, the water in the sky roars. He brings the clouds from the far places of the earth. He causes bright lightning to show in the storms. He opens his rooms so that the wind comes out and it blows everywhere. When he shouts like thunder,
jeremiah-51-16.korean: 그가 목소리를 내신즉 하늘에 많은 물이 생기나니 그는 땅 끝에서 구름이 오르게 하시며 비를 위하여 번개를 치게 하시며 그의 곳간에서 바람을 내시거늘

exodus-8-23.text: I will make a difference between my people and your people. This miracle will happen tomorrow.” ’
exodus-8-23.korean: 내가 내 백성과 네 백성 사이를 구별하리니 내일 이 표징이 있으리라 하셨다 하라 하시고

acts-15-9.text: He made no difference between them and us. When they believed in Jesus, he saved them. He made them clean inside.
acts-15-9.korean: 믿음으로 그들의 마음을 깨끗이 하사 그들이나 우리나 차별하지 아니하셨느니라

1-corinthians-12-16.text: If the ear could speak, it might say, ‘I am not an eye, so I do not belong to this body.’ But what it says makes no difference. It still belongs to the body.
1-corinthians-12-16.korean: 또 귀가 이르되 나는 눈이 아니니 몸에 붙지 아니하였다 할지라도 이로써 몸에 붙지 아니한 것이 아니니

malachi-3-18.text: Because of that, you will see again that I am kind to good people, but I punish wicked people. I show the difference between people who serve me well and those who do not.’
malachi-3-18.korean: 그 때에 너희가 돌아와서 의인과 악인을 분별하고 하나님을 섬기는 자와 섬기지 아니하는 자를 분별하리라

ecclesiastes-2-14.text: Wise people can see where they are going. Foolish people walk in the dark. But at the end of their lives, there is no difference. They both die. Wise people can see where they are going.
ecclesiastes-2-14.korean: 지혜자는 그의 눈이 그의 머리 속에 있고 우매자는 어둠 속에 다니지만 그들 모두가 당하는 일이 모두 같으리라는 것을 나도 깨달아 알았도다

exodus-16-24.text: So they kept some food until the morning, as Moses had said. This time, the food did not have a bad smell and there were no worms in it.
exodus-16-24.korean: 그들이 모세의 명령대로 아침까지 간수하였으나 냄새도 나지 아니하고 벌레도 생기지 아니한지라

acts-13-36.text: While David was alive, he served God as God wanted him to do. Then he died and men buried him next to his ancestors. So worms destroyed David's body.
acts-13-36.korean: 다윗은 당시에 하나님의 뜻을 따라 섬기다가 잠들어 그 조상들과 함께 묻혀 썩음을 당하였으되

deuteronomy-28-39.text: You will plant vineyards to grow grapes. You will take care of the plants. But you will not drink any wine or bring in any grapes. Instead, worms will eat them.
deuteronomy-28-39.korean: 네가 포도원을 심고 가꿀지라도 벌레가 먹으므로 포도를 따지 못하고 포도주를 마시지 못할 것이며

isaiah-14-11.text: Your great power has now come down low, into the deep hole of death. People no longer praise you with their harps. Now you will lie on a bed of maggots. A blanket of worms will cover you.
isaiah-14-11.korean: 네 영화가 스올에 떨어졌음이여 네 비파 소리까지로다 구더기가 네 아래에 깔림이여 지렁이가 너를 덮었도다

amos-4-9.text: ‘I sent hot winds from the east. They burned the small plants, so those plants died. Worms made the other plants sick. So the other plants died. Locusts ate your trees that give fruit. But still you did not start to pray to me again.’ The Lord says this!.
amos-4-9.korean: 내가 곡식을 마르게 하는 재앙과 깜부기 재앙으로 너희를 쳤으며 팥중이로 너희의 많은 동산과 포도원과 무화과나무와 감람나무를 다 먹게 하였으나 너희가 내게로 돌아오지 아니하였느니라 여호와의 말씀이니라

leviticus-9-1.text: On the eighth day, Moses told Aaron and his sons and the leaders of Israel that they must come.
leviticus-9-1.korean: 여덟째 날에 모세가 아론과 그의 아들들과 이스라엘 장로들을 불러다가

numbers-29-35.text: On the eighth day, all the people must come together for a holy meeting. You must not work at your jobs.
numbers-29-35.korean: 여덟째 날에는 장엄한 대회로 모일 것이요 아무 일도 하지 말 것이며

1-chronicles-26-5.text: Ammiel (his sixth son), Issachar (his seventh son) and Peullethai (his eighth son). God blessed Obed-Edom with those eight sons.
1-chronicles-26-5.korean: 여섯째 암미엘과 일곱째 잇사갈과 여덟째 브울래대이니 이는 하나님이 오벧에돔에게 복을 주셨음이라

exodus-22-30.text: Do the same thing with your cows and your sheep. Let them stay with their mothers for seven days. But on the eighth day, you must give them to me.
exodus-22-30.korean: 네 소와 양도 그와 같이 하되 이레 동안 어미와 함께 있게 하다가 여드레 만에 내게 줄지니라

revelation-17-11.text: The wild animal is a picture of an eighth king. He was alive once, but he is not alive now. He belongs to the group of seven kings, but God will destroy him completely.
revelation-17-11.korean: 전에 있었다가 지금 없어진 짐승은 여덟째 왕이니 일곱 중에 속한 자라 그가 멸망으로 들어가리라

job-39-14.text: A mother ostrich leaves her eggs on the ground. She lets the sand cause them to be warm. A mother ostrich leaves her eggs on the ground. She lets the sand cause them to be warm. A mother ostrich leaves her eggs on the ground.
job-39-14.korean: 그것이 알을 땅에 버려두어 흙에서 더워지게 하고

job-39-13.text: When an ostrich is happy, it waves its wings. But it cannot use its wings to fly, as a stork can do. When an ostrich is happy, it waves its wings. But it cannot use its wings to fly, as a stork can do. When an ostrich is happy,
job-39-13.korean: 타조는 즐거이 날개를 치나 학의 깃털과 날개 같겠느냐

job-39-17.text: This is because I did not give wisdom to ostriches. I did not give them minds that understand things. This is because I did not give wisdom to ostriches. I did not give them minds that understand things. This is because I did not give wisdom to ostriches.
job-39-17.korean: 이는 하나님이 지혜를 베풀지 아니하셨고 총명을 주지 아니함이라

1-corinthians-16-6.text: I will probably remain with you for some time. I may even stay for the whole winter. Then you can help me to continue my journey to the next place. I am not sure yet where that may be.
1-corinthians-16-6.korean: 혹 너희와 함께 머물며 겨울을 지낼 듯도 하니 이는 너희가 나를 내가 갈 곳으로 보내어 주게 하려 함이라

proverbs-26-24.text: A hypocrite can say nice things to hide his thoughts,
proverbs-26-24.korean: 원수는 입술로는 꾸미고 속으로는 속임을 품나니

matthew-15-7.text: You are hypocrites! What God's prophet Isaiah wrote about you long ago is true:
matthew-15-7.korean: 외식하는 자들아 이사야가 너희에 관하여 잘 예언하였도다 일렀으되

mark-7-6.text: Jesus said to them, ‘You are hypocrites! What God's prophet Isaiah wrote about you long ago is true:
mark-7-6.korean: 이르시되 이사야가 너희 외식하는 자에 대하여 잘 예언하였도다 기록하였으되 이 백성이 입술로는 나를 공경하되 마음은 내게서 멀도다

romans-12-9.text: Really love other people, not like a hypocrite. Hate anything that is bad. Continue to do things that are good.
romans-12-9.korean: 사랑에는 거짓이 없나니 악을 미워하고 선에 속하라

1-timothy-4-2.text: The people who teach those false things are hypocrites. They no longer understand that what they teach is wrong.
1-timothy-4-2.korean: 자기 양심이 화인을 맞아서 외식함으로 거짓말하는 자들이라

genesis-7-15.text: Pairs of every kind of animal that lived came to Noah and went into the ship.
genesis-7-15.korean: 무릇 생명의 기운이 있는 육체가 둘씩 노아에게 나아와 방주로 들어갔으니

judges-15-4.text: So he went out and he caught 300 foxes. He tied the foxes in pairs by their tails. He tied some dry grass to each pair of tails.
judges-15-4.korean: 삼손이 가서 여우 삼백 마리를 붙들어서 그 꼬리와 꼬리를 매고 홰를 가지고 그 두 꼬리 사이에 한 홰를 달고

job-1-3.text: He had 7,000 sheep and 3,000 camels. He had 500 pairs of oxen and 500 donkeys. He also had many servants. He was the richest person in the east part of the world.
job-1-3.korean: 그의 소유물은 양이 칠천 마리요 낙타가 삼천 마리요 소가 오백 겨리요 암나귀가 오백 마리이며 종도 많이 있었으니 이 사람은 동방 사람 중에 가장 훌륭한 자라

luke-14-19.text: The next man said, “I have bought five pairs of oxen. So I am just going out to see if they work well together. Please say that I am sorry. Tell your master that I cannot come to his meal.”
luke-14-19.korean: 또 한 사람은 이르되 나는 소 다섯 겨리를 샀으매 시험하러 가니 청컨대 나를 양해하도록 하라 하고

amos-8-6.text: When poor people cannot pay their debts, you buy them as your slaves. You pay a silver coin to buy them, which would not even buy a pair of shoes. You also mix dust with the grain that you sell.
amos-8-6.korean: 은으로 힘없는 자를 사며 신 한 켤레로 가난한 자를 사며 찌꺼기 밀을 팔자 하는도다

leviticus-9-19.text: Aaron took the fat tail, the fat and the kidneys and the best piece of the liver.
leviticus-9-19.korean: 그들이 또 수소와 숫양의 기름과 기름진 꼬리와 내장에 덮인 것과 콩팥과 간 꺼풀을 아론에게로 가져다가

isaiah-9-15.text: The head is their leaders and important people. The tail is the prophets who teach lies.
isaiah-9-15.korean: 그 머리는 곧 장로와 존귀한 자요 그 꼬리는 곧 거짓말을 가르치는 선지자라

revelation-9-19.text: The horses had great power in their mouths and in their tails. Their tails were like snakes, with heads that could hurt people very much.
revelation-9-19.korean: 이 말들의 힘은 입과 꼬리에 있으니 꼬리는 뱀 같고 또 꼬리에 머리가 있어 이것으로 해하더라

exodus-4-4.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, ‘Take hold of the snake's tail with your hand.’ So Moses caught the snake with his hand. Then it became a stick in his hand again.
exodus-4-4.korean: 여호와께서 모세에게 이르시되 네 손을 내밀어 그 꼬리를 잡으라 그가 손을 내밀어 그것을 잡으니 그의 손에서 지팡이가 된지라

judges-16-19.text: Delilah made Samson sleep with his head on her knees. She called a man to come and he cut off the seven tails of Samson's hair. This made Samson helpless, so that he had no more strength.
judges-16-19.korean: 들릴라가 삼손에게 자기 무릎을 베고 자게 하고 사람을 불러 그의 머리털 일곱 가닥을 밀고 괴롭게 하여 본즉 그의 힘이 없어졌더라

proverbs-16-28.text: People who tell lies cause arguments.
proverbs-16-28.korean: 패역한 자는 다툼을 일으키고 말쟁이는 친한 벗을 이간하느니라

deuteronomy-1-12.text: But I cannot help you with your troubles and arguments all by myself.
deuteronomy-1-12.korean: 그런즉 나 홀로 어찌 능히 너희의 괴로운 일과 너희의 힘겨운 일과 너희의 다투는 일을 담당할 수 있으랴

job-17-4.text: You have stopped my friends from thinking properly. So do not allow them to win the argument. You have stopped my friends from thinking properly.
job-17-4.korean: 주께서 그들의 마음을 가리어 깨닫지 못하게 하셨사오니 그들을 높이지 마소서

exodus-24-14.text: Moses said to the leaders, ‘Wait here for us. We will come back to you. Aaron and Hur are here with you. If you have any arguments, they can decide who is right.’
exodus-24-14.korean: 장로들에게 이르되 너희는 여기서 우리가 너희에게로 돌아오기까지 기다리라 아론과 훌이 너희와 함께 하리니 무릇 일이 있는 자는 그들에게로 나아갈지니라 하고

1-kings-7-7.text: Solomon also built a Throne Room. He covered the walls with cedar boards, from the floor to the ceiling. He called it the Hall of Justice. He judged people's arguments in that room.
1-kings-7-7.korean: 또 심판하기 위하여 보좌의 주랑 곧 재판하는 주랑을 짓고 온 마루를 백향목으로 덮었고

exodus-28-16.text: Bend a piece of cloth over to make a square pocket, 22 centimetres long and 22 centimetres wide.
exodus-28-16.korean: 길이와 너비가 한 뼘씩 두 겹으로 네모 반듯하게 하고

ezekiel-40-12.text: There was a low wall in front of the rooms on each side of the passage. It was ½ metre high. The rooms were 3 metres square.
ezekiel-40-12.korean: 방 앞에 간막이 벽이 있는데 이쪽 간막이 벽도 한 척이요 저쪽 간막이 벽도 한 척이며 그 방은 이쪽도 여섯 척이요 저쪽도 여섯 척이며

1-kings-7-31.text: On the top of the cart there was a round piece which held a bowl. This piece was 50 centimetres deep and 75 centimetres across. Hiram cut pictures into the metal all around it. The bronze sides of the carts were square. They were not round.
1-kings-7-31.korean: 그 받침 수레 위로 들이켜 높이가 한 규빗 되게 내민 것이 있고 그 면은 직경 한 규빗 반 되게 반원형으로 우묵하며 그 나머지 면에는 아로새긴 것이 있으며 그 내민 판들은 네모지고 둥글지 아니하며

exodus-39-9.text: They bent a piece of cloth over to make a square pocket, 22 centimetres long and 22 centimetres wide.
exodus-39-9.korean: 그것의 길이가 한 뼘, 너비가 한 뼘으로 네 모가 반듯하고 두 겹이며

leviticus-8-8.text: Moses put the breastpiece on Aaron, and he put the Urim and Thummim in its pocket.
leviticus-8-8.korean: 흉패를 붙이고 흉패에 우림과 둠밈을 넣고

exodus-39-16.text: Then they made two gold rings with beautiful gold around the edges. They fixed the rings to the two top corners of the breastpiece.
exodus-39-16.korean: 또 금 테 둘과 금 고리 둘을 만들어 그 두 고리를 흉패 두 끝에 달고

exodus-39-19.text: They made two gold rings and they fixed them to the bottom corners of the breastpiece. They were on its inside edge, next to the ephod.
exodus-39-19.korean: 또 금 고리 둘을 만들어 흉패 두 끝에 달았으니 곧 그 에봇을 마주한 안쪽 가장자리에 달았으며

exodus-29-5.text: Then take the special clothes. Dress Aaron in the shirt, the robe, the ephod and the breastpiece. Tie the ephod on him with its special belt.
exodus-29-5.korean: 의복을 가져다가 아론에게 속옷과 에봇 받침 겉옷과 에봇을 입히고 흉패를 달고 에봇에 정교하게 짠 띠를 띠게 하고

exodus-28-26.text: Make two gold rings and fix them to the two bottom corners of the breastpiece. Put them on its inside edge, so that they are next to the ephod.
exodus-28-26.korean: 또 금 고리 둘을 만들어 흉패 아래 양쪽 가 안쪽 곧 에봇에 닿은 곳에 달고

job-8-15.text: If they expect something like that to help them,
job-8-15.korean: 그 집을 의지할지라도 집이 서지 못하고 굳게 붙잡아 주어도 집이 보존되지 못하리라

hebrews-11-14.text: People who live in that way show that they expect to live somewhere else one day. That is the place where they will really be at home.
hebrews-11-14.korean: 그들이 이같이 말하는 것은 자기들이 본향 찾는 자임을 나타냄이라

ephesians-4-4.text: As God's people, you are like one body. There is one Spirit that gives you life. God has chosen you to be his own people. So you all expect to receive the same great things from God.
ephesians-4-4.korean: 몸이 하나요 성령도 한 분이시니 이와 같이 너희가 부르심의 한 소망 안에서 부르심을 받았느니라

isaiah-10-20.text: At that time, only a few people will remain in Israel. Only a few descendants of Jacob will still be alive. They will no longer expect to receive help from a foreign ruler who is cruel to them. Instead, they will trust the Lord, the Holy God of Israel, to help them.
isaiah-10-20.korean: 그 날에 이스라엘의 남은 자와 야곱 족속의 피난한 자들이 다시는 자기를 친 자를 의지하지 아니하고 이스라엘의 거룩하신 이 여호와를 진실하게 의지하리니

judges-18-27.text: The men of Dan took the idols that Micah had made, as well as his priest. Then they arrived at Laish. The people who lived there were not expecting any trouble. The soldiers of Dan attacked the people with their weapons and they killed them. They destroyed the city with fire.
judges-18-27.korean: 단 자손이 미가가 만든 것과 그 제사장을 취하여 라이스에 이르러 한가하고 걱정 없이 사는 백성을 만나 칼날로 그들을 치며 그 성읍을 불사르되

1-samuel-10-20.text: So each tribe came forward to Samuel, tribe by tribe. God chose Benjamin's tribe.
1-samuel-10-20.korean: 사무엘이 이에 이스라엘 모든 지파를 가까이 오게 하였더니 베냐민 지파가 뽑혔고

judges-20-20.text: The Israelite army marched forward to fight against Benjamin's army. They stood in their places around the city.
judges-20-20.korean: 이스라엘 사람이 나가 베냐민과 싸우려고 전열을 갖추고 기브아에서 그들과 싸우고자 하매

job-30-14.text: I cannot stop them when they attack me. They rush forward to knock me down. I cannot stop them when they attack me.
job-30-14.korean: 그들은 성을 파괴하고 그 파괴한 가운데로 몰려드는 것 같이 내게로 달려드니

ezekiel-10-22.text: They had the same four faces that I had seen beside the River Kebar. Each of them moved forward and they did not turn.
ezekiel-10-22.korean: 그 얼굴의 형상은 내가 그발 강 가에서 보던 얼굴이며 그 모양과 그 몸도 그러하며 각기 곧게 앞으로 가더라

nahum-2-5.text: The army leader chooses his best soldiers to go forward. They almost fall as they run! They hurry to the city wall and they prepare to attack.
nahum-2-5.korean: 그가 그의 존귀한 자들을 생각해 내니 그들이 엎드러질 듯이 달려서 급히 성에 이르러 막을 것을 준비하도다

ezekiel-42-9.text: The lowest level of rooms had an entrance from the outside yard at the east end of the building.
ezekiel-42-9.korean: 이 방들 아래에 동쪽에서 들어가는 통행구가 있으니 곧 바깥뜰에서 들어가는 통행구더라

1-kings-6-8.text: The door to the lowest level of rooms on the sides of the temple was on the south side of the temple. Stairs went up to the middle level and to the top level.
1-kings-6-8.korean: 중층 골방의 문은 성전 오른쪽에 있는데 나사 모양 층계로 말미암아 하층에서 중층에 오르고 중층에서 셋째 층에 오르게 하였더라

1-kings-6-5.text: Solomon built rooms around the outside of the temple walls. These rooms continued outside the big hall and the inside room. The side rooms were on three levels.
1-kings-6-5.korean: 또 성전의 벽 곧 성소와 지성소의 벽에 연접하여 돌아가며 다락들을 건축하되 다락마다 돌아가며 골방들을 만들었으니

ezekiel-42-6.text: They did not have pillars to hold them up as other rooms in the temple yards did. Instead, the walls of the lower rooms held up the rooms above them. So the rooms of each level were smaller than the rooms below them.
ezekiel-42-6.korean: 그 방은 삼층인데도 뜰의 기둥 같은 기둥이 없으므로 그 위층이 아래층과 가운데 층보다 더욱 좁아짐이더라

ezekiel-42-5.text: The rooms at the top level were not as wide as the rooms below them. And the rooms at the middle level were not as wide as the rooms at the lowest level. This was because the higher rooms needed more space in front of them.
ezekiel-42-5.korean: 그 위층의 방은 가장 좁으니 이는 회랑들로 말미암아 아래층과 가운데 층보다 위층이 더 줄어짐이라

daniel-2-31.text: Daniel said, ‘In your dream, you saw in front of you a statue with a man's shape. It was very big and very bright. It frightened people very much.
daniel-2-31.korean: 왕이여 왕이 한 큰 신상을 보셨나이다 그 신상이 왕의 앞에 섰는데 크고 광채가 매우 찬란하며 그 모양이 심히 두려우니

2-chronicles-13-8.text: Now you want to fight against the Lord's own kingdom that he has chosen David's descendants to rule over. You have a very large army. You bring with you the gold statues of young bulls that Jeroboam made for you as your gods.
2-chronicles-13-8.korean: 이제 너희가 또 다윗 자손의 손으로 다스리는 여호와의 나라를 대적하려 하는도다 너희는 큰 무리요 또 여로보암이 너희를 위하여 신으로 만든 금송아지들이 너희와 함께 있도다

nahum-1-14.text: Nineveh, the Lord has said what will happen to you. He has said, ‘You will have no children and your family name will have an end. I will destroy the statues that you made from wood and metal. You worship those statues in your temples. There I will make graves for you because you are bad.’
nahum-1-14.korean: 나 여호와가 네게 대하여 명령하였나니 네 이름이 다시는 전파되지 않을 것이라 내가 네 신들의 집에서 새긴 우상과 부은 우상을 멸절하며 네 무덤을 준비하리니 이는 네가 쓸모 없게 되었음이라

daniel-3-10.text: You made a rule. You said that everyone must listen for the sound of the special music. When they hear it, they must bend down and they must worship the gold statue.
daniel-3-10.korean: 왕이여 왕이 명령을 내리사 모든 사람이 나팔과 피리와 수금과 삼현금과 양금과 생황과 및 모든 악기 소리를 듣거든 엎드려 금 신상에게 절할 것이라

daniel-3-1.text: King Nebuchadnezzar caused his workers to make a gold statue. It was 30 metres high and 3 metres wide. He built it on the flat land called Dura, in the Babylon region.
daniel-3-1.korean: 느부갓네살 왕이 금으로 신상을 만들었으니 높이는 육십 규빗이요 너비는 여섯 규빗이라 그것을 바벨론 지방의 두라 평지에 세웠더라

luke-21-30.text: When you see new leaves on a tree, you know that summer will come soon. Nobody needs to tell you that.
luke-21-30.korean: 싹이 나면 너희가 보고 여름이 가까운 줄을 자연히 아나니

proverbs-6-7.text: They have no leader or ruler, 8 but they get their food during the summer. At the time of harvest they store food to prepare for winter.
proverbs-6-7.korean: 개미는 두령도 없고 감독자도 없고 통치자도 없으되

jeremiah-8-20.text: The people say, ‘We have taken in all our crops from the fields. The summer has finished. And still nobody has rescued us.’ The people say,
jeremiah-8-20.korean: 추수할 때가 지나고 여름이 다하였으나 우리는 구원을 얻지 못한다 하는도다

matthew-24-32.text: ‘Here is a lesson for you to learn about the fig tree. When the new branches on the tree start to grow, the leaves appear. Then you know that the summer will come soon.
matthew-24-32.korean: 무화과나무의 비유를 배우라 그 가지가 연하여지고 잎사귀를 내면 여름이 가까운 줄을 아나니

mark-13-28.text: Here is a lesson for you to learn about the fig tree. When the new branches on the tree start to grow, the leaves appear. Then you know that the summer will begin soon.
mark-13-28.korean: 무화과나무의 비유를 배우라 그 가지가 연하여지고 잎사귀를 내면 여름이 가까운 줄 아나니

job-41-1.text: ‘It is the same with the sea monsters called Leviathan.
job-41-1.korean: 네가 낚시로 리워야단을 끌어낼 수 있겠느냐 노끈으로 그 혀를 맬 수 있겠느냐

isaiah-27-1.text: At that time, the Lord will punish Leviathan. The Lord will use his great and powerful sword to destroy that monster. Leviathan is a snake that moves very fast in the sea and it turns in every direction. But the Lord will kill it.
isaiah-27-1.korean: 그 날에 여호와께서 그의 견고하고 크고 강한 칼로 날랜 뱀 리워야단 곧 꼬불꼬불한 뱀 리워야단을 벌하시며 바다에 있는 용을 죽이시리라

job-7-12.text: Why do you have to watch me, God, like a guard? Do you think that I am a dangerous monster from the sea? Why do you have to watch me, God, like a guard?
job-7-12.korean: 내가 바다니이까 바다 괴물이니이까 주께서 어찌하여 나를 지키시나이까

hebrews-6-15.text: Abraham waited patiently for a long time. In the end, he received what God had promised to give him.
hebrews-6-15.korean: 그가 이같이 오래 참아 약속을 받았느니라

2-corinthians-12-12.text: When I was there with you, I showed that I was a true apostle. I worked patiently among you. I did many miracles and great things that showed God's power.
2-corinthians-12-12.korean: 사도의 표가 된 것은 내가 너희 가운데서 모든 참음과 표적과 기사와 능력을 행한 것이라

romans-2-7.text: Some people continue patiently to do good things. They want to do what is right so that God will praise them. They want to live the kind of life which death will not spoil. God will cause people like that to live with him always.
romans-2-7.korean: 참고 선을 행하여 영광과 존귀와 썩지 아니함을 구하는 자에게는 영생으로 하시고

james-5-7.text: So, my Christian friends, be patient until the Lord Jesus returns. Think about how a farmer is patient. He waits for the ground to give him valuable food to eat. He waits patiently for the rain to come in the autumn and in the spring.
james-5-7.korean: 그러므로 형제들아 주께서 강림하시기까지 길이 참으라 보라 농부가 땅에서 나는 귀한 열매를 바라고 길이 참아 이른 비와 늦은 비를 기다리나니

job-14-14.text: If a man dies, will he live again? If I knew that, I would suffer patiently. I would wait until my troubles have finished. If a man dies, will he live again? If I knew that, I would suffer patiently. I would wait until my troubles have finished. If a man dies, will he live again?
job-14-14.korean: 장정이라도 죽으면 어찌 다시 살리이까 나는 나의 모든 고난의 날 동안을 참으면서 풀려나기를 기다리겠나이다

mark-13-18.text: You must pray to God that this time of trouble will not happen in winter.
mark-13-18.korean: 이 일이 겨울에 일어나지 않도록 기도하라

john-10-22.text: It was the time for the Jewish Festival called Hanukkah. This happened in Jerusalem. It was winter.

2-timothy-4-21.text: Please try to come before the winter. Eubulus, Pudens, Linus and Claudia say ‘hello’ to you. All the other believers here also say ‘hello’.
2-timothy-4-21.korean: 너는 겨울 전에 어서 오라 으불로와 부데와 리노와 글라우디아와 모든 형제가 다 네게 문안하느니라

matthew-24-20.text: You must pray to God about this time when you have to run away quickly. Pray that this time of trouble will not happen in winter. Pray that it will not happen on your day of rest.
matthew-24-20.korean: 너희가 도망하는 일이 겨울에나 안식일에 되지 않도록 기도하라

acts-28-11.text: When we left Malta, we had been there for three months. We got on a ship that was called ‘The Twin Gods’. It had come from Alexandria and it had stayed in Malta during the winter.
acts-28-11.korean: 석 달 후에 우리가 그 섬에서 겨울을 난 알렉산드리아 배를 타고 떠나니 그 배의 머리 장식은 디오스구로라

1-john-1-8.text: If we say that we never do any wrong thing, we are deceiving ourselves. Even though we may think it is true, it is a lie.
1-john-1-8.korean: 만일 우리가 죄가 없다고 말하면 스스로 속이고 또 진리가 우리 속에 있지 아니할 것이요

romans-2-26.text: But a Gentile may obey what God's Law teaches. Then he has shown that he belongs to God even though nobody has circumcised him.
romans-2-26.korean: 그런즉 무할례자가 율법의 규례를 지키면 그 무할례를 할례와 같이 여길 것이 아니냐

2-kings-9-32.text: Jehu looked up at the window and he saw her. Then he shouted, ‘Who wants to help me? Anyone there?’ Two or three eunuchs looked out though a window at him.
2-kings-9-32.korean: 예후가 얼굴을 들어 창을 향하고 이르되 내 편이 될 자가 누구냐 누구냐 하니 두어 내시가 예후를 내다보는지라

1-kings-3-13.text: I will give you even more than this. I will make you rich and famous, even though you did not ask for that. As long as you live, there will be no other king who is greater than you.
1-kings-3-13.korean: 내가 또 네가 구하지 아니한 부귀와 영광도 네게 주노니 네 평생에 왕들 중에 너와 같은 자가 없을 것이라

genesis-19-11.text: Then they caused all the men outside to become blind. The young men of the city and the old men all became blind. As a result, they could not find the door of the house, even though they tried for some time.
genesis-19-11.korean: 문 밖의 무리를 대소를 막론하고 그 눈을 어둡게 하니 그들이 문을 찾느라고 헤매었더라

ezekiel-1-28.text: It shone with the colours of a rainbow in the clouds when there is rain. This bright light showed the glory of the Lord, who was there.
ezekiel-1-28.korean: 그 사방 광채의 모양은 비 오는 날 구름에 있는 무지개 같으니 이는 여호와의 영광의 형상의 모양이라 내가 보고 엎드려 말씀하시는 이의 음성을 들으니라

leviticus-13-56.text: The colour of the mark might be less bright, after the people have washed the clothes. If it is, the priest must tear the marked part out of the clothes.
leviticus-13-56.korean: 빤 후에 제사장이 보기에 그 색점이 엷으면 그 의복에서나 가죽에서나 그 날에서나 씨에서나 그 색점을 찢어 버릴 것이요

genesis-31-10.text: One night I had a dream. It was at the time when the animals were becoming pregnant. In the dream, I saw that the male goats had marks and different colours on their skin.
genesis-31-10.korean: 그 양 떼가 새끼 밸 때에 내가 꿈에 눈을 들어 보니 양 떼를 탄 숫양은 다 얼룩무늬 있는 것과 점 있는 것과 아롱진 것이었더라

revelation-21-19.text: The strong stones that were the foundation of the city's wall were very beautiful. They had valuable jewels in them that were different colours. Each great stone had its own special jewel. They were called:
revelation-21-19.korean: 그 성의 성곽의 기초석은 각색 보석으로 꾸몄는데 첫째 기초석은 벽옥이요 둘째는 남보석이요 셋째는 옥수요 넷째는 녹보석이요

job-38-14.text: When the light of day comes, people see the land clearly. Its shape and colours show like bright clothes. When the light of day comes, people see the land clearly. Its shape and colours show like bright clothes. When the light of day comes,
job-38-14.korean: 땅이 변하여 진흙에 인친 것 같이 되었고 그들은 옷 같이 나타나되

proverbs-2-8.text: He protects the lives of righteous people. He takes care of people who serve him faithfully.
proverbs-2-8.korean: 대저 그는 정의의 길을 보호하시며 그의 성도들의 길을 보전하려 하심이니라

job-11-18.text: You will be safe as you trust God. God will protect you. You will be able to rest safely. You will be safe as you trust God.
job-11-18.korean: 네가 희망이 있으므로 안전할 것이며 두루 살펴보고 평안히 쉬리라

genesis-31-7.text: But your father has cheated me many times. He has changed what I receive for my work at least ten times. But God has protected me from him.
genesis-31-7.korean: 그대들의 아버지가 나를 속여 품삯을 열 번이나 변경하였느니라 그러나 하나님이 그를 막으사 나를 해치지 못하게 하셨으며

isaiah-31-5.text: The Lord Almighty will make Jerusalem safe. He will protect it like a bird that protects its nest. He will pass over the city and he will rescue it.
isaiah-31-5.korean: 새가 날개 치며 그 새끼를 보호함 같이 나 만군의 여호와가 예루살렘을 보호할 것이라 그것을 호위하며 건지며 뛰어넘어 구원하리라 하셨느니라

deuteronomy-12-10.text: But when you go across the Jordan River, that land will become your home. The Lord will protect you from all the enemies who are around you. You will live safely.
deuteronomy-12-10.korean: 너희가 요단을 건너 너희 하나님 여호와께서 너희에게 기업으로 주시는 땅에 거주하게 될 때 또는 여호와께서 너희에게 너희 주위의 모든 대적을 이기게 하시고 너희에게 안식을 주사 너희를 평안히 거주하게 하실 때에

exodus-14-7.text: He took 600 of his best chariots with him., as well as all the other chariots of Egypt. All the chariots had officers to drive them.
exodus-14-7.korean: 선발된 병거 육백 대와 애굽의 모든 병거를 동원하니 지휘관들이 다 거느렸더라

acts-8-38.text: The officer said to the man who was driving the chariot, ‘Stop the chariot!’ Then he went down with Philip into the water, and Philip baptized him.
acts-8-38.korean: 이에 명하여 수레를 멈추고 빌립과 내시가 둘 다 물에 내려가 빌립이 세례를 베풀고

jonah-1-13.text: But the sailors did not do what Jonah said. Instead, they tried to use oars to drive the ship back to the land. But the storm was too strong and they could not do that.
jonah-1-13.korean: 그러나 그 사람들이 힘써 노를 저어 배를 육지로 돌리고자 하다가 바다가 그들을 향하여 점점 더 흉용하므로 능히 못한지라

2-kings-9-20.text: The guard reported to Joram, ‘The man has reached them, but he is not coming back yet either. Their leader is driving his chariot like Nimshi's son, Jehu. He drives like a crazy man!’
2-kings-9-20.korean: 파수꾼이 또 전하여 이르되 그도 그들에게까지 갔으나 돌아오지 아니하고 그 병거 모는 것이 님시의 손자 예후가 모는 것 같이 미치게 모나이다 하니

1-samuel-8-11.text: Samuel said to them, ‘This is how the king will rule over you: He will take your sons to be his soldiers. They will ride his horses and they will drive his chariots. They will have to run in front of his own chariot.
1-samuel-8-11.korean: 이르되 너희를 다스릴 왕의 제도는 이러하니라 그가 너희 아들들을 데려다가 그의 병거와 말을 어거하게 하리니 그들이 그 병거 앞에서 달릴 것이며

1-kings-9-17.text: So Solomon built Gezer again. He also built Lower Beth-Horon,

exodus-28-42.text: Use good linen to make trousers that will cover the lower parts of their bodies.
exodus-28-42.korean: 또 그들을 위하여 베로 속바지를 만들어 허리에서부터 두 넓적다리까지 이르게 하여 하체를 가리게 하라

1-chronicles-7-24.text: Beriah's daughter was Sheerah. She built Lower and Higher Beth-Horon. And she built Uzzen-Sheerah.
1-chronicles-7-24.korean: 에브라임의 딸은 세에라이니 그가 아래 윗 성 벧호론과 우센세에라를 건설하였더라

ephesians-4-9.text: It says: ‘He went up.’ That must mean that Christ had also come down. He came down to a lower place, the earth.
ephesians-4-9.korean: 올라가셨다 하였은즉 땅 아래 낮은 곳으로 내리셨던 것이 아니면 무엇이냐

joshua-16-3.text: It continued to the west, to the land of the Japhletites as far as lower Beth Horon and Gezer. The border ended at the sea.
joshua-16-3.korean: 서쪽으로 내려가서 야블렛 족속의 경계와 아래 벧 호론과 게셀에까지 이르고 그 끝은 바다라

luke-2-14.text: ‘God is great! He lives in the highest place above.
luke-2-14.korean: 지극히 높은 곳에서는 하나님께 영광이요 땅에서는 하나님이 기뻐하신 사람들 중에 평화로다 하니라

proverbs-9-3.text: She has sent her servants to shout a message from the highest places in the town.
proverbs-9-3.korean: 자기의 여종을 보내어 성중 높은 곳에서 불러 이르기를

isaiah-2-14.text: He will bring down the high mountains and the highest hills. He will bring down the high mountains and the highest hills.
isaiah-2-14.korean: 모든 높은 산과 모든 솟아 오른 작은 언덕과

deuteronomy-10-14.text: The whole sky and the highest heavens belong to the Lord your God. The earth and everything that is in it also belong to him.
deuteronomy-10-14.korean: 하늘과 모든 하늘의 하늘과 땅과 그 위의 만물은 본래 네 하나님 여호와께 속한 것이로되

john-7-20.text: The crowd answered, ‘You have a demon in you! Nobody is trying to kill you!’
john-7-20.korean: 무리가 대답하되 당신은 귀신이 들렸도다 누가 당신을 죽이려 하나이까

james-2-19.text: You believe that there is only one God. That is good! But even the demons believe that! And it makes them very afraid.
james-2-19.korean: 네가 하나님은 한 분이신 줄을 믿느냐 잘하는도다 귀신들도 믿고 떠느니라

luke-4-33.text: There was a sick man in the meeting place. He had a spirit of a bad demon that was living inside him. The spirit caused the man to shout loudly.
luke-4-33.korean: 회당에 더러운 귀신 들린 사람이 있어 크게 소리 질러 이르되

1-corinthians-10-21.text: If you drink anything from the cup of demons, you can not then drink wine from the Lord's cup. If you share a meal with demons, you can not also share in the Lord's meal.
1-corinthians-10-21.korean: 너희가 주의 잔과 귀신의 잔을 겸하여 마시지 못하고 주의 식탁과 귀신의 식탁에 겸하여 참여하지 못하리라

deuteronomy-32-17.text: They offered sacrifices to demons, instead of to God. They worshipped new gods which they had not known before. Your ancestors had never respected those gods. They offered sacrifices to demons, instead of to God.
deuteronomy-32-17.korean: 그들은 하나님께 제사하지 아니하고 귀신들에게 하였으니 곧 그들이 알지 못하던 신들, 근래에 들어온 새로운 신들 너희의 조상들이 두려워하지 아니하던 것들이로다

1-chronicles-6-15.text: Jehozadak went into exile with the people from Jerusalem and the rest of Judah. The Lord used Nebuchadnezzar to take them away to Babylon.
1-chronicles-6-15.korean: 여호와께서 느부갓네살의 손으로 유다와 예루살렘 백성을 옮기실 때에 여호사닥도 가니라

ezra-1-11.text: There were 5,400 things made from gold and silver. Sheshbazzar took them all with him when he left Babylon to return to Jerusalem with the other exiles.
ezra-1-11.korean: 금, 은 그릇이 모두 오천사백 개라 사로잡힌 자를 바벨론에서 예루살렘으로 데리고 갈 때에 세스바살이 그 그릇들을 다 가지고 갔더라

isaiah-56-8.text: The Almighty Lord is the one who brings together all the Israelite people who are in exile. He says, ‘I will continue to bring more people to join with them.’
isaiah-56-8.korean: 이스라엘의 쫓겨난 자를 모으시는 주 여호와가 말하노니 내가 이미 모은 백성 외에 또 모아 그에게 속하게 하리라 하셨느니라

nehemiah-1-2.text: Hanani, my brother, and some other men arrived from Judah. I asked them for news of the Jews who had returned there from exile in Babylon. I asked them for news about Jerusalem.
nehemiah-1-2.korean: 내 형제들 가운데 하나인 하나니가 두어 사람과 함께 유다에서 내게 이르렀기로 내가 그 사로잡힘을 면하고 남아 있는 유다와 예루살렘 사람들의 형편을 물은즉

jeremiah-3-18.text: At that time, the nations of Judah and Israel will join together as one kingdom. They will leave their exile in a country in the north. They will come back to this land that I gave to your ancestors to be their home for ever.
jeremiah-3-18.korean: 그 때에 유다 족속이 이스라엘 족속과 동행하여 북에서부터 나와서 내가 너희 조상들에게 기업으로 준 땅에 그들이 함께 이르리라

matthew-22-38.text: This is the greatest rule and the most important of all God's Laws.

2-samuel-1-19.text: ‘The greatest men of Israel now lie on the mountains. They are dead!
2-samuel-1-19.korean: 이스라엘아 네 영광이 산 위에서 죽임을 당하였도다 오호라 두 용사가 엎드러졌도다

hebrews-1-6.text: Also, when God was ready to bring his greatest Son into the world, he said:
hebrews-1-6.korean: 또 그가 맏아들을 이끌어 세상에 다시 들어오게 하실 때에 하나님의 모든 천사들은 그에게 경배할지어다 말씀하시며

1-chronicles-12-14.text: These descendants of Gad were leaders in the army. The least important officer among them led 100 soldiers. The greatest officer led 1,000 soldiers.
1-chronicles-12-14.korean: 이 갓 자손이 군대 지휘관이 되어 그 작은 자는 백부장이요, 그 큰 자는 천부장이더니

ezekiel-25-9.text: So listen! I will let enemies attack the towns on the border of Moab. I will destroy their greatest cities, Beth Jeshimoth, Baal Meon and Kiriathaim.
ezekiel-25-9.korean: 그러므로 내가 모압의 한편 곧 그 나라 국경에 있는 영화로운 성읍들 벧여시못과 바알므온과 기랴다임을 열고

john-5-12.text: So they asked him, ‘Who is this man? Who said to you, “Pick up your mat and walk”?’
john-5-12.korean: 그들이 묻되 너에게 자리를 들고 걸어가라 한 사람이 누구냐 하되

acts-9-34.text: Peter said to Aeneas, ‘Jesus Christ now makes you well again! So stand up and put away your mat.’ Immediately Aeneas stood up.
acts-9-34.korean: 베드로가 이르되 애니아야 예수 그리스도께서 너를 낫게 하시니 일어나 네 자리를 정돈하라 한대 곧 일어나니

luke-5-25.text: Immediately, the man stood up in front of them all. He picked up the mat that he had been lying on. He went home. He was praising God as he went.
luke-5-25.korean: 그 사람이 그들 앞에서 곧 일어나 그 누웠던 것을 가지고 하나님께 영광을 돌리며 자기 집으로 돌아가니

mark-2-9.text: I said to this man who cannot walk, “I forgive you for your sins.” Instead, I could have said to him, “Stand up! Pick up your mat and walk.” Which of those is easier for me to say?
mark-2-9.korean: 중풍병자에게 네 죄 사함을 받았느니라 하는 말과 일어나 네 상을 가지고 걸어가라 하는 말 중에서 어느 것이 쉽겠느냐

matthew-9-6.text: But I want you to know this. I, the Son of Man, have authority on earth. I can forgive people for the wrong things that they have done.’ Then he said to the man who could not walk, ‘Stand up. Pick up your mat and go home.’
matthew-9-6.korean: 그러나 인자가 세상에서 죄를 사하는 권능이 있는 줄을 너희로 알게 하려 하노라 하시고 중풍병자에게 말씀하시되 일어나 네 침상을 가지고 집으로 가라 하시니

2-corinthians-2-16.text: For the people who are dying, we are like a bad smell that brings a message of death. But for the people that God is saving, we are like a lovely smell that brings a message of new life.
2-corinthians-2-16.korean: 이 사람에게는 사망으로부터 사망에 이르는 냄새요 저 사람에게는 생명으로부터 생명에 이르는 냄새라 누가 이 일을 감당하리요

ephesians-5-2.text: Show that you love other people. Remember how much Christ loved us. He gave himself as a sacrifice on our behalf. He offered himself in a way that pleased God, like a sacrifice with a lovely smell.
ephesians-5-2.korean: 그리스도께서 너희를 사랑하신 것 같이 너희도 사랑 가운데서 행하라 그는 우리를 위하여 자신을 버리사 향기로운 제물과 희생제물로 하나님께 드리셨느니라

philippians-4-8.text: Now my friends, I want to say this to you. Fill your minds with thoughts about good things. Think about things that are true, clean, right and lovely. Always think about things which people know are very good.
philippians-4-8.korean: 끝으로 형제들아 무엇에든지 참되며 무엇에든지 경건하며 무엇에든지 옳으며 무엇에든지 정결하며 무엇에든지 사랑 받을 만하며 무엇에든지 칭찬 받을 만하며 무슨 덕이 있든지 무슨 기림이 있든지 이것들을 생각하라

2-corinthians-2-15.text: When we tell people about Christ, we are like a lovely smell that rises up to God. We are like that among the people that God is saving. We are also like that among the people who are dying because they are far from God.
2-corinthians-2-15.korean: 우리는 구원 받는 자들에게나 망하는 자들에게나 하나님 앞에서 그리스도의 향기니

luke-20-27.text: Then some of the Sadducees came to see Jesus. The Sadducees do not believe that anyone becomes alive again after they die.
luke-20-27.korean: 부활이 없다고 주장하는 사두개인 중 어떤 이들이 와서

matthew-22-29.text: Jesus said to the Sadducees, ‘You are wrong. This is because you do not know the Bible. And you do not know how powerful God is.
matthew-22-29.korean: 예수께서 대답하여 이르시되 너희가 성경도, 하나님의 능력도 알지 못하는 고로 오해하였도다

mark-12-24.text: Jesus said to the Sadducees, ‘You are very wrong. This is because you do not know the Bible. And you do not know how powerful God is.
mark-12-24.korean: 예수께서 이르시되 너희가 성경도 하나님의 능력도 알지 못하므로 오해함이 아니냐

acts-5-17.text: People liked the apostles very much. So the most important priest and his friends who belonged to the Sadducees' group were very jealous.
acts-5-17.korean: 대제사장과 그와 함께 있는 사람 즉 사두개인의 당파가 다 마음에 시기가 가득하여 일어나서

acts-23-7.text: As soon as Paul said that, the Pharisees and Sadducees began to argue with each other. People in the group thought different things about Paul.
acts-23-7.korean: 그 말을 한즉 바리새인과 사두개인 사이에 다툼이 생겨 무리가 나누어지니

romans-7-14.text: We understand that God's Law is spiritual. But I am weak and human. I am like a slave that has sin as my master.
romans-7-14.korean: 우리가 율법은 신령한 줄 알거니와 나는 육신에 속하여 죄 아래에 팔렸도다

1-corinthians-15-46.text: The spiritual body does not come first. No, what is human comes first. Then, after that, what is spiritual comes.
1-corinthians-15-46.korean: 그러나 먼저는 신령한 사람이 아니요 육의 사람이요 그 다음에 신령한 사람이니라

ephesians-3-10.text: But now God wants the people of his church to show everyone how wise he is in every way. He wants the spiritual rulers and everything that has authority in the heavens to know this.
ephesians-3-10.korean: 이는 이제 교회로 말미암아 하늘에 있는 통치자들과 권세들에게 하나님의 각종 지혜를 알게 하려 하심이니

1-corinthians-10-4.text: All of them drank the same spiritual drink. They drank water from the spiritual rock that went with them. Christ was that rock.
1-corinthians-10-4.korean: 다 같은 신령한 음료를 마셨으니 이는 그들을 따르는 신령한 반석으로부터 마셨으매 그 반석은 곧 그리스도시라

1-corinthians-1-7.text: As a result, God has given you every spiritual gift that you need. God has blessed you with those gifts as you wait for our Lord Jesus Christ to return.
1-corinthians-1-7.korean: 너희가 모든 은사에 부족함이 없이 우리 주 예수 그리스도의 나타나심을 기다림이라

exodus-5-11.text: You must try to find straw for yourselves. But you will still have to make the same number of bricks.” ’
exodus-5-11.korean: 너희는 짚을 찾을 곳으로 가서 주우라 그러나 너희 일은 조금도 감하지 아니하리라 하셨느니라

ezekiel-4-1.text: ‘Son of man, take a large brick and put it in front of you. On the brick, draw a picture of the city, Jerusalem.
ezekiel-4-1.korean: 너 인자야 토판을 가져다가 그것을 네 앞에 놓고 한 성읍 곧 예루살렘을 그 위에 그리고

isaiah-9-10.text: ‘We built houses with bricks and they fell down. But we will build them again with strong stones. People have cut down our fig trees, but we will plant great cedar trees instead.’
isaiah-9-10.korean: 벽돌이 무너졌으나 우리는 다듬은 돌로 쌓고 뽕나무들이 찍혔으나 우리는 백향목으로 그것을 대신하리라 하는도다

genesis-11-3.text: They said to each other, ‘We should make bricks and cook them until they are hard.’ These people used bricks instead of stones to build houses. They used tar to hold the bricks together, instead of cement.
genesis-11-3.korean: 서로 말하되 자, 벽돌을 만들어 견고히 굽자 하고 이에 벽돌로 돌을 대신하며 역청으로 진흙을 대신하고

2-samuel-12-31.text: He brought the people out from the city to do hard work for him. He made them cut wood with saws, and use iron tools and axes. He also made them work at the brick ovens. He did the same thing to the people of all the other Ammonite cities.
2-samuel-12-31.korean: 그 안에 있는 백성들을 끌어내어 톱질과 써레질과 철도끼질과 벽돌구이를 그들에게 하게 하니라 암몬 자손의 모든 성읍을 이같이 하고 다윗과 모든 백성이 예루살렘으로 돌아가니라

2-kings-25-15.text: Nebuzaradan also took away the baskets that carried hot coals and the bowls for water. He took away everything that was made from gold or silver.
2-kings-25-15.korean: 시위대장이 또 불 옮기는 그릇들과 주발들 곧 금으로 만든 것이나 은으로 만든 것이나 모두 가져갔으며

isaiah-6-7.text: He touched my mouth with the piece of coal. He said to me, ‘Look! This has touched your lips. It has taken away your sin. You are no longer guilty.’
isaiah-6-7.korean: 그것을 내 입술에 대며 이르되 보라 이것이 네 입에 닿았으니 네 악이 제하여졌고 네 죄가 사하여졌느니라 하더라

proverbs-6-28.text: You cannot walk over hot pieces of coal and not burn your feet. You cannot walk over hot pieces of coal and not burn your feet. You cannot walk over hot pieces of coal and not burn your feet.
proverbs-6-28.korean: 사람이 숯불을 밟고서야 어찌 그의 발이 데지 아니하겠느냐

jeremiah-52-19.text: Captain Nebuzaradan also took away everything that was made from gold or silver. He took the dishes, the baskets that carried hot coals, the bowls for water, the pots, the lampstands and other bowls.
jeremiah-52-19.korean: 사령관은 잔들과 화로들과 주발들과 솥들과 촛대들과 숟가락들과 바리들 곧 금으로 만든 물건의 금과 은으로 만든 물건의 은을 가져갔더라

ezekiel-10-6.text: The Lord gave a command to the man who was wearing linen clothes. He said, ‘Go in among the cherubs. Take coals of fire from between the wheels.’ So the man went in and he stood beside one of the wheels.
ezekiel-10-6.korean: 하나님이 가는 베 옷을 입은 자에게 명령하시기를 바퀴 사이 곧 그룹들 사이에서 불을 가져 가라 하셨으므로 그가 들어가 바퀴 옆에 서매

1-corinthians-15-9.text: Among all the apostles, I am the least important. I caused so much trouble for God's church that people should not really call me an apostle.
1-corinthians-15-9.korean: 나는 사도 중에 가장 작은 자라 나는 하나님의 교회를 박해하였으므로 사도라 칭함 받기를 감당하지 못할 자니라

matthew-19-30.text: But many people who are very important now will become the least important. And many people who are not important now will become very important then.’
matthew-19-30.korean: 그러나 먼저 된 자로서 나중 되고 나중 된 자로서 먼저 될 자가 많으니라

ezekiel-29-15.text: Egypt will be the least important of all kingdoms. It will never again have power over other nations. I will make it too weak to rule over other nations.
ezekiel-29-15.korean: 나라 가운데에 지극히 미약한 나라가 되어 다시는 나라들 위에 스스로 높이지 못하리니 내가 그들을 감하여 다시는 나라들을 다스리지 못하게 할 것임이라

luke-22-26.text: You must not be like that. The most important person among you must become like the least important person. The person who is your leader must become like your servant.
luke-22-26.korean: 너희는 그렇지 않을지니 너희 중에 큰 자는 젊은 자와 같고 다스리는 자는 섬기는 자와 같을지니라

numbers-11-32.text: The people were picking up the birds all day and all night and all the next day. Each person got at least 220 litres of birds. They put their dead bodies on the ground everywhere round the camp.
numbers-11-32.korean: 백성이 일어나 그 날 종일 종야와 그 이튿날 종일토록 메추라기를 모으니 적게 모은 자도 열 호멜이라 그들이 자기들을 위하여 진영 사면에 펴 두었더라

jeremiah-30-13.text: There is no one who will speak on your behalf. There is no medicine that can make you well. There is no one who will speak on your behalf.
jeremiah-30-13.korean: 네 송사를 처리할 재판관이 없고 네 상처에는 약도 없고 처방도 없도다

ezekiel-27-17.text: Traders came to you from Judah and Israel. They paid you with wheat from Minnith, with figs, with honey, with olive oil and with medicine. Traders came to you from Judah and Israel. They paid you with wheat from Minnith, with figs, with honey, with olive oil and with medicine.
ezekiel-27-17.korean: 유다와 이스라엘 땅 사람이 네 상인이 되었음이여 민닛 밀과 과자와 꿀과 기름과 유향을 네 물품과 바꾸어 갔도다

genesis-37-25.text: Then the brothers sat down to eat their meal. They looked up and they saw a group of Ishmaelites coming towards them. They were coming from Gilead region. They were riding on camels that carried spices, and different kinds of oils for medicine. They were taking them to sell in Egypt.
genesis-37-25.korean: 그들이 앉아 음식을 먹다가 눈을 들어 본즉 한 무리의 이스마엘 사람들이 길르앗에서 오는데 그 낙타들에 향품과 유향과 몰약을 싣고 애굽으로 내려가는지라

jeremiah-31-4.text: My special people of Israel, I will make you strong again. You will be so happy that you dance, as people make music with tambourines. My special people of Israel,
jeremiah-31-4.korean: 처녀 이스라엘아 내가 다시 너를 세우리니 네가 세움을 입을 것이요 네가 다시 소고를 들고 즐거워하는 자들과 함께 춤추며 나오리라

2-samuel-6-5.text: David and all Israel's people were singing and dancing with all their strength to praise the Lord. They made music with harps, lyres, tambourines, shakers and cymbals.
2-samuel-6-5.korean: 다윗과 이스라엘 온 족속은 잣나무로 만든 여러 가지 악기와 수금과 비파와 소고와 양금과 제금으로 여호와 앞에서 연주하더라

judges-11-34.text: After that, Jephthah returned to his home in Mizpah. As he arrived, his daughter came out to meet him. She was dancing and making music with a tambourine. She was Jephthah's only child. He had no other son or daughter.
judges-11-34.korean: 입다가 미스바에 있는 자기 집에 이를 때에 보라 그의 딸이 소고를 잡고 춤추며 나와서 영접하니 이는 그의 무남독녀라

isaiah-5-12.text: You have wild parties with plenty of music and wine. You make music with your lyres, harps, tambourines and flutes. But you do not understand the things that the Lord is doing. You do not see the things that he has made.
isaiah-5-12.korean: 그들이 연회에는 수금과 비파와 소고와 피리와 포도주를 갖추었어도 여호와께서 행하시는 일에 관심을 두지 아니하며 그의 손으로 하신 일을 보지 아니하는도다

1-samuel-18-6.text: After David had killed the Philistine, Goliath, he and the soldiers returned to their homes. Women came out from all the towns in Israel to meet King Saul. The women were happy as they sang songs and they danced. They made music with tambourines and lyres.
1-samuel-18-6.korean: 무리가 돌아올 때 곧 다윗이 블레셋 사람을 죽이고 돌아올 때에 여인들이 이스라엘 모든 성읍에서 나와서 노래하며 춤추며 소고와 경쇠를 가지고 왕 사울을 환영하는데

zephaniah-2-6.text: By the sea, there will be houses for people who feed sheep.
zephaniah-2-6.korean: 해변은 풀밭이 되어 목자의 움막과 양 떼의 우리가 거기에 있을 것이며

1-kings-17-4.text: You will drink water from the stream. I have also commanded the ravens to feed you there.’
1-kings-17-4.korean: 그 시냇물을 마시라 내가 까마귀들에게 명령하여 거기서 너를 먹이게 하리라

2-samuel-13-10.text: Then Amnon said to Tamar, ‘Bring the food here into my bedroom. Then you can use your own hand to feed me.’
2-samuel-13-10.korean: 암논이 다말에게 이르되 음식물을 가지고 침실로 들어오라 내가 네 손에서 먹으리라 하니 다말이 자기가 만든 과자를 가지고 침실에 들어가 그의 오라버니 암논에게 이르러

leviticus-25-37.text: The person who is feeding the man might give money or food to him. He must not ask for more back than he gave.
leviticus-25-37.korean: 너는 그에게 이자를 위하여 돈을 꾸어 주지 말고 이익을 위하여 네 양식을 꾸어 주지 말라

mark-8-4.text: The disciples replied, ‘This place is far from any houses. We cannot get enough bread to feed all these people.’
mark-8-4.korean: 제자들이 대답하되 이 광야 어디서 떡을 얻어 이 사람들로 배부르게 할 수 있으리이까

deuteronomy-14-19.text: Some insects have wings but they walk on the ground. Insects like that are unclean food for you. You must not eat them.
deuteronomy-14-19.korean: 또 날기도 하고 기어다니기도 하는 것은 너희에게 부정하니 너희는 먹지 말 것이나

matthew-6-20.text: Instead, you should want to have valuable things in heaven. Insects and water cannot destroy anything there. Men cannot rob you of your things there.
matthew-6-20.korean: 오직 너희를 위하여 보물을 하늘에 쌓아 두라 거기는 좀이나 동록이 해하지 못하며 도둑이 구멍을 뚫지도 못하고 도둑질도 못하느니라

luke-10-19.text: Listen! I have given power to you. You will even stand on dangerous snakes and insects and you will have authority over all the power of the Devil. Nothing will hurt you.
luke-10-19.korean: 내가 너희에게 뱀과 전갈을 밟으며 원수의 모든 능력을 제어할 권능을 주었으니 너희를 해칠 자가 결코 없으리라

leviticus-5-2.text: God has said that some animals and insects are not clean. A person may touch a dead animal or an insect like that. If he does, he is doing something wrong. It is a sin even if he did not really want to touch it.
leviticus-5-2.korean: 만일 누구든지 부정한 것들 곧 들짐승의 사체나 부정한 가축의 사체나 부정한 곤충의 사체를 만졌으면 부지중이라고 할지라도 그 몸이 더러워져서 허물이 있을 것이요

1-kings-4-33.text: He could describe many plants. These included large trees like cedar trees that grow in Lebanon and small plants like hyssop that grows on walls. He also taught people about all kinds of animals, birds, insects and fish.
1-kings-4-33.korean: 그가 또 초목에 대하여 말하되 레바논의 백향목으로부터 담에 나는 우슬초까지 하고 그가 또 짐승과 새와 기어다니는 것과 물고기에 대하여 말한지라

leviticus-14-55.text: These are the rules for mildew in clothes or in a house.

leviticus-13-57.text: If the mildew comes back to the clothes, the people must burn them.
leviticus-13-57.korean: 그 의복의 날에나 씨에나 가죽으로 만든 모든 것에 색점이 여전히 보이면 재발하는 것이니 너는 그 색점 있는 것을 불사를지니라

leviticus-14-43.text: A person might find mildew on the wall that he has mended. He must tell the priest.
leviticus-14-43.korean: 돌을 빼내며 집을 긁고 고쳐 바른 후에 색점이 집에 재발하면

leviticus-14-44.text: The priest will look at the house. If the mildew is on more of the mended wall, the house is not clean.
leviticus-14-44.korean: 제사장은 또 가서 살펴볼 것이요 그 색점이 만일 집에 퍼졌으면 악성 나병인즉 이는 부정하니

leviticus-13-50.text: The priest must look at the mildew. And he must keep the clothes separate from other clothes for seven days.
leviticus-13-50.korean: 제사장은 그 색점을 진찰하고 그것을 이레 동안 간직하였다가

1-kings-11-27.text: This is what happened: Solomon had built the Millo. He had also mended the walls of the City of David his father.
1-kings-11-27.korean: 그가 손을 들어 왕을 대적하는 까닭은 이러하니라 솔로몬이 밀로를 건축하고 그의 아버지 다윗의 성읍이 무너진 것을 수축하였는데

leviticus-14-48.text: If a person mends his house, the priest must look at it. There may not be any mildew. The priest will then say that it is clean.
leviticus-14-48.korean: 그 집을 고쳐 바른 후에 제사장이 들어가 살펴보아서 색점이 집에 퍼지지 아니하였으면 이는 색점이 나은 것이니 제사장은 그 집을 정하다 하고

2-kings-12-5.text: Each priest should receive the money that he needs to make repairs to the temple. When he sees that something is broken, he can use some of the people's money to mend it.’
2-kings-12-5.korean: 제사장들이 각각 아는 자에게서 받아들여 성전의 어느 곳이든지 파손된 것을 보거든 그것으로 수리하라 하였으나

matthew-9-16.text: Then Jesus said, ‘Nobody uses a piece of new cloth to mend an old coat. If he does, the new cloth will cause the old cloth to tear again. It will make a bigger hole than before.
matthew-9-16.korean: 생베 조각을 낡은 옷에 붙이는 자가 없나니 이는 기운 것이 그 옷을 당기어 해어짐이 더하게 됨이요

ezekiel-13-5.text: They have not helped you to mend the broken walls of your city. The walls will not be strong enough to keep Israel's people safe on the day of the Lord. That is when I will allow your enemies to attack you.
ezekiel-13-5.korean: 너희 선지자들이 성 무너진 곳에 올라가지도 아니하였으며 이스라엘 족속을 위하여 여호와의 날에 전쟁에서 견디게 하려고 성벽을 수축하지도 아니하였느니라

numbers-13-25.text: The men returned after they had explored the land for 40 days.
numbers-13-25.korean: 사십 일 동안 땅을 정탐하기를 마치고 돌아와

deuteronomy-1-24.text: They left and went up into the hill country. They came to Eshcol valley and they explored it.
deuteronomy-1-24.korean: 그들이 돌이켜 산지에 올라 에스골 골짜기에 이르러 그 곳을 정탐하고

joshua-14-7.text: I was 40 years old when Moses sent me from there to explore the land of Canaan. I brought back to him a true report. I was sure that we could take the land.
joshua-14-7.korean: 내 나이 사십 세에 여호와의 종 모세가 가데스 바네아에서 나를 보내어 이 땅을 정탐하게 하였으므로 내가 성실한 마음으로 그에게 보고하였고

judges-18-2.text: So the men of Dan sent five soldiers from the clans of their tribe to explore the land. The leaders sent them out from Zorah and Eshtaol. They told them, ‘Go and find some land for us.’
judges-18-2.korean: 단 자손이 소라와 에스다올에서부터 그들의 가족 가운데 용맹스런 다섯 사람을 보내어 땅을 정탐하고 살피게 하며 그들에게 이르되 너희는 가서 땅을 살펴보라 하매 그들이 에브라임 산지에 가서 미가의 집에 이르러 거기서 유숙하니라

numbers-14-7.text: Joshua and Caleb said to all the Israelites, ‘The land that we travelled through to explore is a very good land.
numbers-14-7.korean: 이스라엘 자손의 온 회중에게 말하여 이르되 우리가 두루 다니며 정탐한 땅은 심히 아름다운 땅이라

2-samuel-3-11.text: Ish-Bosheth was so afraid of Abner that he could not say anything.
2-samuel-3-11.korean: 이스보셋이 아브넬을 두려워하여 감히 한 마디도 대답하지 못하니라

2-samuel-3-15.text: So Ish-Bosheth sent his men to take Michal from her husband, Paltiel, son of Laish.
2-samuel-3-15.korean: 이스보셋이 사람을 보내 그의 남편 라이스의 아들 발디엘에게서 그를 빼앗아 오매

2-samuel-2-8.text: Ner's son Abner was the leader of Saul's army. He took Saul's son Ish-Bosheth to Mahanaim.
2-samuel-2-8.korean: 사울의 군사령관 넬의 아들 아브넬이 이미 사울의 아들 이스보셋을 데리고 마하나임으로 건너가

2-samuel-3-14.text: Then David sent men to Saul's son, Ish-Bosheth, with this message: ‘Give back to me my wife, Michal. I paid
2-samuel-3-14.korean: 다윗이 사울의 아들 이스보셋에게 전령들을 보내 이르되 내 처 미갈을 내게로 돌리라 그는 내가 전에 블레셋 사람의 포피 백 개로 나와 정혼한 자니라 하니

2-samuel-2-12.text: Then Ner's son, Abner, left Mahanaim and he went to Gibeon. He took with him the men who served Saul's son, Ish-Bosheth.
